NOTES: On 28 March 2020, throughout Antigua and Barbuda a state of emergency was declared and a curfew was imposed to prevent the spread of coronavirus.

On 15 January 2018, a home-made explosive planted by unidentified armed actors against Security Minister Patricia Bullrich and judge Claudio Bonadio in Buenos Aires city (Buenos Aires, Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires) was safely defused by the police forces.
Property destruction: On 9 July 2018, in Pergamino, Buenos Aires, a group of unknown men set fire to two parked buses. Motivations of the attack are not known.

On 6 September 2018, in Comodoro Rivadavia, Chubut, a 61 millimeter mortar and fuse of an active explosive was found in Restinga neighbourhood by residents. The police arrived at the scene and an explosive expert detonated the bomb on site.

On 20 September 2018, police officers defused an explosive device that was found between the neighborhood Rosedal and Los Naranjos in Cordoba. According to police, the device was incomplete but it could have caused important damages. The location of the device could be interpreted as a threat for people involved in a relevant judiciary case known as Dolto case.

Property destruction: On 8 October 2018, in Buenos Aires (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), the car of an activist was set on fire by unidentified individuals in Belgrano neighbourhood. According to the man, the perpetrators were pro-abortion individuals, with whom he was having online discussions and receiving threats. Authorship is unknown.

Property destruction: On 23 October 2018, in Santa Fe (Santa Fe), a Chinese-owned supermarket was set on fire after unidentified individuals threw Molotov bombs in the establishment in the Presidente Roca y Arijon avenue. According to residents, the attack could have been motivated by a robbery attempt or connected to the Chinese mafia.

Looting: Around 26 October 2018 (as reported), in Colonia Dora, Santiago del Estero, the Community Integration Center (CIC) was depredated by unidentified individuals in Belem neighbourhood. Motivation and authorship are unknown.

Property destruction: On 8 November 2018, near the city of El Bolson, Rio Negro, road construction machinery from a company was set on fire. The perpetrators drew graffiti with references to RAM. No injuries.

Defusal: On 14 November 2018, in Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires, Buenos Aires, a man placed an explosive artifact in the house of a federal judge in Belgrano neighborhood. The suspect was chased after and arrested. He was armed with a knife. The police bomb squad was called and safely defused the artifact. No injuries.

Property destruction: On Nov 16th, in Bariloche machines from the company Hidraco were set on fire by a group of 10 people. Police associated the event to another property destruction where a message was left from the RAM (Resistencia Ancestral Mapuche).

On 29 November 2018, in Buenos Aires, hours before the start of the G20, 3 explosives were found and defused in different places in the city. Some of them were not real. No injuries or explosions were reported.

On 3 December 2018, in Buenos Aires, Ciudad Autonoma, the Argentine Security Ministry approved a law to allow federal security forces to use arms in self-defence, protect someone else of risk to life or injury, prevent crime, against suspects who resist arrest, or to prevent the escape of suspects. The new law allows security forces to use weapons and critics say it goes against the UN Basic Principles.

On 5 December 2018, in General Roca (Rio Negro), the police deactivaded an explosive device left left in Houssay y San Luis street. According to a resident of the area, the device was left by a young man. A note was left, written ''All Mapuche Land to be liberated''.
On 11 January 2019, a general strike across the country began led by workers at the ports what has caused millions of dollars in losses.

Around 23 February 2019 (between 21 February - 23 February), in San Luis, San Luis, nine Jewish tombs were destroyed in the Jewish cemetery. The local Israeli community believes it could be an anti-Semitic attack related to other incidents that have happened in the country.

March 14, 2019. In San Carlos de Bariloche, Fausto Jones Huala brother of the leader and creator of Mapuche Ancestral Resistance RAM, and important member of the group, surrendered to the judge that is investigating the assassination of a Mapuche indigenous man during an armed clash in 2017. Huala was a fugitive since May, 2018.

As reported on August 20, 2019, unidentified perpetrators attacked the private residence of the governor of Chubut province in Trelew, Chubut. Several gunshots impacted the private car of the politician parked in fron of the door. No arrests were reported.

On 29 August 2019, in La Plata, Buenos Aires province, unidentified perpetrators vandalized the building facilities of a local workers unions. Workers of the organization found several shotguns and threatening graffitis.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: APDH: Permanent Assembly for Human Rights
NOTES: On 3 November 2019, in San Justo (Buenos Aires), the headquarters of the Permanent Assembly for Human Rights (APDH) in La Matanza was intentionally burned down. It was reported that the APDH received threats but there are no suspects.

On 3 November 2019, in Roldan (Santa Fe), the car of the Finances seceretary of the Federation of Municipal Workers 'Unions (Festram) and current General Secretary of the Municipal Workers' Union of Roldan and Adhered Communes (Sitram) was set on fire. There were no suspects but the trade unions believed the attack was connected with the dismissals of workers in Commune of Maciel.

On 25 November 2019, in Trelew (Chubut), two cars in different parts of the city were set on fire. The residents helped to put out the fire, so the cars would not be completely destroyed. It was reported that the owner of one of the cars might be a relative of a person who is arrested for murder and it might be the motivation for this action.
On 4 December 2019, in Rosario (Santa Fe), the pickup truck of the United Maritime Trade Union (Somu) was burned by a group who was in a car. The motivation of the attack is unknown.
On 9 December 2019, in Tolosa (Buenos Aires), a police car was set on fire in front of the 6th Police Station of Tolosa. There are no suspects.

On 10 December 2019, in Buenos Aires (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), Alberto Fernandez and Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner, both of PJ (Justicialist Party), took over the presidency and vice-presidency of the country in the Congress.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: ATE: Association of State Workers; Labour Group (Argentina)
NOTES: As reported on 29 January 2020, in Pergamino (Buenos Aires), the ATE (Association of State Workers) headquarters were disorganized, partially destroyed and looted. The group took 200 ARS and an electric kettle. The Secretary-General believed the attack was political, with the aim to intimidate the Commission.

As reported on 20 February 2020, in the indigenous mapuche community Nehuentuain Inchin de Costa del Lepa, 45 kilometers away of Esquel (Chubut), an Italian farmer blocked the road and access to the mapuche community. This action made the group isolated, with scarce food. This action took place one week after signing the agreement to create a 'Table for Alternative Resolution of Territorial Conflicts with Native Peoples', in order to find peaceful and consensual solutions.

On 18 March 2020, in Claromeco (Buenos Aires), self-convened merchants and residents gathered in the city's entrance in order to control the entry of vehicles that will be in quarantine in the city. The main goal of this measure was to prevent the spread of coronavirus, that was considered pandemic by the World Health Organization.

On 19 March 2020, in Pinamar (Buenos Aires), self-convened residents blocked route 11 in order to control the entry of vehicles that will be in quarantine the city and only let residents get in. The main goal of this measure was to prevent the spread of coronavirus, that was considered pandemic by the World Health Organization.

On 20 March 2020, in Puerto Deseado (Santa Cruz), in the early hours, a petrol bomb and rocks were thrown at the Court of Misdemeanors, hitting a judge's office. The identity and number of perpetrators, as well as their motivation, are unknown.

On 7 May 2020, in Rosario (Santa Fe), the police invaded several houses of members of indigenous Qom (Toba) community in La Cava neighborhood, took some belongings, money and threatened them with their guns. The motivation of the police's action is unknown.
On 28 June 2020, in San Luis (San Luis), the LGBT flag that was placed in front of the City Council was burned on the International LGBT Pride Day. There is no information about perpetrators.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Argentina (2019-); PJ: Justicialist Party
NOTES: On 9 September 2020, in Vicente Lopez (Buenos Aires), one man threw a petrol bomb against one of the Presidential House's walls. The suspect was detained and his motivations are unknown.

On 10 December 2020, in Las Heras (Santa Cruz), after municipal workers, who have been demonstrating to demand a salary raise, met the Mayor and agreed to suspend the demonstration, a car was set on fire near the building that those who chose to remain demonstrating were occupying. The group believed the perpetrators were linked to the Mayor.

Property destruction: On 9 March 2021, in San Luis (San Luis), during the early hours, a group called Brigada mata progreso (Kill Progress Brigade) painted homophobic and anti-Semitic sentences on the benches that have the pride flags in Pringles square and in Casa Azul (LGBT space), besides breaking its windows and setting fire to International Woman's Day's posters.

Property destruction: On 19 April 2021, in Andalgala (Catamarca), a group attacked and damaged the car of a Club's President, besides spilling excrement in it. It is believed that it was an attack perpetrated by anti-mining groups, who were aware of his position in favor of the mining project.

Property destruction: On 3 October 2021, in San Carlos de Bariloche (Rio Negro), around three hooded people, who claimed to be Mapuche indigenous people, broke into the provincial road's camp, set fire to the warehouse, and road machines, besides handcuffing the watchman and his wife. The group left flyers and messages that supported the Mapuche's struggle to get back their ancestral lands in the Patagonia area.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: JxC: Together for Change; PRO: Republican Proposal
NOTES: Property destruction: On 16 October 2021, around Salta municipality (Salta), stones were thrown at the house of a Together for Change's Congressman during the early hours. The Congressman, who is affiliated with the Republican Proposal (PRO) party, had his glass door broken in the attack. The motivation of the crime and its perpetrators are unknown.

Property destruction: On 20 October 2021, in El Bolson (Rio Negro), the Andean Club Piltriquitron was set on fire in the early hours, while flyers against the sale of water and lands were left around the place. The flyers had messages against the Mayor, the Governor, and a businessman. The attack was believed to be perpetrated by Mapuche indigenous groups, who carried out a similar event on 3 October. There is an ongoing conflict of the Mapuche people with the government and businessmen.

Property destruction: Around 17 November 2021 (week of), in Bahia Blanca (Buenos Aires), members of the National Restoration Command (CRN) threw a petrol bomb at the woman leader of the Ruka Kimun Mapuche indigenous group. Weeks later, pamphlets with death threats to her and the community were found in the San Cayetano neighborhood with the far-right group CRN's signature.

SOURCE: El Comercial; Diario Cronica (Argentina); Diario De Cuyo
NOTES: Property destruction: On 22 November 2021, in Buenos Aires (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), nine hooded people threw around seven petrol bombs at the Clarin newspaper's headquarters in Piedras Street and fled. The case, which was classified as public intimidation by a judge, had anarchists as main suspects, with one of them arrested on 26 November.

Property destruction: Around 24 November 2021, in Villa Mascardi (Rio Negro), hooded Mapuche indigenous people from the Winkul Lafken Mapu community threw stones against the car of National Park's workers, damaging part of the cars. The attack took place during an increasing conflict between Mapuche people, civilians, the police, and the provincial government.

On 20 March 2020, throughout the Bahamas a curfew was imposed to prevent spread of the coronavirus. On 27 March 2020 the borders of the Bahamas were closed to all incoming visitors including citizens.

On 25 September 2021, of the coast of Inagua district, police officers arrested 50 Haitian migrants in a sloop.

On 22 November 2021, in Nassau, New Providence, police arrested 32 people, including seven Bahamians, nine Cubans, eight Colombians, two Romanians, and six Jamaicans, who were in five vessels at a dock on West Bay Street. The operation is believed to be human trafficking (unspecified).

Elections/referendum: On 20 October 2021, in Bridgetown, Saint Michael, Governor General Dame Sandra was named the first president-elect of the country. A secret ballot was held in the legislature where the elections were held. This step is part of the country's transition process from the British monarchy to a Republic.

Other: On 30 November 2021, in Bridgetown, Saint Michael, Barbados officially transitioned from a Commonwealth state to a Republic. During the ceremony, the first president of Barbados Sandra Mason took office.

The commander of the Military Forces and the commander of the National Police asked the president to end the political and social crisis.

On 12 November 2019, in La Paz city, Jeanine Anez assumed the presidency of Bolivia after the resignation made on November 10 2019 of Evo Morales from the presidency. After the president and first vice-president of congress resigned as well, she took control of the Senate and then she became the internal president. She was previously senator of BENI. There is a time limit of 90 days to implement a new election and a new government for transition.

They were responsible for calling the November 2021 protests in the country, which is why opposition groups report the arrests were arbitrary detentions intended to target those opposed to the left-wing MAS government.

On 24 April 2018, in Campo Grande, Mato Grosso do Sul, a house was set on fire in Vila Jacy. The house was used to store recyclable materials and tools, and used as a garage by other neighbours. It is believed that the fire was criminal. Another house was hit by the flames. No reports on injured.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: PT: Workers' Party; PSDB: Brazilian Social Democratic Party; NOVO: New Party; REDE: Sustainability Network; PPS: Popular Socialist Party; PV: Green Party; PSOL: Socialism and Liberty Party; PDT: Democratic Labour Party
NOTES: Other: On 13 June 2018, in Sao Paulo, Sao Paulo, political parties that usually diverge from other have united in launching a pact in defense of democracy in Brazil. Representatives of at least eight political parties participated in the presentation event: PT, PSDB, NOVO, REDE, PPS, PV, PSOL, and PDT. The text for of the Pact for Democracy reads, 'Brazil is living a decisive moment' and that 'it has rarely been so difficult to affirm pluralism, tolerance, and coexistence with difference in the public space.' The proposal is to overcome differences in order to combat the erosion of institutions and to fight for equal rights and respect for diversity. The initiative commenced from more than 60 civil society organizations and movements, such as Ethos, Igarape, Alana, and Sou da Paz institutes. Furthermore, groups that preach political renewal, such as Agora!, Acredito, RenovaBR, Network for Political Action for Sustainability (RAPS, Rede de Acao Politica pela Sustentabilidade), Bancada Ativista, Frente Favela Brasil, and Nova Democracia also joined the coalition.

The wave of attacks in the state of Ceara started after the new secretary of Penitentiary Administration stated that he did not recognize criminal factions in the state of Ceara. According to ongoing investigations, criminal factions operating in Ceara - First Capital Command, Red Command, and Guardians of the State - would have joined forces to retaliate the statements made by the newly-installed state penitentiary secretary.

On 3 June 2019, in Minas Gerais state, it was reported 64 attacks on buses in 37 cities, commanded by PCC (First Capital Command), besides attempts to burn two city councils and shots against the police station of Cruzilia. A note found at the scene says the oppression in Minas Gerais and Rio Grande do Norte's prisons are the reason for the attack. Most attacks happened in the south of the state. The police believes these crimes are related to the 'nationalization' of PCC. Sao Paulo's D.A. Office is investigating whether the leaders were ordering the attack from within prison. ACTOR1: CIPN: Command of the Popular Nationalist Insurgency
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Catholic Christian Group (Brazil); PSL: Social Liberal Party
SOURCE: Ponte Jornalismo; Globo Extra; Agencia Brasil
NOTES: On 24 Dec 2019, in the South Zone of Rio de Janeiro, the headquarters of the audio-visual production company Porta dos Fundos in Humaita was attacked with two Molotov cocktails. A security guard of the building prevented the spread of flames and no injuries were reported. A group called Command of the Popular Nationalist Insurgency, which claims to be connected to the Integralist Family of Brazil, released a video claiming responsibility for the attack. They declared that the reason for the attack was the online broadcast by a streaming service of a Christmas TV special produced by Porta dos Fundos in which Jesus was depicted as a homosexual. The Brazilian Integralist Front (FIB) claimed to have no involvement in the episode. The Police identified one of the responsible for the attack, who is affiliated to the PSL. The man fled to Russia and declared he is planning to seek asylum in that country.

On 17 Jan 2020, the National Special Secretary of Culture resigned from his position and was later dismissed by the President of Brazil. A day before, the government official had released a video announcing a National Cultural Contest in which he used a similar text and setting as previously used by Joseph Goebbels, Ministry of Propaganda of Nazi Germany. His dismissal was requested by different leaders of the government and of the civil society.

On 19 January 2020, in Pedro Juan Caballero (Amambay), 76 prisoners, most of them members of PCC (First Capital Command), escaped from prison through a tunnel. Because of the suspect that prison workers helped or that they were aware of the escape, since one of the gates was unlocked and it was quite difficult to not see that the prisoners were moving to another place, 28 prison guards, directors and chiefs of the penitentiary were detained and taken to the Investigation headquarters. On 22 January 2020, one of the prisoners who escaped through the tunnel, handed himself to the police and told them that the heads of the PCC got out through the front door and later he denied his statement. By 25 January 2020, seven people were recaptured.

On 19 January 2020, in Ponta Pora, Mato Grosso do Sul, the Brazil-Paraguay border was closed at the request of the Brazilian Ministry of Justice and Public Security, after 75 detainees, mostly PCC members, escaped a Paraguayan detainment facility.
On 20 January 2020, in several cities of Parana, the border was closed at the request of the state Governor, after 75 detainees, mostly PCC members, escaped a Paraguayan detainment facility.

NOTES: Property destruction: On 8 December 2021, in Itaituba (Para), four suspects set a military police station on fire. The attack happened near a mining site. Three perpetrators were identified, but not arrested.
On 26 February 2018, in Santa Cruz, Corozal district, police forces seized an illegal airplane used for drug trafficking.
On 26 February 2018, in rural area of Orange Walk district, police forces seized an illegal airplane strip used for drug trafficking. The plane was found burnt.

On 24 April 2018, in San Estevan, Orange Walk district, police forces found and seized a clandestine airplane that landed on the San Estevan/Progresso Road. The airplane had signs of a burning attempt and of having been used to transport drugs.

Around 19 June 2018, in Otoxcha village, Toledo, Military Forces of Belize started patrolling to prevent incursions from Guatemala. Since April Guatemalan farmers have been making aggressive incursions into Belize to clear lands to make plantations. The Guatemalans farmers also have threatened the population.

On 4 September 2018, in Belize City, Belize, 100 gang members from Ghost Town Gang and George Street Gaza Gang were arrested by military forces under the State of Public Emergency declared by the government the day before to control gang violence in Southside Belize.

On 5 September 2018, in Belize City, the Governor General of Belize declared the State of Emergency in the Southside of the city. The State of Emergency have been declared in order to control an increase of violence between gangs in two areas of the Southside.

On 9 September 2018, in Blue Creek, Orange Walk district, Police and military forces seized a drug airplane with a cocaine cargo valued in US 7 million. Five people were arrested, including two police officers and two Mexican citizens.
On 3 October 2018, in Belize City, 64 prisoners, allegedly gang members, were released after 30 days of imprisonment permitted by the State of Emergency implemented in two areas of the city.

On 20 December 2018, three miles away from Barranco Village, Toledo District, police forces found and seized a clandestine airplane used for drug trafficking. The police arrested three police officers and a civilian who were caught in the area transporting gasoline and an airplane seat. No cargo was found in the plane.
On 30 September 2019, in Blue Creek, Orange Walk District, Police Forces of Belize seized an airplane that crash landed with drugs. No arrests were reported.

On 21 October 2019, in Orange Walk district, National Security Forces of Belize seized an airplane that was used to transport drugs. The plane was left behind by their crew, and the cargo was taken away before the authorities arrived.
On 6 December 2019, in Corozal District, an airstrip and a burnt narco plane were seized by the police.
On 16 December 2019, in Sarteneja, Corozal District, Police Forces of Belize seized a burnt airplane that landed in an airstrip.

On 22 January 2020, in rural area of Belize district, police seized an airplane transporting drugs. The airplane was on its way from Venezuela to Mexico, but landed in Belize because Mexican authorities were aware of the flight. The traffickers managed to take away the cargo and disappear.
On 26 January 2020, in rural area of Toledo District, Police Forces of Belize found and seized a crashed and burnt airplane used to transport drugs.

On 6 February 2020, in the Toledo municipality, Toledo, a destroyed plane suspected to have been used for drug trafficking was found by the Police in the Monkey River area together with magazines and bullets in boxes.

On 27 February 2020, in Belize City, in Highway Belize, Police and Military Forces found and confiscated an airplane with around 2 tons of cocaine. The crew managed to escape. This is the biggest cocaine cargo ever confiscated in Belize history.

On 17 March 2020, in Belize City, the government of Belize declared the State of Emergency to respond to an alarming increase of gang violence. Military and Police Forces were deployed in 8 zones of the city. The security forces will conduct 'comprehensive searches and operations' in those areas. On 9 April the government took additional measures to restrict the operation of construction businesses all around the country. On 17 April a new amendment began, prohibiting children under 16 years to be on the streets after 4:00 p.m.; ordering medical staff to work at one facility only; and allowing utility companies to open their doors on Fridays for payment of bills.

On 18 March 2020, in Belize City, Police forces arrested at least 82 people from 8 zones of the city, during an operation against gang violence. The operation is part of the meassures of the State of Emergency declared after a wave of gang violence during the past days.

On 21 March 2020, in Belize, the government closed the country's borders to prevent coronavirus. Also all bars, clubs, lounges, and casinos countrywide were ordered to close. On 25 March, a curfew was established requiring that children below 16 years to remain indoors from 6:00 p.m. to 6:00 a.m On 26 March the government declared quarantine in the country to control coronavirus pandemic, i.a. restricting the movement of people and the size of public gatherings to 10 persons or less.

On 17 April 2020, in Belize City, gang members signed a peace agreement and handed over 22 guns, including AK-47 assault rifles after a mediation led by the police in a prison. The people involved in the agreement were released from prison, where they were detained as part of a State of Emergency initiative that was launched by Government in March.

On 28 May 2020, in Sarteneja, Corozal District, a crashed airplane was found by police forces that was being tracked from Venezuela to Belize. According to the authorities the airplane had a drug cargo that was not found in it. Two people have been arrested in the course of this investigation.

On 7 July 2020, in Belize City, the government declared the State of Emergency for Southside Belize City, to combat an abrupt increase in crime and violence. Around 300 policemen with the support of military forces conducted an operation were 100 suspected gang members were arrested.
On 10 August 2020, in Belmopan, Cayo district, MS-13 members vandalized the Belmopan Nazarene Church, benches in the park and other structures in the city.
On 21 September 2020, in Santa Martha, Orange Walk District, police forces found and seized a crashed landed airplane used for drug trafficking.

On 2 November 2020, in Bella Vista and Santa Cruz, Belize, the National Oversight Committee of the Government of Belize established a curfew from 8 pm to 5 am, as part of a response to a coronavirus outbreak.
On 12 November 2020, in Belmopan, Belize, the new prime minister John Briceno affiliated to the People's United Party sworn in. The last party victory was in 2003.

On 27 November 2020, in Belize City, Belize, the Minister of Health and Wellness established a curfew from 10 pm to 4:59 am, as part of a response to a coronavirus outbreak. Security personnel and essential workers with a special pass are allowed to move during the pandemic within the scope of their duties.

On 15 December 2020, in Belize City, Belize, the Minister of Health and Wellness established a curfew amid the coronavirus pandemic. The curfew for adults runs from 8 pm to 5 am. The curfew for children runs from 6 pm to 5 am. The estimated end date of the curfew is 2 March 2021.
On 20 January 2021, in Consejo, Corozal, the police found and destroyed 2,500 marijuana plants.

On 29 January 2021, in the outskirts of Crooked Tree, Belize, the Belize police department and the Joint Intelligence Operation center seized a boat in Hill Bank lagoon. According to reports, moments earlier, a plane landed and caught fire and the occupants fled the scene and got into two boats. Police seized one boat and arrested nine men. A total of 2000 pounds of cocaine were seized. Two of the arrested people were police officers.
On 5 February 2021, in Belize City, Belize, the police department burned 2,000 pounds of cocaine.

Property destruction: On 13 May 2021, in the outskirts of Blue Creek, Orange Walk, Police officers and members of the Belizean military forces seized a luxury jet that had landed illegally on Belizean soil. According to reports, after the landing and before Belizean authorities arrived, at least 60 armed individuals unloaded the contents of the plane, likely drugs, and it is believed the illicit cargo was taken to Mexico. Police estimated the plane had storage space of almost two tons. No arrests were made.

Property destruction: On 22 May 2021, off the coast of Placencia, Stann Creek, Police officers and members of the Coast Guard found a suspected narco plane that crash-landed illegally on Belizean soil. Police believed it contained drugs.

Security measures: On 19 August 2021, in Belize City, Belize, the government declared Public Emergency and ordered a 30-day lockdown on the Southside of the city to respond to an alarming increase of gang violence.

SOURCE: GardaWorld; San Pedro Sun; Channel 5 Belize
NOTES: Security measures: On 20 August 2021, in Belize City, Belize, the Minister of Health and Wellness introduced new restrictions to prevent the spread of coronavirus in the country. The measure focuses on establishments within the boundaries of the Belize District, making exceptions for Caye Caulker and San Pedro Town, Ambergris Caye. Restrictions include the prohibition to sell liquor between 6 PM and 4 AM, the immunization of all the casino staff, and the requirement for customers to present their vaccination cards in casinos. On 1 September 2021, the curfew was extended from 9 PM to 6 AM for an additional month. On 23 November 2021, the COVID-19 related restrictions were extended until 15 January 2022, including a shortened curfew and bars, rum shops, and nightclubs must remain closed.

Looting: On 24 November 2021, in a rural area of Santa Cruz, Stann Creek, authorities found a charred suspected drug plane in the Kanantik area. Authorities believe the airplane was burned after it discharged its cargo. The aircraft made an illegal landing on the Kanantik Air Strip, a private airfield.
Security measures: On 28 March 2020, in Cayman Island (coded to George Town), throughout the Cayman Islands a curfew was implemented to prevent the spread of coronavirus.

Property destruction: On 1 January 2018, in San Juan de la Costa (Los Lagos), at least ten unidentified men set fire to machinery under at an agricultural property. Pamphlets supporting the Mapuche cause were found near the place of the event. The same group had carried out the same attack hours before in Rio Negro. The Araucania and Lagos regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

Property destruction: On 1 January 2018, in Rio Negro, Los Lagos, at least ten unidentified men set fire to machinery after firing in the air at an agricultural property. Neither injuries, fatalities, nor arrests were reported. The Araucania and Lagos regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 6 January 2018, in Valdivia (Los Rios), four microbuses were set on fire by unidentified suspects. Officials reported the incident was not related to the Mapuche cause as no pamphlets supporting the cause were found on the site. Investigations were ongoing.

Property destruction: Between 14 and 16 January 2018, in Villa Garcia (Araucania), a group carried out an arson attack against a Catholic chapel in the Rio Negro area. The incident took place during a visit of Pope Francis to the country. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

Property destruction: Between 14 and 16 January 2018, in Cunco (Araucania), a group carried out an arson attack against a Catholic chapel in the Alto Can Can community. The incident took place during Pope Francis' visit to the country. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

Around 17 January 2018 (as reported), in Collipulli (Araucania), rioters carried out arson attacks against a church and a school. The incident took place during the visit of Pope Francis to the country, with the attacks being a demonstration against the pontiff.

Property destruction: Around 17 January 2018 (as reported), in Curanilahue (Biobio), a group carried out an arson attack against three helicopters at an airfield. The incident took place during a visit of Pope Francis to the country. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

Property destruction: On 18 January 2018, in San Pablo (Los Lagos), five machines destined to public work were set on fire by unidentified suspects. No group claimed the attack, and neither evidence of the authorship nor pamphlets were found on the site.

On 20 January 2018, in Panguipulli (Los Rios), a Catholic church was set on fire by unidentified suspects in Calafquen sector in demonstration. The incident took place after the visit of Pope Francis to the country, with people demonstrating against the pontiff, the pedophilia scandals amongst Chilean priests, and the public spending the visit implied for the country. No group claimed the attack and officials discarded the involvement of Mapuche indigenous or residents of the community.

On 22 January 2018, in Santiago, Metropolitana, rioters threw seven firebombs at the Sacred Heart of Jesus church in demonstration. The incident happened a few days after the visit by Pope Francis to the country, with people demonstrating against the pontiff, the pedophilia scandals amongst Chilean priests, and the public spending the visit implied for the country.

Property destruction: On 27 January 2018, in Ercilla (Araucania), at least four hooded armed suspects carried out an arson attack, setting four trucks on fire after threatening the workers. Neither injuries, fatalities, nor arrests were reported. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

Property destruction: On 19 November 2018, on the road that connects Puerto Saavedra and Teodoro Schmidt communes, suspected indigenous militiamen attacked the property of an industrial farmer. Property destruction: On 19 November 2018, in the rural area of Tirua commune, Biobio region, a group of unidentified individuals set on a school building on fire. The event was reported in the wake of several violent events registered following the death of a Mapuche activist killed by police forces.

Property destruction: On 20 November 2018, near Tirua, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set a summer cottage on fire. The event was reported in the wake of several violent events following the death of a Mapuche activist killed by police forces. The house was empty at the moment of the attack.

Property destruction: On 20 November 2018, in Bajo Malleco, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set two public restrooms on fire. Perpetrators left in the area pamphlets demanding justice for the death of a Mapuche activist killed by police forces.

Property destruction: On 21 November 2018, in Victoria, Araucania region, a group of unidentified individuals set a private house on fire. The event was reported in the wake of several violent events registered following the death of a Mapuche activist killed in previous days by police forces. There was not people in the building at the moment of the attack.

Property destruction: On 21 November 2018, in the rural area of Canete municipality, Biobio region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a crane and other equipment from a logging company. Perpetrators threatened the workers before setting the equipment on fire. Pamphlets in support of the Mapuche indigenous community were found in the area.

Property destruction: On 23 November 2018, in Chiguaihue, Araucania region, a group of unidentified individuals set a community center and a private house on fire. The event was reported in the wake of several violent events registered following the death of a Mapuche activist by police officers. Pamphlets demanding justice were found in the area.

Property destruction: On 24 November 2018, Quidico, Araucania region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen set a summer cottage on fire. Witnesses claimed a group of men fired shots to the air before they spread gasoline in the structure before setting the building on fire. The event followed a series of attacks registered in the area over the death of a Mapuche activist killed by police forces. No injuries reported.
Property destruction: On Nov 26th 2018, at the comuna Colipulli, unidentified individuals set fire to agricultural products.

Property destruction: On 29 November 2018, in Macul, Metropolitana, unidentified perpetrators set fire to barricades across the streets in the limit of the commune with san Joaquin. Pamphlets were left in the area and the MJL claimed responsibility for the event. The group demanded social justice for the country.

Property destruction: On 30 November 2018, in the rural area of Canete municipality, Biobio, suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to equipment from an aggregates company. Pamphlets demanding justice over the death of a Mapuche activist, killed during a police operation on 14 November 2018, and the release of Mapuche arrested individuals were found in the area.

Around 8 December 2018 (as reported), in the Araucania region, a specialized police squad known as Comando Jungla was withdrawn from the rural areas of the Araucania region. The decision followed the death of a Mapuche activist killed by officers members of this unit.

Property destruction: On 11 December 2018, in the rural area of Canete municipality, Biobio, suspected indigenous militiamen burned down a truck that worked for a company that produces aggregates. Armed men forced the driver to stop across route P70, between Canete and Tirua, subsequently setting the vehicle on fire. Pamphlets demanding justice over the death of a Mapuche activist were found in the area.

Property destruction: On 13 December 2018, in Lleu Lleu, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set a private house and a barn on fire. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.
Property destruction: On Dec 18th2018, in Arauco Chile, a group of individuals in a car arrived to a private property 'Los Rios' and set on fire farming machines, a tractor and a seeding machine.

Property destruction: On 27 December 2018, in Chamichaco (Araucania), unidentified individuals set fire to a house belonging to the guardian of an agricultural property. Pamphlets supporting the Mapuche cause and the death of the Mapuche leader Camilo Catrillanca were found at the site. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.
On 3 Jan 2019, in the road between Collipulli and San Andres, Malleco, three armed hooded individuals set a logging farm on fire after asking the workers to exit the buildings.

On 13 January 2019, in the route between Lumaco and Capitan Pestene, Araucania, unknown men destroyed four forestry machinery and damaged four other motors in a rural area. Neither injuries, fatalities, nor arrests were reported. Some notes signed by a Mapuche militia, related to CAM, were left in the scene.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Chile (2018-); RN: National Renewal
NOTES: On 14 Jan 2019, in San Felipe, Valparaiso, the district headquarters of a legislator (RN) was attacked by two hooded individuals. The attack was perpetrated by the group Anti-Fascist Action Fifth Region.

A group of armed men threatened a truck driver and set the truck loaded with wood on fire in Contulmo, province of Arauco Biobio Region. The event was registered on January 22th, 2019. According to the victim, the perpetrators wore black masks. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

As reported on 23 February 2019, on the P72 road, between Canete and Tirua (Biobio), unidentified men set fire to a warehouses and a residence at an agricultural property. The suspects managed to escape, and no arrests were reported. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 4 March 2019, in Contulmo (Biobio), unidentified men set on fire to machinery and equipment of a wood company. Pamphlets supporting the Mapuche cause were found near the place of the event. Neither injuries, fatalities nor arrests were reported. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 4 March 2019, in Mafil, Los Rios, unidentified men set fire to 2500 meters of forest land. No group has claimed the event. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

On 7 March 2019, in Nueva Imperial, Araucania, at least 8 unidentified armed men set fire to four important equipments at a building of a forest company. No group has claimed the event. No fatalities or injuries were reported.

On 10 March 2019, in Temuco, Araucania, three unidentified hooded and armed men set on fire machinery of a forest company. On 11 March 2019, in Tirua, Biobio, a digger was burnt by unidentified men. No group has claimed the event.The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

March 11, 2019. In Temuco, La Araucania, forest workers recived the third attack to their equipment and property in the last week. Two important equipments were burnt by unidentified men. The watchman and two of his sons resulted injured while trying to control the fire. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 15 March 2019, in Puerto Varas, Los Lagos, unidentified men set fire and destroyed four houses in the poblacion Violeta Parra. No group has claimed the event. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies. On 15 March 2019, in Villarrica, Araucania, a huge fire took place in the Poblacion Los Coihues. It left 40 people injured and burned down 12 houses. The firemen managed to control the fire and the motivation is unclear. No group has claimed the event. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 16 March 2019, in Temuco, Araucania, unidentified armed men set fire to a car, which started a fire that burned 4 houses and left 23 people injured. No group has claimed the event. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 18 March 2019, in Melipeuco, Araucania, unidentified men set fire to a building and it burnt about 8,000 bales of grass that were stored at the construction site. No group has claimed the event. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

In the week of March 18, 2019, the Chilean Army informed the defusal of 13 out the 17 minefields settled in The Beagle Channel in the region of Magallanes and Antartida during the Argentinian war on 1978. According to the military, the demining process requires more time than expected due to the fragility of the area.

On 19 March 2019, in Lanco, Los Rios, three houses in the Malalhue sector were set on fire. Two of them were almost completely destroyed. In addition, two volunteers firefighters were injured. No group has claimed the event. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 19 March 2019, in Angol, Araucania, unidentified men set fire to about 10 hectares of grassland in the Pozo Lastre sector. No group has claimed the event. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies. A volunteer firefighter was injured.

On 21 March 2019, in Quidico, Biobio, at least 10 unidentified men, with their faces covered, set on fire to a house in the Palos Blancos sector. No group has claimed the event. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

On 29 March 2019, in Concepcion, Biobio, unidentified men set fire to a house. No group has claimed the event. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies. No injuries or fatalities were reported.
On 1 April 2019, in sector el Transito, Nueva Imperial, Araucania, Coordination Arauco Malleco set two forest machines on fire, destroying both of them.

On 3 April 2019, in Mafil, Valdivia, Los Rios, a group of men set on fire five forest machines, a property of a private company. Several pamphlets promoting the Mapuche cause were found in the place of the attack.
On 22 April 2019, in Fundo Pumalal, Temuco, Araucania, the Coordination Arauco Malleco destroyed six forest machines and partially destroyed other five.

On April 22, 2019, the CAM claimed authorship for an arson attack carried within the rural area of Lautaro in the Cautin province, Araucania region. Heavy equipment was set on fire. The burned vehicles belonged to a company dedicated to wood exploitation.

In the week of April 25, 2019, heavy equipment used for wood extraction was set in fire by unidentified men. The keeper declared the group was armed since several shots were heard before the attack. The event was registered in the area of Collipulli, Malleco region, Araucania region. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 28 April 2019, in Carahue, Cautin, Araucania, a group pf men set on fire two forest machines. The perpetrators left the scene after setting on fire the tools, and according to reports, they shot a few times in the air. Several pamphlets promoting the Mapuche cause were found in the place of the attack.

On 5 May 2019, in Rio Bueno, Ranco, Los Rios, two agricultural machines were set on fire by masked men, who left a note in rejection of foreign investments and calling for freedom for mapuche political prisoners.
On May 5, 2019, armed men set machinery on fire in local fish business in the area of Osorno Los Lagos region. No group has claimed the attack.
On 6 May 2019, in Collipulli, Malleco, Araucania, a group of Mapuche militia burnt a bulldozer machine and left a note claiming for the freedom of political prisoners.

ACTOR1: ITS: Individualists Tending Toward the Wild (Chile)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Chile (2018-); Labour Group (Chile)
NOTES: In the week of May 9, 2019, police forces of Chile deactivated an explosive device sent to a known businessman in the city of Santiago de Chile. The civilian received a package at his house and after finding irregularities in such decided to call the police. The group Ecoterrorist Movement- ITS claimed authorship for the event.

On May 14, 2019, masked men set on fire several trucks and containers that belonged to a forest products company in the area of Loncoche, Cautin, in the Araucania region. The perpetrators threaten the guards with guns. Several pamphlets promoting the CAM were found in the place of the attack.

On May 19, 2019, unidentified men set on fire machinery of a forest company in the rural area Miraflores in Lautaro, La Araucania region. No group has claimed the event. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On May 20, 2019, civilians reported that unidentified armed men set on fire two houses in the area of Tirua in the Arauco province, Biobio region. According to the reports, the men also shoot at a third house in the area. No persons were reported injured or killed. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 21 May 2019, in Barros Arana, Teodoro Schmidt, Cautin, Araucania, seven forest machines and a trailer house were sent on fire. There is an ongoing land issue in the area directly related to the indigenous communities. No group has claimed the attack.

On May 21, 2019, unidentified men set on fire several trucks and a trailer that belonged to a forest products company in the area of Teodoro Schmidt, in the Araucania region. Pamphlets of the armed organization WAM were found in the area.

On 23 May 2019, in the area of Lebu, Arauca, in the Biobio region, masked men set on fire several trucks and containers that belonged to a forest products company. The perpetrators threaten the guards with guns. The Coordination Arauco Malleco claimed the attack

On 23 May 2019, in Los Alamos, Arauco, Biobio, nine forest machines and trucks were set on fire by four masked men. The men threaten the security guard and then set the machines on fire. There is an ongoing land issue in the area directly related to the indigenous communities.

On 23 May 2019, in Canete, Arauco, two trucks were set on fire on the highway from Canete to Curva del Circo. There is an ongoing land issue in the area directly related to the indigenous communities. No group has claimed the attack.

On 23 May 2019, on the road P-60, connecting Canete and Contulmo (Biobio), unidentified men set two trucks on fire while transporting wood, at the level of the Curva del Circo community. The suspects managed to escape, and no arrests were reported. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 23 May 2019, in Los Alamos (Biobio), between four and eight unidentified men set fire to machinery at an agricultural property on the Los Cambuchos sector. The suspects arrived at the site, intimidated workers, and eventually burned the infrastructure. The suspects managed to escape, and no arrests were reported. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 24 May 2019, Canete, Arauco, a cargo truck was set on fire by a group of masked men. The driver was injured in the attack, and authorities found a pamphlet vindicating indigenous law. There is an ongoing land issue in the area directly related to the indigenous communities.

On 26 May 2019, in Mulchen, Biobio, a backhoe was set on fire. There is an ongoing land issue in the area directly related to the indigenous communities. According to reports, no group has claimed the event.

In the week of May 29, 2019, a group of unidentified men set a truck on fire in the road that connects Contukmo with Caneta in the Arauco, Biobio region. In the area were found pamphlets against the indigenous law promulgated by the Chilean government. No group has claimed the event. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 29 May 2019, unidentified men set on fire three houses in the rural area Quidico in the Tirua area, Arauca, Biobio region. The perpetrators wore back masks and shot several times to the air. No group has claimed the event. There is an ongoing land issue in the area directly related to the indigenous communities. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.
On 30 May 2019, in Santiago, Metropolitana, around 40 unidentified men set one Transantiago bus on fire. The perpetrators wore black masks. No group has claimed the event.

In the week of June 7, 2019, unidentified men set on fire several trucks and a machinery that belonged to a forest products company in the area of Los Sauces in the Malleco province, Araucania region. Pamphlets of the armed organization associated to the CAM were found in the area.

As reported on 7 June 2019, in Santiago (Metropolitana), a group set a bus on fire at the intersection of the Providencia sector and Huelen. Four young men, two of them minors, were arrested. Family members of the accused reported they were not involved in the vandalism acts.

On 9 June 2019, in Canete (Biobio), unidentified men set a neighbourhood association on fire at the Pangueco sector. On June 12, 2019, unidentified men set on fire two vehicles in Canete, Arauco province, Biobio region. Pamplhets demanding a land reform in the country were found in near the place of the fire. No group has claimed the attack. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 21 June 2019, in Ercilla (Araucania), a group of six hooded, armed suspects set a bus on fire after they forced passengers to get off the vehicle. On July 7, 2019, unidentified men set on fire the local office of the Indigenous Agricultural Territorial Development Program in the area Ercilla, Malleco province, Araucania region. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On July 22, 2019, unidentified men set on fire a private business run by a member of the Mapuche indigenous group in the area of Canete, Arauco province, Biobio region. No group has claimed the event, but pamphlets claiming justice for the death of a Mapuche man killed by a farmer in Tirua were found in the place.

On July 23, 2019, unidentified armed men set on fire a private house in the rural area of Tirua, Arauco province, Biobio region. No injuries or fatalities reported. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 23 July 2019, in Canete (Biobio), a group of hooded suspects set a bus on fire and forestry machinery in a rural area. Neither injuries, fatalities nor arrests were reported. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On July 23, 2019, three masked men set on fire several equipment that belonged to a forest products company in the area of Lanalhue, rural area of Canete, Biobio region. The perpetrators threaten the workers with guns and are suspected to be Mapuche.

On 23 July 2019, in Concepcion (Biobio), three unidentified men set fire to a truck and a skidder at a forestal plot belonging to the Mininco business. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 25 July 2019, in Canete (Biobio), unidentified men set a truck on fire on the P-70 highway. Before that, around 10 armed suspects had conducted the same attack in the community of San Miguel, setting machinery, a truck, and the guardian's house on fire, after intimidating him with gunshots. It was reported this was the sixth attack in less than five days. No injuries or fatalities were reported. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On July 25, 2019, police forces of Chile found a package charged with explosives in the offices of Chilean Post in the area Las Condes, Santiago de Chile. The parcel addressed to a former minister of Chile, contained dynamite. The anarchist militia Complices Sediciosos/Fraccion por la Venganza claimed the attack on their website.

On 25 Jul 2019, in Santiago, Metropolitana, an explosive artifact was deactivated in Las Condes, in the offices of a large business conglomerate. The package had the same send that the one which exploded a few hours before and was destined for the former Home Secretary.

On 28 July 2019, in the rural area of Ercilla, Araucania region, unidentified perpetrators set on fire a pick-up truck. The car was used as a barricade across the road. On July 29, 2019, a group of men destroyed communication equipment from multiple private companies in the area of Quillon, Nuble region. The men threaten the security guard and proceed to destroy the devices with axes and oxy-fuel torches.

On 5 August 2019, in the rural area of Ercilla, Araucania region, two unidentified armed men stole and set on fire a truck of a telecommunications company. Perpetrators set the vehicle on fire. Plampelhts demanding the liberation of imprisoned Mapuche leaders were found.

On 26 August 2019, in Lautaro, Araucania region, seven masked men set on fire several pieces of equipment that belonged to a private farmer. The perpetrators threatened the workers with guns. On 31 August 2019, in the rural area of Contulmo, Araucania region, a group of masked men set on fire heavy equipment that belonged to a private wood enterprise. As reported on 13 September 2019, in Villa Alemana, Valparaiso region, two masked rioters threw Molotov bombs at the police station of the district. Authorities claimed the goal was to set on fire the building. No information on fatalities or injuries was reported/shared by the source. [size=2]

On 19 October 2019, the mayor of the city of Valparaiso reported a state of emergency in the regional capital, allowing the Military Forces of Chile to intervened in the demonstrations that are taking place in the streets.

On 20 October 2019, in Temuco (Araucania), a group of more than 20 hooded suspects started shooting to intimidate the keeper of the La Frontera University. On 27 October 2019, in Iquique, Tarapaca region, Police Forces of Chile arrested in his house the president of the student's committee of a regional university. According to witnesses, over 20 agents participated in the operation, and they did not mention the charges under which the student was being arrested.

As reported on 27 October 2019, on the road connecting Angol and Collipulli, a truck was set on fire. At least 5 suspects ordered the driver to get off the vehicle, eventually setting it on fire. No arrests were reported. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies. [size=at least 5]

On 27 October 2019, in Santiago de Chile, the president announced the end of the state of emergency in the country. With this anouncement the security measures in the main cities will be responsibility of police forces of Chile instead of the military officers.

On 28 October 2019, in Santiago, Metropolitan region, the president announced the conclusion of the state of emergency in every province of the country. Moreover, he announced the dismissal of 8 ministers, among them the minister of interior. Following this communicate, the military forces of Chile have to return to their military bases.
As reported on 29 October 2019, in Biobio region, Police Forces of Chile informed that they have arrested more than 1,180 people in the region in relation with the protests and demonstration.

On 29 October 2019, in the rural area of the Malleco province, Araucania region, a group of armed masked men set on fire heavy machinery that belonged to a local forest company. There have been several attacks in Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.

On 29 October 2019, in Lumaco (Araucania), a group of rioters carried out an arson attack, setting machinery, a truck and a container on fire in a rural area. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies. [size=no report]

On 05 November 2019, in the rural area of Contulmo, Biobio region, a group of 10 masked men set on fire three trucks and two houses. Police claimed that a pamphlet claiming justice for the death of a Mapuche indigenous was found in the area of the attacks.

As reported on 06 November 2019, national authorities informed that nearly 3,193 people have been arrested during the nationwide demonstrations. The same report registered nearly 1,092 people injured, among them 546 with gunshots. Meanwhile, the national medical association reported that more than 180 people have lost their eyesight, product of pellets shot during the protest.

As reported on 06 November 2019, the national agency for protection of children's rights reported more than 150 cases for excessive force or sexual abuses by state agents against underage persons had been registered across the country.

On 12 November 2019, in Mulchen, Biobio region, a group of 6 unidentified masked men set on fire one crane and four trucks that belonged to a local company. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 14 November 2019, near Quidico, in the commune of Tirua, Biobio, an undetermined number of hooded men burnt down a summer cottage. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 15 November 2019, in Puerto Montt, Los Lagos, an alleged arson attack destroyed the home of a Catholic priest. The house was empty at the time of the attack, no injuries.

On 19 November 2019, in Curico (Maule), two women set fire in a tire in front of the house the city's Police Commissioner. The two women were arrested. The event happened during a political and social crisis in the country, with civil uprising continuing for several weeks.

On 20 November 2019, in the rural area of Canete, Biobio region, a group of unidentified armed men burnt down two houses after threatening the owners. On 27 November 2019, in a rural area of Freire (Araucania), the Trapilhue school was set on fire by unidentified suspects. Neither injuries, fatalities nor arrests were reported. On 8 December 2019, in Collipulli (Araucania), a group of suspects set two school buses on fire in a rural area. Neither injuries, fatalities nor arrests were reported. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

As reported on 13 December 2019, in the rural area of Padre Las Casas, Araucania region, unidentified perpetrators set on fire the building facilities of a catholic school. Pamphlets against the current Mapuche governor of the Cautin province were found in the building.

On 15 December 2019, in Santiago, Metropolitan region, the National Commission for Human Rights reported the robbery of three computers with information on human rights violations and excessive use of force by state forces during the demonstrations of the previous weeks. On 21 December 2019, in a rural area near Carahue (Araucania), at least three armed suspects broke into a land of a logging company and set six trucks on fire after intimidating workers. On 21 December 2019, in the rural area of Carahue, Araucania region, alleged members of the CAM set on fire seven trucks and heavy equipment that belonged to a logging company. No information on fatalities or injuries was reported/shared by the source.

On 22 December 2019, in the rural area of Ercilla, Araucania region, a group of armed men set on fire the house of a worker of the local water company. Pamphlets supporting the Mapuche movement were found in the area.

On 30 December 2019, in the rural area of Canete, Biobio region, unidentified armed men set on fire a truck of a wood company. No information on fatalities or injuries was reported/shared by the source. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 03 January 2020, in the rural area of Collipulli, Araucania region, unidentified armed men set on fire a truck of a wood company. The perpetrators stopped and forced the driver to get off the vehicle, consequently parking the car across the road before setting this on fire. The source reported no casualties. Hours later one person was arrested under suspicion of participating in the attack. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 7 January 2020, in the rural area of Los Sauces, Araucania region, a group of armed men set on fire heavy equipment that belonged to a wood company. The perpetrators intimidated workers and consequently set on fire the machines. In total 7 backhoes, 3 trucks, one crane, and a tractor were damaged. Later, in a public statement released to the press, the CAM claimed authorship for the attack.

On 10 January 2020, in the rural area of Tirua, Biobio region, 5 armed men stormed in the house of a local farmer in an attempt to steal their animals. The group set on fire the house of the victims and left behind a note supporting the Mapuche movements in the region.

On 17 January 2020, in the rural area of Lebu, Biobio region, a group of at least 4 masked individuals set on fire heavy machinery in the forest plantation Ranquil Bajo. The perpetrators threaten the drivers and then proceed to set on fire two pick-up trucks, an excavator, three trucks and a crane. Pamphlets demanding the liberation of a Mapuche activist from jail were found in the area. Later, in a public statement released to the press, the CAM claimed authorship for the attack.

On 18 January 2020, in the rural area of Lumaco, Araucania region, a group of masked men set on fire several heavy-machinery in a forest plantation. At least 8 trucks and machines were reported damaged. Pamphlets signed by the CAM demanding the liberation of a Mapuche activist from jail were found in the area.

On 22 January 2020, in the rural area of Collipulli, Araucania region, an unidentified group of perpetrators set on fire several heavy machinery and other vehicles in the forest plantation Santo Domingo. The attack is presumed to be connected to indigenous militias in the area.

On 23 January 2020, in the rural area of San Juan de la Costa, Los Lagos region, a group of armed men set on fire heavy machinery and other vehicles that belonged to a forest plantation company. In a public statement released to the press, the CAM claimed authorship for the attack and demanded the liberation of a Mapuche activist from jail.

On 26 January 2020, in the rural area of Contulmo, Biobio region, a group of at least 3 unidentified masked men burned down a firefighter truck of a brigade working on a wildfire near the Lanalhue Lake. As reported on 9 February 2020, in the rural area of Temuco, Araucania region, a group of members of the CAMs set on fire five heavy machinery that belonged to a forest company. Authorities found in the area propaganda supporting the Mapuche movement.

On 25 October 2020, Chile held a referendum to decide whether the country's constitution, written over the military dictatorship times, should be changed. Nearly 78% of the electorate voted in favor of a new charter, and 79% of voters supported the election of a body of citizens to draft the new document. From Santiago, Metropolitan region, the President Sebastian Pinera (no party) made a public speech to accept the outcome.

Workers claimed perpetrators had military gear and intimidated the operators. Pamphlets found in the area connected the attack to the CAM. No injuries were reported.

Around 4 November 2020, in the Metropolitan region [coded to Santiago], the resignation of the Minister of Interior was reported. The public officer decided to retire following a session of the house of Representatives in which it was approved to open an official investigation and temporally suspension of his duties due to excessive use of force by state forces during the political unrest of October 2019.

Simultaneously, near the Llleu Lleu Lake residents, reported that hooded men threw Molotov Bombs at a Catholic church, producing a fire in the facilities. There have been several attacks in the region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals.

Property destruction: On 6 October 2021, in Tranaquepe, Tirua commune (Biobio), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a local school. Perpetrator threatened the workers who were in the area when the attack occurred and subsequently burned down the building. There have been several attacks in the region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals.

Property destruction: On 6 October 2021, in the rural area of Puren (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a private house. The property was empty when the attack occurred. Pamphlets connecting the attack to a Mapuche indigenous militia group were found in the area.

Looting: On 6 October 2021, in the rural area of Canete commune (Biobio), suspected indigenous militiamen stole a private vehicle that belonged to a local logging company. The hooded men forced the driver to stop and subsequently fled the area in the car. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals.

Land seizure: Around 7 October 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Quilaco (Biobio), a group of armed men who identified themselves as Mapuche militiamen from ATM group occupied the offices of the National Park and stated that they would take control of the territory of Pemehue National Park. The individuals affirmed that they would respond with fire to any government official who attempts to enter the area.

Property destruction: On 8 October 2021, near Collipulli (Araucania), at least four armed suspected indigenous militiamen arrived at Thermal baths in the Pemehue area and set fire to the facilities of the tourist complex. A house, a restaurant, and other facilities were destroyed by the fire. A worker who was present at the moment of the attack fled the area.

Property destruction: On 8 October 2021, near Pailahueque, Ercilla commune (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to two vehicles on Route 5. Perpetrators intercepted the car, forced the drivers off, and subsequently burned down cars. There have been several attacks in the region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals.

Property destruction: On 8 October 2021, in the rural area of Canete (Biobio), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a building of a local civil society organization in the Butamalal locality. The property was empty when the attack occurred. There have been several attacks in the region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals.

SOURCE: Biobio Chile; La Nacion (Chile); El Austral Temuco
NOTES: Property destruction: On 12 October 2021, in the rural area of Traiguen (Araucania), between 6 to 8 Mapuche indigenous militiamen set fire to multiple pieces of machinery that belonged to a local logging company located in the Santa Lidia plot of land. Perpetrators threatened the workers and subsequently burned down four forestry machines, three logging trucks, and three pick-up trucks. The CAM claimed responsibility for the attack.

Property destruction: On 12 October 2021, in the rural area of Tirua commune (Biobio), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to an evangelic church in the Bajo Quilantahue area. Property destruction: On 13 October 2021, in the rural area of Lautaro (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to two private houses in Colihueco plot of land. Property destruction: On 13 October 2021, in the rural area of Canete (Biobio), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a private house in a plot of land located six kilometers from the town. Property destruction: On 13 October 2021, in the rural area of Punucapa, Valdivia commune (Los Rios), three suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to several vehicles being used for repair work on a local road. Property destruction: On 14 October 2021, in the rural area of Carahue (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a backhoe that belonged to a local logging company. Security measures: On 15 October 2021, military forces were deployed 400 military soldiers in the provinces of Malleco and Cautin (Araucania), and Biobio and Arauco (Biobio), (coded to Concepcion, Biobio), following a significant increase in the number of attacks by suspected indigenous militia members. Military forces would provide support to the police to patrol areas with high militia activity for the upcoming 15 days.

Property destruction: On 18 October 2021, in Curacautin area (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to eight trucks and other equipment from the project Rural Drinking Water (APR, in Spanish) on the km 40 of the CH-181 highway. Shootings were reported. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals. Pamphlets found in the area connected the attack to a Mapuche indigenous militia.

Property destruction: On 18 October 2021, in Los Angeles (Biobio), an unknown group of suspects set fire to a children's playground in the Ricardo Vicuna avenue. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals.

Property destruction: On 19 October 2021, in Curacautin area (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a Catholic church in the Huenchulao community, in R-829 road, Km 10, between Pua and Selva Oscura locations. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals.

Property destruction: On 20 October 2021, in Vilcun area (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to machinery equipment in the General Lopez sector. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals. Pamphlets found in the area called for the withdrawal of military forces from the area.

Movement of forces: Around 21 October 2021 (as reported), in Chile (coded to Santiago, Metropolitana), authorities remain on alert after reports that the Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua is carrying out illegal activities, such as migrant smuggling, inside the country. The incidents marked the expansion of this organization further from the Venezuelan borders.
On 25 October 2021, in Ollague, Antofagasta, at least 60 Venezuelans trying to cross the border were arrested by the police.

Property destruction: On 25 October 2021, in the rural area of Carahue, Araucania, suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to ten houses, five trucks and two pickups. The entrance to the Forestal Casa Blanca property was blocked by the group. The group also robbed two trucks. The organization Weichan Auka Mapu claimed responsibility for the attack.

Property destruction: On 27 October 2021, on the road that connects Imperial with Temuco, Araucania, at least five suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a truck and build barricades on the km 23, around Entre Rios sector. The hooded men stopped a truck driver, forced him out of the vehicle and subsequently set fire to the truck. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals.

Property destruction: On 28 October 2021, around Labranza municipality, Araucania, suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a truck on the S-40 highway, near the area known as Entre Rios or Ragnintuleufu. The attackers forced the driver, who worked for a forest company, out of the vehicle and subsequently set fire to it. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals. Pamphlets found in the area connected the attack to a indigenous militia.

Property destruction: On 28 October 2021, in the rural area of Osorno (Los Lagos), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to three machines of forestry companies in the Pichilcura sector. There have been several attacks in Los Lagos region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals. A pamphlet connecting the attack to a Mapuche indigenous militia group was left in the area.

Property destruction: On 2 November 2021, around the rural area of Vilcun municipality (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to two machines and a container in the sector of Cordelia. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals. A pamphlet signed by the organization Weichan Auka Mapu was left in the area, demanding the removal of military forces from the region.

Property destruction: On 2 November 2021, in Victoria area (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to four rail carriages and two trains after causing its derailment near the Queipul crossroads. Property destruction: On 3 November 2021, in Contulmo area (Biobio), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a house and a wine warehouse in El Peral sector.
