Property destruction: On 3 November 2021, in Cayucupil (Biobio), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a power generator, a water truck, a water house and an office building. This is the third time the place was attacked, which is why the place was abandoned. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals.

Property destruction: On 3 November 2021, in Colcura (Biobio), at least six suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to two buses. They forced one driver from out of one bus and threatened him with knives and hammers, before setting fire to the vehicles. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals.

Property destruction: On 4 November 2021, in Santiago - Pedro Aguirre Cerda, Metropolitana, suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a bus near the Ranquil street. The armed men forced the driver out of the bus and subsequently set the bus on fire. Pamphlets found in the area connected the attack to the Mapuche indigenous militia.

Property destruction: On 4 November 2021, in Selva Oscura (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to two excavators, a backhoe, a hopper truck, a water tank, a container and a power supply, near Cautin bridge. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals.

Property destruction: On 5 November 2021, in Lautaro (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a school and a preschool. A shoot-out was heard near the place. Property destruction: On 5 November 2021, in Collipulli (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a truck near the main square, in the early hours. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals.

Property destruction: On 5 November 2021, in Traiguen, Araucania, at least 4 suspected indigenous militiamen set fire the farm of a deputy from the National Renewal party (RN). Farm equipment and three warehouses were set on fire, after the perpetrators threatened the night watcher. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals. Property destruction: On 5 November 2021, in Santiago (Metropolitana), unidentified armed individuals set fire to a bus near the Villa Francia memorial. They forced the driver out of the vehicle and subsequently set fire to the bus.

Property destruction: On 5 November 2021, in Contulmo (Biobio), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to an evangelical church. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals.

Property destruction: On 5 November 2021, in the rural area of La Union municipality (Los Rios), six suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to two machinery equipment and a warehouse from a forestry company in the Catamutun sector. Property destruction: On 7 November 2021, in Colcura (Biobio), hooded suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a bus. They forced the driver out of the vehicle and subsequently set fire to the bus. A second bus was used to block the street. Property destruction: On 10 November 2021, in the rural area of Victoria municipality (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to two trucks and one farm tractor in El Maiten area. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals. Property destruction: On 19 November 2021, in Santiago (Metropolitana), heavily armed police officers raided the Communist Party headquarters. They kicked and broke the door of the place. The event took place a day before the presidential elections in the country.

Property destruction: On 24 November 2021, around Los Alamos municipality (Biobio), suspected indigenous armed militiamen set fire to four trucks around the Trongol sector. Pamphlets from the RML: Mapuche Lavkenche Resistance were found in the area, calling for the removal of military forces from their territory, and the release of arrested Mapuche individuals.

Property destruction: On 26 November 2021, in the rural area of Antiquina (Biobio), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a private house. The house was empty at the time of the attack. Gunshots were heard by locals during the incident. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals.

Property destruction: On 28 November 2021, in LonquiMay (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to three cabins and a boat in Las Araucarias area in Laguna Galletue sector. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested indigenous individuals. Property destruction: On 28 November 2021, in the rural area of Lonquimay (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to the facilities of Arenales ski resort . Three of the houses located inside the resort were set on fire. There have been several attacks in the region by indigenous groups demanding land rights and the release of indigenous people arrested. On the same day, three cabins and a boat were also set to fire by Mapuche groups (coded separately).

SOURCE: Biobio Chile; El Mercurio (Chile); El Austral Temuco
NOTES: Property destruction: On 1 December 2021, in the rural area of Carahue commune (Araucania), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to three heavy vehicles that belonged to a logging company in the San Juan plot of land, near the Trovolhue area. Pamphlets connecting the attack to the WAM indigenous militia group were found in the area.

SOURCE: El Sur; Biobio Chile; La Estrella Concepcion
NOTES: Property destruction: On 3 December 2021, in Lloncao (Biobio), suspected indigenous militiamen set fire to a house and two barns in the area of Los Tuneles. The perpetrators stole a vehicle that was parked on the property and also barricaded the road to the property with wooden logs to make the arrival of local authorities more difficult. Pamphlets were found in the area linking the attack to a Mapuche indigenous militia group.

Security measures: On 7 December 2021, in the provinces of Arauco, Cautin, Malleco (Araucania), and Biobio (Biobio) (coded to Temuco, Araucania), the government introduced a 30-day extension of the state of emergency, allowing the deployment of military troops in these areas. This is the third time that the Senate has approved such a measure alluding to increasing attacks perpetrated by indigenous militia groups operating in these regions.

On 5 January 2018, in El Encanto, Fortul, the Land Operations Battalion No. 27 of the Military Forces of Colombia found a cache with grenades, explosives, weapons and military quartermaster material. It is presumed that the material belongs to ELN and would be used in ELN war operations.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - C15 Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (C15 Front)
NOTES: On 10 January 2018, in rural zone of El Paujil, the military forces of Colombia along with the police forces caught a cache with 75 grenades. The weapons belonged to dissident group Frente C15 of FARC. No arrests or armed clashes were reported.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 1st Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (1st Front - Armando Rios)
NOTES: On 13 January 2018, in Charras, San Jose del Guaviare, the military forces of Colombia found a cache with 80 kg of explosives and material to make 340 landmines. The explosives were destroyed. The cache belonged to Frente 1, dissidents of FARC

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 1st Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (1st Front - Armando Rios)
NOTES: On 13 January 2018, in Las Colinas, rural area of San Jose del Guaviare, the military forces of Colombia found a cache with 40 pounds of explosives in two IED. The IEDs were destroyed and the area secured. The cache belonged to Frente 1, dissidents of FARC.

Property destruction: January 14, 2018. In the area of La Lagrima, in a road of La Esmeralda, Arauquita, a public service bus was burned, presumably by members of ELN. Two men on a motorcycle intercepted the bus and after forcing the passengers go out, they set it on fire. The road was blocked temporarily.

On 15 January 2018, in El Crucero, Alban, El Cairo, the Military Forces of Colombia found a cache that belonged to ELN. In the cache the Military found: 85 improvised explosive devices, a binocular lens, a battery, a flashlight, 50 meters of cable, an ELN flag, 80 detonators, a plastic can and a black bag. No arrests or casualties were reported.

Property destruction: January 26, 2018. On the road that connects Caucasia and Segovia, unidentified armed men stopped and burned vehicles, trucks and machinery belonging to the company that builds the highway. In the region ELN and Clan del Golfo operate, but the Police also suspect of common criminal people. 20 vehicles were burned between Caucasia and Segovia. Obs: the report mentions three places: Segovia, Zaragoza and Caucasia, but it also says the actions occurred in just two points of the road.

Property destruction: January 26, 2018. On the road that connects Caucasia and Segovia, unidentified armed men stopped and burned vehicles, trucks and machinery belonging to the company that builds the highway. In the region ELN and Clan del Golfo operate. 20 vehicles were burned between Caucasia and Segovia.
Property destruction: On January 26th, 20 cars were burned on the route between Caucasia, Zaragoza, and Segovia in Antioquia by unidentified actors.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: Property destruction: January 27, 2018. In Caserio Muriba, in Mesetas, seven armed men got on a bus, forced the passengers to get off and proceeded to burn it. The action is attributed to FARC dissidents. No casualties were reported.
Around 25 January 2018, a military operation was deployed in Caucasia in order to control the territory and the actions of ELN and Clan del Golfo

On 29 January 2018, in San Jose de Urama, Dabeiba, the Military Forces of Colombia with the support of anti-explosives dogs discovered a package containing 58 landmines in a public bus. The package was sent as a parcel. The landmines were destroyed by specialized personnel. The authorities are investigating the procedence and destiny of the explosives.

On 29 January 2018, in Ciudad Bolivar, police forces seizured a cargo of 850 kilograms of indugel explosive and 8.750 meters of slow wick. In the operative one person was arrested. The material belonged to Gulf Clan (AGC) and was going to be used in illegal mining and to attack the Police and Military Forces. An investigation is taking place to determine how this material ended up in the hands of Gulf Clan, as this kind of explosive is made only by the Colombian Military Forces.

On 30 January 2018, in La Fortuna, rural area of El Carmen de Chucuri, the Battalion of Humanitarian Demining Engineers and Fifth Brigade of the Military Forces of Colombia, found and destroyed 25 landmines nearby a house.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 1st Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (1st Front - Armando Rios)
NOTES: On 30 January 2018, in rural area of San Jose del Guaviare, the Military Forces of Colombia, Jungle Battalion No. 51 ''General Jose Maria Ortega'', found a deposit with 30 landmines. The landmines belonged to FARC 1st Front dissidents and were destroyed by the army.

Non-violent activity: January 31, 2018. People from the Sabanas de la Fuga to Los Cambulos, in San Jose del Guaviare, were displaced by FARC dissidents. The displacement of the indigenous Jiw community (70 people approx.) is the result of an incursion of FARC members, who entered the community looking for individuals accused of being involved in a robbery case in a nearby farm. The military forces committed to go to the area and check whether there are landmines left by FARC or not.

On 1 February 2018, in Alto Bonito, rural area of Leiva, soldiers of the Infantry Battalion No. 9 of the Military Forces of Colombia, found an ELN's deposit of explosives. The soldiers found two grenade launchers, 27 detonators, 40 pentolite bars, 92 grenades, 100 meters of detonating cord, 34 explosive containers of 30 kilos each and 300 kilos of amatol

On 2 February 2018, in Costa Rica, rural area of Pueblo Bello, troops of the Engineers Battalion N. 10 'General Manuel Alberto Murillo Gonzalez' seizured a cache with 31 improvised explosive devices, a base communications radio, eight small communicating radios, a radio scanner, a standard radio scanner, three microphones, three radio chargers, a rifle stock, 78 non-electric detonators and a flash. The weapons belonged to Libardo Company, North War Front of ELN. The detonators and the IED were destroyed, while the other elements remained in custody.
Property destruction: February 2, 2018. In Puerto Nidia, Fortul, members of ELN who were on a motorcycle stopped a truck of a petrol company and took it to an unknown place.

Property destruction: February 3, 2018. In La Lorenza, rural area of Canalete, 20 armed men arrived to the mayor's farm, burned the houses and robbed 42 cattle heads in two tucks. The mayor went to the farm accompanied by the police and Military Forces, and from there asked the national government and the United Nations to guarantee his life. He blames AGC (Clan del Golfo), as he reported their presence in the area and refused to go to a meeting with them.
Property destruction: February 10, 2018. On the road that connects Buenaventura and Cali, ELN members set two trucks on fire.

Property destruction: February 10, 2018. On the road between Cali and Buenaventura, in El Gallinero area, one trailer truck was burned by ELN members because it was not observing the strike declared by that armed group.

On 11 February 2018, in J-10, rural area of Tibu, Troops of the Engineers Battalion No.30 located a considerable quantity of explosives owned by the ELN. In the place were found four launching cylinder type devices containing a total of 104 improvised explosive devices, 70 meters of duplex cable and two kilos of black powder. This material was detonated in a controlled way.

Property destruction: February 11, 2018. In El Socorro, on the road that connects Valdivia and Yarumal, ELN members burned two trucks and blocked the road with it. The action was part of the armed strike ordered by ELN. A first report by El Tiempo mentions one truck. A second report by Noticias Caracol mentions two trucks and is more precise about the location.
Property destruction: February 11, 2018. In La Cruz, ELN members robbed a bus after detaining its driver for some hours. The action was part of the armed strike ordered by ELN.
On 11 February 2018, in Belen de Docampado, Bajo Baudo, Military Forces of Colombia seized 55 kilos of pentonite and shrapnel. A man wearing ELN clothes was arrested.
Property destruction: February 11, 2018. In Toledo, ELN members burned a bus after ordering the passengers to go out. The action was part of the armed strike ordered by ELN.
Property destruction: February 11, 2018. In Tame, ELN members burned a taxi as a show of power during an armed strike.

On 29 January 2018, in San Jose de Urama, Dabeiba, the Military Forces of Colombia with the support of anti-explosives dogs discovered a package containing 58 landmines in a public bus. The package was sent as a parcel. The landmines were destroyed by specialized personnel. The authorities are investigating the event.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 40th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (40th Front - Jacobo Arenas)
NOTES: On 12 February 2018, in Yavia, rural area of Uribe, Joint Task Forces of the Military Forces of Colombia found a cache with 25 landmines, 14 mortar shells, three long guns, one spare cannon for machine gun, 10 meters of slow fuse, 17 cartridges caliber 7.62 mm, an assault equipment and seven magazines. The material belonged to the residual group 40th Front Jacobo Arenas, a splinter of the FARC.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - Mobile Column: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Teofilo Forero Castro)
NOTES: On 12 February 2018, in Vista Hermosa, rural area of San Vicenete del Caguan, troops of the Specific Command of Caguan of the Military Forces of Colombia found a cache with five kilos of black powder, 28 batteries, one kilo of ammonium nitrate and two electric chargers. The material belonged to the Mobile Column Teofilo Forero, a splinter of the FARC.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - Mobile Column: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Teofilo Forero Castro)
NOTES: On 12 February 2018, in Nuevo Horizonte, rural area of San Vivente del Caguan, soldiers of the Sixth Division of the Military Forces of Colombia, located and destroyed 81 mortar grenades of 81 millimeters, which were hidden in an illegal deposit belonging to Mobile Column Teofilo Forero, FARC dissidents.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 21st Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (21st Front - La Gaitana)
NOTES: On 12 February 2018, in El Progreso, rural area of Planadas, soldiers of the Fifth Division of the Military Forces of Colombia found an 81 mm mortar. According to the Military Forces, the mortar belonged to FARC dissidents 21st Front La Gaitana

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 1st Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (1st Front - Armando Rios)
NOTES: On 12 February 2018, in Plan de Cumare, rural area of San Jose del Guaviare, men of the Fourth Division of the Military Forces of Colombia, located and destroyed an illegal deposit with 140 kilos of black powder and urea belonging to the residual FARC Front Armando Rios .

On 13 February 2018, in rural area of Sotomayor, Los Andes, Joint Task Force Hecules of the Military Forces of Colombia found a cache belonging to ELN. On the site were found two and a half tons of anfo, mixed with shrapnel, and a package with more than 100,000 pamphlets with propaganda of this armed group.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 7th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (7th Front - Jacobo Prias Alape)
NOTES: On 14 February 2018, in Planada del Rayo, rural area of San Vicente del Caguan, Military and police forces found and detonated in a controlled manner 40 landmines that belonged to FARC dissidents Front Seventh. The authorities of Colombia are deploying operations to dismantle FARC dissidents in San Vicente del Caguan and Cartagena del Chaira.
On 16 February 2018, in Acacias, troops of the Seventh Brigade of the Military Forces of Colombia arrested the local leader of the hitmen network of Clan del Golfo (AGC).
On 16 February 2018, in Buenos Aires, rural area of Cumaribo, a joint group from the Military Forces and the Police captured the leader of Los Puntilleros militia.

Non-violent activity:: February 16, 2018. In Paloquemao area, downtown Bogota, a ''pamphlet bomb'' exploded, throwing papers with ELN propaganda. The anti explosives units of the police secured the area and searched for more devices. The bomb was charged with black powder, which is a low power explosive material. No injured people were reported.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 1st Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (1st Front - Armando Rios)
NOTES: On 19 February 2018, in Puerto Cumare, rural area of San Jose del Guaviare, troops of the Land Operations Battalion No. 77 of the Military Forces of Colombia located a cache with explosives of high power belonging to FARC 1st Front Armando Rios. The explosives were destroyed in a controlled manner.

On 19 February 2018, in Alto del Palo, rural area of Caloto, social leader Holmes Enrique Fernandez Dagua, leader of the Association of Peasants and Indigenous Displaced From Alto Naya ASOCAIDENA, received threats in his residence and an explosive device was planted behind in its door. Anti Explosive experts of the Military Forces evacuated the neighbors and proceeded to destroy the explosive. The leader has been threatened before this year.

On 20 February 2018, in Caceres, the Technical Research Body CTI seizured two assault rifles, two revolvers and 400 cartridges kept in an strategic place by Clan del Golfo (AGC). This operation frustrated an attack that was planned against the Public Force.

On 21 February 2018, in Cuero Tendido, rural area of La Gloria, information provided by the network of allies led to the location of 17 explosive devices by troops of the Military Forces and the Police Forces of Colombia. The devices belonged to ELN and were going to be used to attack the pipeline. Anti Explosives experts detonated them in a controlled manner.

Property destruction: February 24, 2018. In La Guayacana, Tumaco, hooded armed men stopped a bus and set it on fire after making the passengers and driver get off. The men had assault rifles. The Military Forces arrived later to secure the area.
Property destruction: February 25, 2018. In La Balastrera, on the road that connects Padilla and Corinto, four armed men intercepted a bus and burn it after forcing the driver to leave.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: On 27 February 2018, in Toez, Caloto, Guardia Indigena found and neutralized an IED. It is believed that the explosive device was installed by FARC dissidents. Threatening pamphlets sign by FARC dissidents were also found.

On 1 March 2018, in Guatemala, rural area of Miranda, police forces found a cache with 91 .50 caliber cartridges; as well as 442 cartridges caliber 7.62 and four IED with an approximate weight of 2.5 kilos of R1 explosive.

On 2 March 2018, in Buenos Aires, rural area of San Juan de Arama, a joint operation of the Military and police forces resulted in the seizure of an AK37 rifle, six magazines for it, 300 cartridges for AK 47, four hand grenades. The war material belonged to Clan del Golfo (AGC).

On 3 March 2018, in Rio Neiva, rural area of Campoalegre, troops of the Artillery Battalion No. 9 and members of the Technical Investigations Corp CTI found a hidden cache containing 10 - 60 mm mortar grenades. Anti Explosives experts destroyed the explosives.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 14th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (14th Front)
NOTES: On 8 March 2018, in El Brillante, rural area of Cartagena del Chaira, Military and police forces in a joint operation found and destroyed 39 explosive devices that belonged to FARC dissidents 14th Front. Each device 80 grams of explosives and shrapnel. Also some PVC tubes for the fabrication of explosive devices were found.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 1st Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (1st Front - Armando Rios)
NOTES: On 9 March 2018, in the rural area of Calamar, troops of the 22nd Brigade of the Military Forces of Colombia, found and destroyed a cache with 41 grenades of 140 mm. The cache belonged to FARC dissidents First Front. They found and destroyed also a second cache with 80 kilos of R-1 explosive; 57 landmines; 20 kilograms of black powder; 200 meters of blue detonating cord; 104 electric detonators; 1 TNT bar; 4 grenades of 120 millimeters; 4 electric detonators; 1 multimeter; 2 cellphones and 2 dairy canteens. The cache belonged to FARC dissidents First Front as well.

Displacement: March 12, 2018. In Tigre Dos, rural area of Caucasia, 80 Zenu indigenous people from 19 families, were internally displaced due to fear of being attacked by the armed groups of the area. Internal displacement consisted in the families moving to a single house to be all together and try to avoid attacks. The displacement began on early March, when a leader was killed and his son in law injured by unknown men.
On 13 March 2018, in La Florida, rural area of Santacruz, soldiers of the Third Division of the Military Forces of Colombia destroyed in a controlled manner a landmine installed by armed actors.

On 13 March 2018, in El Porvenir, rural area of San Vicente del Caguan, troops of the Ground Combat Battalion n. 22 of the Military Forces of Colombia found and destroyed a landmine installed in a rural road.
Around 15 March 2018, in Taraza, this week two grenades were thrown to a house. The grenades did not explode, and anti explosive technicians of the Police Forces had to defuse them.

On 15 March 2018, in Flor de Mayo, rural area of La Macarena, troops of the Omega Joint Task Force of the Military Forces of Colombia found and destroyed an IED with 40 pounds of explosives and six landmines in a minefield.

Security measures: March 18, 2018. In San Jose de Aartado, rural area of Apartado, AGC (Clan del Golfo) men forced the population to go to a meeting and announced some regulations to be followed. They decreed a curfew during some moments of the week, and people has to warn them about what is happening in the territory. They are also recruiting people and forcing the peasants to grow coca.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - C15 Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (C15 Front)
NOTES: On 20 March 2018, in San Juan, rural area of El Paujil, troops of the Unified Action Group for Personal Freedom ang GAULA of the Military Forces of Colombia, and members of the Investigations Technical Body CTI of the Prosecutors Office, found a cache with 748 cartridges caliber 7,62 mm, and two magazines for AK-47 assault rifle. The cache belonged to FARC dissidents 15th Front.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 17th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (17th Front)
NOTES: On 20 March 2018, in Rio Negro, rural area of Baraya, troops of the Artillery Battalion No. 9 of the Military forces of Colombia coordinating with the Investigations Technical Body CTI of the Prosecutors Office, found a cache with 37 homemade grenades and 19 driving loads that belonged to FARC dissidents 17th Front.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: Property destruction: March 22, 2018. In Cano Camame, rural area of Tame, on the road that connects with Arauca, armed men identified as FARC dissidents burned a bus.

On 26 March 2018, in Zaragoza, Cartago, Anti Narcotics Division of police forces captured the leader of Clan del Golfo (AGC) in Narino, who was recovering after being injured in a Police operation on March 10 in El Rosario. Sepulveda was ordering peasants to face the authorities in Narino and block the illicit crops substitution activities.

Displacement: March 27, 2018. In Tame, indigenous people of Palma Real community have arrived to the urban area displaced from their community due to security reasons. The municipal authorities are taking the displaced people to two different transitory shelters while the security situation is stabilized. Obs: the report does not mention the actor producing the displacement nor the amount of people displaced.
Displacement: March 28, 2018. In Puerto Leguizamo 13 people of the kichwa indigenous community of Puntales arrived after being displaced due to threats of the FARC dissidents Front 1st.

On Sunday April 1, the Colombian Police confiscated in the route Dabeida - Santa Fe de Antioquia military uniforms, communications systems, and war armament. The police are investigating if the material belongs to the Gulf Clan. Two people got arrested in the operation.
On the last 24 hours personnel of the Colombian Army confiscated 155 kilograms of explosives in the vereda Arenosa en Arauquita. The material allegedly belonged to the ELN.

Around 2 April 2018, the website Humanitarian Response cited a report from OCHA in which they denounce the massive displacement of nearly 200 people from the municipality of San Calixto. According to the source the event is caused by armed clashes between the ELN and the EPL.

A group of nearly 50 people and 15 families were internally displaced in the area of the Alto Naya on May 3. The people are from the community of San Juan Santo of the municipality Lopez de Micay, Cauca.

On 10 April 2018, the Colombian Army destroyed an explosive located in the area of Arenosa, Arauquita, Arauca. The explosive was about 100 kgs and according to military forces, it was installed by ELN members.
Around 13 April 2018, in an operation, the Colombian military and the Colombian Police confiscated explosive material in the area La Veremos in the municipality of Hato Corozal in Casanare.

The military forces of Colombia found and confiscated a deposit with explosive material located in the area Monserrate of the municipality of San Jose del Guaviare. The material included 14 landmines, 4000 kgs of explosives between others. The event was reported on April 13th by Extra La Dorada.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: Around 15 April 2018, the military forces of Colombia confiscated explosive material, allegedly from the dissident group of the FARC. The material included landmines and guns, reported the armed forces of Colombia.

NOTES: Recruitment: On 15 April 2018, 3 underage teenagers were recruited by FARC dissident groups in the area of Puerto Betania, San Vicente del Caguan, Caqueta.
Property destruction: On 16 April 2018, armed men identified as members of the EPL set a public bus on fire in the area of Petrolea, near the municipality of Tibu in Norte de Santander.

Around 18 April 2018, a deposit full of explosives that belonged to the ELN was found by the military forces of Colombia. According to sources, the explosives belong to the Front Jose Luis Cabrera and it was located in the municipality of Cumbal.

According to witnesses, the armed group has had meetings with the local population in order to establish new rules in the area and to inform about their presence in the territories.

Property destruction: A supplies warehouse was set on fire by armed men in the area of Jurisdicciones municipality of Teorama. According to the sources, the event was triggered because the owners of the business decided to continue activities during the ceasefire declared by the EPL on April 15.

Property destruction: Around 19 April 2018, in the area of Catatumbo, armed men of the EPL burned a car and a motorcycle. According to witnesses, the group stopped the drivers and claimed that they had no authorization to be in the area, then proceed to set the vehicles on fire.

In the area, La Vega de San Antonio, municipality of La Playa in Norte de Santander was set a shelter for IDPs of the Catumbo area. The confrontation between the ELN and EPL have caused a wave of displacement and in this particular shelter were registered 1050 IDPs on April 19th.

Around 19 April 2018, the Oficina Cucuta reported the opening of a new shelter in the area of Ocana, Norte de Santander. Since April 16th it has received 266 IDPs from Catatumbo. The civilians were unable to get supplies due to the confrontations between the ELN and EPL in the area.

On 26 April 2018, in an operation, the Colombian police captured the person in charge of logistics of the Clan del Golfo (AGC) in Sucre. He was found in a house in the south of the city of Sincelejo. The police also seized weapons and ammunition.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: The community of San Andres de Cuerquia in the north of Antioquia reported the presence of FARC dissident groups in the rural area of the municipality. In the area of Pueblo Nuevo Ceral the presence of armed actors was reported on April 27th. According to the sources, pickup trucks brought heavily armed men wearing military outfits.

ACTOR2: GUP: United Guerrillas of the Pacific
NOTES: The National Police and Colombian Army confiscated rifles, grenades, communication equipment, ammunition and military uniforms in the area of Pueblo Nuevo, municipality of Mosquera, Narino. According to official sources, the implements would belonged to the Guerrillas Unidas del Pacifico. The event was reported on May 7th by Diario del Sur.

A leader of the ELN was arrested in a joint operation between the military forces of Colombia and the Colombian Police. Elmer Cardena, known as El Gordo, was captured in the area of Peje, the area of Junin de Barbacoas published Diario del Sur on May 4.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: Property destruction: Dissidents of the demobilized group FARC set the car of a civilian on fire five minutes from the municipality of San Vicente del Caguan, Caqueta on May 7th. According to the sources, the civilian was being blackmailed by the group and she refused to pay the money.

In the rural area of the municipality of Policarpa in Narino was reported the sight of an armed group. According to the sources, the men are wearing military uniforms and are heavily armed. The group has not yet been identified and the event was reported on May 10th.

The community council of Mosquera Sur in the vicinity of the Patia in Narino reported the presence of armed men around their municipality. According to to the sources, the men are setting checkpoints in the area. The event was informed on May 10th.
Around 12 May 2018, seventy-six people were internally displaced in the rural area of Munambi, near San Jose (municipality of Roberto Payan in Narino) due to threats from the armed group ELN.

According to the people in Vigia del Fuerte, Antioquia, over the last days appeared political material related to the ELN over the region. The area was an operation zone of the FARC, nevertheless, since this group stopped controlling in this area, there are theories that point to an incursion of ELN in this municipality. The event was reported by El Colombiano on May 15th.
On 15 May 2018, 76 IDPs were reported in the municipality of Magui Payan in Narino. According to the source, their presence was due to the presence of armed groups in the area.

Around 17 May 2018, indigenous groups of the Sierra Nevada reported the presence of an armed group in their territories. According to them, the areas affected are Santa Marta and Cienaga in Magdalena, and Dibulla in La Guajira. The illegal group is known as Los Pachencas and its members are mostly demobilized members of paramilitary groups. The communities affected by this are the communities Kogui, Malayo, Arhuaco, and Kankuam which are located in the mountains of these areas.

Property destruction: On 18 May 2018, three trucks were set on fire in the route Caucasia, Zaragoza, and Segovia in Antioquia, in the area known as Brasil. No groups have yet taken responsibility for the attack.

Property destruction: On 5 June 2018, armed men that identified themselves as members of the Pachencas group burned a bus of public transport in the rural area of Bonda in the municipality of Santa Marta in Bolivar.

NOTES: Around 21 June 2018, the Colombian military reported that they found a storage unit in which a dissident group of the FARC produced explosive material. In the operation, the army confiscated landmines and other materials used to build rudimentary bombs.

Around 26 June 2018, two work machines for construction were burned by unidentified armed men in the municipality of San Andres de Cuerquia in Antioquia. These were part of the project for a dam in the area.

Property destruction: A truck was set on fire and another one painted with the initials of the ELN in the area of Zaragoza in the municipality of Buenaventura in Valle del Cauca. The destruction happened on the morning of July 14th. the road was blocked for several hours after the attack.

NOTES: A former FARC member created a FARC dissident group in the area of Guapi. For this same action, he was expelled of the political party FARC. Property destruction: The ELN tried to set on fire a pipe truck of the firm Ismocol in Saravena. Armed men broke into one of the parking lots on July 22nd and set fire to the vehicle. People present at the moment helped to control the fire. No injured or dead were reported.

The military forces of Colombia found a storage with 686 explosive devices hidden in the area of Los Brazos in the municipality of Barbacoas in Narino. All the material was confiscated. The event was reported on July 26th.

NOTES: The presence of an armed group that identified themselves as AUC was reported in the municipality of Cajibio in Cauca. The men set up an illegal checkpoint on the roads. The event was reported on July 26th.

A vehicle was set alight and four more painted with EPL propaganda in the rural area of the municipality of Sardinata in Norte de Santander. The event was on July 28th and no injuries or deaths were reported

Property destruction: Unidentified men set on fire a tractor and a water pump of a private company in the municipality of Corinto in Cauca on August 16th. No group has yet claimed this event.

The community of Saravena in Aruca reported that on August 17th that armed men patrolled the streets of the municipality. According to the source, the men wore camouflage but had no indication to belong to the police or military forces of Colombia .

Around 9 March 2018, in La Yuquera, rural area of Calamar, troops of the 22nd Brigade of the Military Forces of Colombia, found and destroyed a cache with 80 kilos of R-1 explosive; 57 landmines; 20 kilograms of black powder; 200 meters of blue detonating cord; 104 alectric detonators; 1 TNT bar; 4 grenades of 120 millimeters; 4 electric detonators; 1 multimeter; 2 cellphones and 2 dairy canteens. The cache belonged to FARC dissidents First Front.

Displacement: On 25 August 2018, 118 indigenous Awa peoples were forcibly displaced from Resguardo nambi Piedra Verde, in Barbacoas (Narino) due to threats to the cabildo leaders by an unidentified armed group.
Displacement: On 27 August 2018, the presence of several armed groups in the rural area of Roberto Payan have caused nearly 41 IDPs to head towards the municipality of Olaya Herrera.

A high commander of a GAOR was arrested by the police in an operation of police forces and the military. The event was registered in the town of San Sebastian in the municipality of Tumaco in Narino. In the event were also arrested 12 more people and seized several elements including computers, ammunition, etc. The operation was reported on August 28th but happened earlier in the week.

Property destruction: A public bus that was driving from Tibu to Cucta was set alight by members of the EPL on August 29th. The event was registered in an area of El tablazo in the municipality of El Zuilia in Norte de Santander. No people was injured.

Detonation: One person died after the motorcycle in which he was transporting an explosive deviced exploded. The event was registered on August 26th in the area El Palo of the municipality of Caloto in Cauca. There is not information if the man was part of an armed group or not.

On 2 September 2018, in San Antonio (Santander De Quilichao, Cauca) the Military and police forces arrested 6 ELN: National Liberation Army rebels and seized an AK-47 rifle, 1 revolver, a stick of dynamite, 365 5.56-mm ammunition cartridges, 65 electric detonators, detonating cord and uniforms belonging to ELN.

Looting: On 4 September 2018, an unidentified armed group illegally drilled Cano Limon oil pipeline from state company Ecopetrol near Lenguazaque (Lenguazaque, Norte De Santander), causing a leakage of petrol.

Recruitment: Two teenagers that disappeared in the city of Arauca in Arauca seem to be recruited by illegal armed groups in the area. The police investigation declared that the kids are probably part of a group near the border with Venezuela. The event was reported on September 6th.

SOURCE: General Command of the Military Forces - Colombia
NOTES: On 7 September 2018, in Altamira (San Martin, Cesar), the Military Forces of Colombia found and defused 30 antipersonnel landmines, together with 1kg of Pentolite, a detonator, 1m of safety fuse and 2m of detonant cord.

On 7 September 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia found and seized 5 rifles, an M60 machine gun, a 9-mm pistol, 68 7.62-mm ammunition cartridges and 32 assorted calibre ammunition belonging to ELN: National Liberation Army insurgents in La Conquista (Arauquita, Arauca).

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 48th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (48th Front - Pedro Martinez)
NOTES: On 8 September 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia found and seized in La Floresta (San Miguel, Putumayo) 14 bags containing ANFO (Ammonium Nitrate Fuel Oil) explosives and 730kg more of ANFO in 2 plastic drums belonging to dissidents from FARC's 48th ''Pedro Martinez'' Front.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 40th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (40th Front - Jacobo Arenas)
NOTES: On 8 September 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia found and seized 27 anti personnel landmines and 40 non-electric detonators belonging to dissidents from FARC's 40th ''Jacobo Arenas'' Front in Alpes (Mesetas, Meta).

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - 6th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (6th Front)
NOTES: Armed men of the Front 6th of the dissidents of the FARC set alight a public bus in the area of El Jagual in the municipality of Corinto in Cauca. The action is apparently for not paying a extortion. The event was reported on September 9th.

Property destruction: The property of a local leader that is an advocate for the protection of the environment was set on fire by unidentified men on Mongui in Boyaca. According to the leader, she reported often people or business that interfere and affect the highlands of the area something that could produce this violent reaction. No group has yet claimed this event that was registered on September 10th.

On 11 September 2018, the military forces and police forces found and seized 5 rifles, 2 fragmentation grenades, communications devices, a 9-mm pistol, 18 ammunition clips, 1000 assorted calibre ammunition cartridges and clothing belonging to Clan del Golfo (AGC) in Arenales, Santa Rita (Ituango, Antioquia).

The military forces of Colombia found a storage with ammunition and other supplies that belonged to the ELN. The elements were hidden in the rural area of the municipality of Sacama In Casanare. The event was reported on September 15th.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - Mobile Column: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Teofilo Forero Castro)
NOTES: On 24 September 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia found and seized in Risaralda (Puerto Rico, Caqueta) 30m of duplex cable, 92 IED and a 12-volt battery belonging to dissidents from FARC's Mobile Column ''Teofilo Forero Castro''.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 30th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (30th Front)
NOTES: On 24 September 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia found and seized in the vicinity of San Francisco De Naya (Buenaventura, Valle Del Cauca) 300 kg of ANFO (Ammonium Nitrate Fuel Oil) and 260kg of black gunpowder belonging to dissidents from FARC's 30th ''Jose Antonio Paez'' Front.

On 24 September 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia found and seized in a rural sector of El Cairo (Valle Del Cauca) 12 sticks of dynamite, 120 homemade mortars and 6 sticks of Pentolite belonging to ELN: National Liberation Army members.

On 24 September 2018, in Lobo Guerrero (Dagua, Valle Del Cauca), the Military Forces of Colombia found and seized 4 rifles, a revolver, 4 pistols, 6 ammunition clips, 2300 rifle ammunition cartridges and communications devices belonging to ELN: National Liberation Army, as well as took into custody an ELN member, 2 unidentified persons and a minor.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 48th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (48th Front - Pedro Martinez)
NOTES: On 28 September 2018, police forces seized a 7.62-mm machine gun, 4 5.56-mm M-4 rifles, 45 assorted calibre ammunition clips, and 1 pistol with 50 9mm ammunition cartridges belonging to dissidents from FARC's 48th ''Pedro Martinez'' Front in El Eden neighbourhood, La Hormiga (Valle Del Guamuez, Putumayo), after arresting Ricardo Antonio Garvin Rojas (''El Medico''), commission leader of FARC's 48th Front, and 3 more dissidents.

NOTES: On 29 September 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia arrested ''Mocho'', a leader of FARC's 1st ''Armando Rios'' Front, in Saravena (Saravena, Arauca) and seized a 9-mm pistol with ammunition clip, 15 9-mm ammunition cartridges, 18 7.65-mm ammunition cartridges, communications devices and documents such as information on extortion payments.

On 29 September 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia found and seized in La Honda, Pueblo Bello (Pueblo Bello, Cesar) four 5.56-mm rifle ammunition clips, 1 Mini-Ingram-type weapon, 291 7.62-mm ammunition cartridges, 26 60-mm anti-tank grenades, 191 5.56-mm ammunition cartridges, 30 kg of ammonium nitrate fuel oil (ANFO), 1 launching ramp and 30m of cable belonging to the ELN: National Liberation Army.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Colombia (2018-); Police Forces of Colombia (2018-)
SOURCE: General Command of the Military Forces - Colombia
NOTES: On 30 September 2018, between Pinalito (Vistahermosa, Meta) and Yarumal, the Military Forces, the Air Force and the Police Forces located and seized 443 grenades belonging to Los Puntilleros.

NOTES: Land seizure: On 30 September 2018, the Government of Colombia seized 9 properties located in Paz De Ariporo (Paz De Ariporo, Casanare) belonging to dissidents from FARC's 28th ''Jose Maria Cordoba'' Front: 1 supermarket, 6 business premises, 2 sets of land, with an overall value of around US$1,3 million.

On 4 October 2018, the intra-urban displacement of 22 families from San Buenaventura neighbourhood, Buenaventura (Buenaventura, Valle Del Cauca) was reported.

NOTES: On 6 October 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia seized in Santa Ana, Arauquita (Arauquita, Arauca) a rifle, 6 short-range weapons, 4 fragmentation grenades, 14 ammunition clips, 466 assorted calibre ammunition, 1 telescopic sight, communications devices, 3 laptops, 3 video cameras, 2 recorders, supplies and documents with valuable information belonging to dissidents from FARC's 1st ''Armando Rios'' Front, after arresting ''Walter'' and 4 dissidents from FARC's 1st Front.

SOURCE: General Command of the Military Forces - Colombia
NOTES: On 8 October 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia found and seized in Cucharito (Tello, Huila) a cache with 22 IED, 11 IM_26 hand grenades, 5 40-mm grenades, an 81mm homemade explosive, 136 5.56-mm cartridges, a radio scanner, 8 detonators, 1 machine gun, a vest and a rifle bag belonging to GAOR: Residual Organized Armed Group.

NOTES: On 8 October 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia found and seized a cache with 12900 7.62-mm ammunition cartridges and 48 60-mm mortar grenades belonging to dissidents from FARC's 7th ''Jacobo Prias Alape'' Front in Loma Linda, Vistahermosa (Vistahermosa, Meta).

On 8 October 2018, in a joint operation by the Military Forces and police forces in El Doce (Taraza, Antioquia), after arresting ''El Indio'' (leader of the ''Julio Cesar Vargas'' Front of Clan del Golfo (AGC)), authorities seized 4 firearms, silencers, assorted calibre ammunition, communications devices and documents of interest to military intelligence.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 7th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (7th Front - Jacobo Prias Alape)
NOTES: On 10 October 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia found and seized 48 60-mm mortar grenades and 9000 7.62-mm ammunition cartridges belonging to dissidents from FARC's 7th ''Jacobo Prias Alape'' Front in Loma Linda, Vistahermosa (Vistahermosa, Meta).

On 11 October 2018, at least 700 people were reported to have displaced from the northern territories in the municipalities of Hacari (Hacari, Norte De Santander) and San Calixto (San Calixto, Norte De Santander), as a result of the armed conflict. The displaced people have gathered in Palocruza (Hacari, Norte De Santander), as a protest and a way to call the authorities' attention.

On 11 October 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia found and seized in Oru (El Tarra, Norte De Santander) 265 5.56-mm rifle ammunition cartridges, 100 22-mm pistol ammunition cartridges, 181 7.62-mm ammunition cartridges, a rifle ammunition clip, 160 pamphlets, 600 metres of electrical cable and 2 notebooks with information of interest to military intelligence, all belonging to ELN: National Liberation Army.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 1st Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (1st Front - Armando Rios)
NOTES: On 11 October 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia found and seized 714 7.62-mm ammunition cartridges belonging to dissidents from FARC's 1st ''Armando Rios'' Front in Puerto Uva, Puerto Gaitan (Puerto Gaitan, Meta).

On 11 October 2018, at least 700 people were reported to have displaced from the northern territories in the municipalities of Hacari (Hacari, Norte De Santander) and San Calixto (San Calixto, Norte De Santander), due to the lack of guarantees to remain in the territories as a result of the armed conflict. The displaced people have gathered in Palocruza (Hacari, Norte De Santander), as a protest and a way to call the authorities' attention.

On 13 October 2018, 600 soldiers from the Military Forces of Colombia arrived to Taraza (Taraza, Antioquia), as part of the Government's plan to strengthen security in Antioquia's Bajo Cauca. The soldiers will be divided between Puerto Valdivia, Taraza, Caceres and Caucasia.

Property destruction: On early 14 October 2018, the headquarters of the Christian Church Monte del Rey were burned by unidentified people in El Poblado, Medellin (Medellin, Antioquia). No injuries were reported.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - C15 Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (C15 Front)
NOTES: On 15 October 2018, the military forces and police forces arrested the leader of the FARC dissident C-15 Front, and his sister in the neighbourhood of La Ceiba, Baraya (Baraya, Huila). A pistol, ammunition, laptops, cellular telephones and cash was also seized.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 1st Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (1st Front - Armando Rios)
NOTES: On 16 October 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia arrested the militia chief of the dissident FARC's 1st ''Armando Rios'' Front, together with 2 more dissidents in Pueblo Seco, Agua Bonita media, Calamar (Calamar, Guaviare).
On 17 October 2018, police forces arrested 59 people in a security sweep in Medellin (Medellin, Antioquia).

Property destruction: On 18 October 2018, the ceremonial house of the Kankuamo Indigenous Group in Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta (Atanquez, Valledupar, Cesar) was burned down by unidentified people. No injured were reported, and the ONIC reported that thanks to the community action the other spiritual houses in the same location were saved. This follows other similar events in 2015 (Chemesquemena), 2016 (La Mina) and 2017 (Guatapuri) targeting indigenous ceremonial houses.
On 18 October 2018, police forces arrested 12 members of Clan del Golfo (AGC) in Meta, including the regional commander of the organization.
On 18 October 2018, 35 members of El Guajiro were arrested by police forces in Yumbo (Yumbo, Valle del Cauca).

SOURCE: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
NOTES: Land seizure: On 19 October 2018, supporters of the Gulf Clan occupied the Zona de Biodiversidad La Esmeralda from Familia Durango, in the community of El Guamo, Curbarado (Carmen del Darien, Choco). The occupiers, around 50 people, started to build ranches to stay in the place, affirming they were taking the land with the authorization of the representative of the Main Council of Curbarado (German Marmolejo). Out of the 60 hectares of the property, they occupied 6. This happened a day after members of the Gulf Clan tried to access the humanitarian area of Cano Manso and the people refused to let them access it.

On 20 October 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia seized ammunition (244 assorted calibre ammunition cartridges, 7 metallic ammunition clips), 60 antipersonnel landmines, a 30-gallon can with ANFO mixed with Pentolite, 36 syringes and some clothing belonging to EPL: People's Liberation Army - Los Pelusos in the rural sector of Canas Arriba (Florida, Valle del Cauca).

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 3rd Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (3rd Front - Oswald Patino)
NOTES: On 21 October 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia seized weapons (1 submachine gun, 1 9-mm pistol) and ammunition (25-cartridges 9mm ammunition clip, 9-mm ammunition cartridges) from FARC's 3rd ''Oswaldo Patino'' Front dissidents in the rural sector of Socorro Alto, Morales (Morales, Cauca).

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - Mobile Column: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Teofilo Forero Castro)
NOTES: On 21 October 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia seized 31 improvised explosive devices from FARC's ''Teofilo Forero Castro'' Mobile Column dissidents in the rural sector of El Tesoro, Puerto Rico (Puerto Rico, Caqueta).

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: On 21 October 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia seized weapons and ammunition from FARC dissidents in Gaitania (Planadas, Tolima).

NOTES: Property destruction: On 22 October 2018, in vereda Sabaneta, close to Pandi (Pandi, Cundinamarca) an intermunicipal bus covering the route between Pandi and Venecia was assaulted by 25 dissidents from FARC's 53rd ''Jose Antonio Anzoategui'' Front,who intimidated the driver (from the company Autofusa), forced the passengers out of the vehicle and set it on fire. No injuries were reported. LPG cylinders were found.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 1st Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (1st Front - Armando Rios)
NOTES: On 22 October 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia arrested the finance chief of FARC's dissident 1st ''Armando Rios'' Front in the rural sector of El Lago, Puerto Guzman (Puerto Guzman, Putumayo). At the same time, they rescued a 16-year-old radio operator, a girlfriend, and a 17-year-old boy. They also seized weapons, ammunition, explosives, communications materials and other supplies.
On 22 October 2018, the authorities arrested in Cucuta (Norte De Santander) EPL: People's Liberation Army - Los Pelusos leader Sebastian [Frangil Antonio Rodriguez].

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: On 23 October 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia found and neutralised 2 60-lbs gas-cylinder bombs installed by FARC dissidents in Charras (San Jose Del Guaviare, Guaviare).

NOTES: On 23 October 2018, military forces and police forces found and seized 10 antipersonnel landmines, 20m of detonating cord, communications devices, ammunition (247 assorted calibre ammunition cartridges, a 5.56-mm ammunition clip) and some clothes from FARC dissidents in the rural sector of Rio Blanco, Baraya (Baraya, Huila).

NOTES: On 23 October 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia found and seized 37 antipersonnel landmines, 1 pistol, communications devices and 100 metres of duplex cable from FARC dissidents in La Paz (El Retorno, Guaviare).
On 23 October 2018, in the rural sector of Chontadural, Mutata (Mutata, Antioquia), the military forces and police forces arrested two men, including the head of hit men for Clan del Golfo (AGC).

Property destruction: On 24 October 2018, Ecopetrol (State Oil Company) confirmed a new attack against Cano Limon Covenas pipeline in vereda La Blanquita, Cubara (Cubara, Boyaca), this being the 76th attack in 2018. The ELN: National Liberation Army is believed to be behind the attack.

On 28 October 2018, a group of 5,600 soldiers arrived to Catatumbo region (Norte De Santander), in order to reinforce the troops battling the armed groups in the area, mainly ELN: National Liberation Army and EPL: Popular Liberation Army.
On 29 October 2018, the Military Forces of Colombia arrested ''Hernesto'' and ''Canuta'', key urban militia leaders from ELN: National Liberation Army, in Caserio Puerto Nidia (Fortul, Arauca).

March 14, 2019.
