In the week on July 12, 2019, military forces of Colombia found and destroyed a drug production facility located in the rural area of the municipality of Cumbitara, Narino.

In the week of July 14, 2019, military forces of Colombia seized a cache of explosives and weapons that would belong to the ELN. The deposit was hidden in the rural area of the municipality of Ituango, Antioquia.

On July 14, 2019, military forces of Colombia defused an explosive device installed in a truck and a motorcycle on the road that connects Tumaco and Pasto in Narino. The vehicles were left in the area of San Miguel, municipality Mallama, Narino.
Around July 15, 2019, military forces of Colombia defused a car charged with explosives in the rural area of the municipality of Ricaurte in Narino. The vehicle had propaganda for the ELN.
In the week of July 17, 2019, at least 100 indigenous Embera Katio fled from the rural area of the municipality of Tierralta, Cordoba due to death threats made by the AGC/Gulf Clan.
On July 22, 2019, alleged ELN members set two trucks on fire in the area El 15, municipality of Taraza, Antioquia. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

As reported on July 30, 2019, the military forces of Colombia arrested 143 members of illegal armed organizations, including ELN and EPL, during a large scale military operation carried in 14 municipalities of the Norte de Santander department. Five drug production compounds were destroyed and more 26 tonnes of contraband good seized. No casualties reported.

SOURCE: General Command of the Military Forces - Colombia
NOTES: As reported on July 31, 2019, Police Forces of Colombia found and destroyed a drug production facility located in the rural area of the municipality of San Jose del Ure, Cordoba. The facilities are believed to belong to the AGC/Gulf Clan.

On August 5, 2019, unidentified men set on fire the facilities of the Guardia Indigena in the hamlet of La Liberia, municipality of Morales in Cauca. Indigenous claim the perpetrators are members of an armed organization that retaliates the rejection of the community for sowing coca crops.

On August 11, 2019, alleged members of the ELN initiated the displacement of 34 people after their village received threatening notes with peoples' name on them to leave from the rural area of the municipality of Yondo, Antioquia.
In August 2019, in the rural area of Murindo Antioquia, at least 62 indigenous Embera were displaced due to armed clashes between ELN and AGC/Gulf Clan forces in the community of Chajerado.

On August 16, 2019, armed men that identified as EPL members stopped and set on fire a bus on the road that connects the municipalities of Ocana and Cucuta in Norte de Santander. No casualties/injuries reported.

As reported on August 19, 2019, Military Forces of Colombia units seized a large warehouse for the manufacture and storage of weapons and ammunition in the rural area of the municipality of Litoral del San Juan, Choco. The supplies would belong to ELN.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 7th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (7th Front - Jacobo Prias Alape)
NOTES: As reported on August 19, 2019, Military Forces of Colombia seized a large number of ammunition, guns, and equipment that would allegedly belong to the FARC Dissident Faction 7th. The material was stored in the rural area of the municipality of Vistahermosa, Meta.

As reported on August 19, 2019, a dissident FARC Faction and Military Forces of Colombia clashed in the rural area of the municipality of Suarez, Cauca, since August 13, 2019. At least 400 people, mostly peasants and indigenous, were reported forcibly displaced and more than 100 caught in the crossfire. No casualties/injuries reported.
On 22 August 2019, in Medio San Juan, Choco department, OCHA reported the displacement of Afro-Colombian communities due to the continuous clashes between military forces of Colombia an ELN forces.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: As reported on August 22, 2019, alleged FARC dissident members stole a truck loaded with 150 gas cylinders in the rural area of the municipality of Paez, Cauca.
As reported on 23 August 2019, in the rural area of the municipality of Auguachica, Cesar, Military Forces of Colombia found and destroyed a drug production compound. No arrests were reported.

As reported on August 23, 2019, nearly 900 people evacuated the town and municipality of Toribio, Cauca, during the defusal of an explosive device settled in the urban area. Police claimed as potential perpetrators ELN or a FARC dissident Faction.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - 33rd Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (33rd Front)
NOTES: On 25 August 2019, in Convencion, Norte de Santander department, members of the FARC dissidents Faction 33rd, set on fire the car of a politician of the FARC political party and candidate for the local government. No casualties/injured reported.

As reported on 27 Aug 2019, about 78 nautical miles from Punta Coco, Uribia, La Guajira, Colombia (in the Panamanian Pacific Ocean), the Panamanian National Aeronaval Service (SENAN) seized 603 packages of illicit substances found inside the structure of a craft boat. Two colombian citizens apprehended.

On 29 August 2019, in a video published online allegedly from the Aurauca department, members of the FARC: Common Alternative Revolutionary Force announced their withdrawal from the peace agreement with the Colombian government and the reinstatement of an armed guerrilla group in the country. The group alluded to lack of guarantees and non-compliance by the government with the agreements as motives to return to the armed fight.
On 05 September 2019, in Soacha, Cundinamarca department, unidentified men set a bus of public service on fire. Pamphlets claiming the attack by an unidentified armed group were found in the area.

As reported on 06 September 2019, in El Tarra, Norte de Santander department, military forces of Colombia found and destroyed two drug production compounds that would belong to the ELN. No arrests were reported.

On 12 September 2019, in Las Perlas, Putumayo department, at least 100 armed men that identified themselves as the New Sinaloa Guerrillas raided the village and announced they were taking control over the territory.

As reported on 12 September 2019, in the rural area of Toledo, Norte de Santander department, military forces of Colombia disposed of an explosive device laid near a petroleum pipeline by unidentified armed men.
As reported on 13 September 2019, in La Aguada, municipality of Abrego, Norte de Santander department, police and military forces of Colombia found an destroyed a cocaine production compound.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: As reported on 13 September 2019, in Guamal, municipality of Abrego, Norte de Santander department, police and military forces of Colombia found an destroyed a cocaine production compound. The facilities would allegedly belong to a FARC dissident faction.
In September 2019, in the maritime area of Tumaco, Narino, the military forces of Colombia seized a submarine loaded with eight tons of cocaine. The drugs would belong to an unidentified armed group.

As reported on 18 September 2019, in the rural area of El Litoral Del San Juan, Choco department, military forces of Colombia seized a large cache of explosives that would allegedly belong to the ELN.

As reported on 24 September 2019, ELN forces have strengthened their presence in the department of Arauca. According to the report, FARC dissidents factions are under control by the ELN, and the group is looking forward to expanding their operation areas to the Catatumbo region in Norte de Santander.
As of 24 September 2019, in Solano (Caqueta), around 91 indigenous people were displaced as a result of ongoing armed violence perpetrated by unidentified groups in the region.

Around 25 September 2019 (between 16 September - 4 October), in Alto Baudo (Choco), at least 159 people were displaced as a result of ongoing armed violence perpetrated by the National Liberation Army (ELN) in the region.

SOURCE: General Command of the Military Forces - Colombia
NOTES: As reported on 25 September 2019, in the department of Narino, the ministry of defense reported the arrest of 206 people, during a two-week operation carried against illegal armed organizations.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - 18th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (18th Front)
NOTES: As reported on 26 September 2019, FARC dissident Faction 18th declared they were joining the armed organization of the newly dissident formed by Ivan Marquez, Jesus Santrinch, and El Paisa --that recently issued a call to arms. The statements were published in a video that authorities believed was recorded in the Nudo de Paramilli, Antioquia department.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 6th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (6th Front)
NOTES: As reported on 28 September 2019, in Caloto (Cauca), the alleged leader of support networks of the FARC Dissident 6th Front was arrested in a residence in the community of Pajarito. Behind the arrest warrant there were terrorism and homicide charges. No fatalities were reported.

On October 03 2019, in the municipality Planeta Rica, Cordoba, 225 kilos of amphora, a high-powered explosive, were seized inside a bus. It is reported that legally, this explosive is used in mining works. It is illegally used to attack civilians and security forces. The destination of this explosive was San Juan de Uraba, Antioquia. One person was arrested.

On October 04 2019, at the Rumichaca International Bridge, Ipiales, Narino, police officers closed the border with Ecuador. The reason for the closure of the border is due to the protests that have been generated in Ecuador against the economic measures of President Lenin Moreno. It is reported that the closure has been intermittent.
As reported on 12 October 2019, in Cauca department, the Sinaloa Cartel is recruiting underage people. The event was reported by indigenous leaders in the region.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: PU: Social Party of National Unity
NOTES: On 13 October 2019, in Zulia, Norte de Santander, unidentified men set on fire two vehicles that belonged to one of the candidates for the mayor's office of this municipality. The victim is a member of the PU party. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

As reported on 15 October 2019, in a rural area of the department of Choco, Military Forces of Colombia located and destroyed a military compound of the AGC. The facilities were used by the organization as a training camp and could host up to 60 militants. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

SOURCE: General Command of the Military Forces - Colombia
NOTES: As reported on 15 October 2019, in the rural area of Unquia, Antioquia department, Military Forces of Colombia found and destroyed illegal mining material and machinery, including ten motor and a digger, that would allegedly belong to the AGC.

SOURCE: General Command of the Military Forces - Colombia
NOTES: As reported on 15 October 2019, in the rural area of Murindo, Antioquia department, Military Forces of Colombia found and destroyed illegal mining material and machinery, including two diggers, that would allegedly belong to the AGC.

As reported on 17 October 2019, in the rural area of Brazuelo de Papayal, Bolivar, the military forces of Colombia seized a vehicle and nearly 1,100 gallons of smuggled gasoline that would belong to the AGC. The material would potentially be used to produce drugs or trade to finance the group_ expenses.

As reported on 17 October 2019, in the rural area of San Sebastian de Buenavista, Magdalena, the military forces of Colombia seized a vehicle anf nearly 1,100 gallons of smuggled gasoline that would belong to the AGC. The material would potentially be used to produce drugs or trade to finance the group_ expenses.

As reported on 21 October 2019, in Norte de Santander, more than 1000 military and police officers were deployed to 11 municipalities in Catatumbo area, including Tibu city, to guarantee the safety of local elections candidates. The area was declared by the Electoral Observation Mission (MOE) at extreme risk due to the presence of armed groups.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Colombia (2018-); AV: Green Alliance
NOTES: On 21 October 2019, in Miraflores, Convencion, Norte de Santander, an empty vehicle from the National Unit of Protection was set on fire. The vehicle was part of the security scheme of the Green Aliance party mayorship candidate. The vehicle had been seized from the candidate by armed men on 19 October.

On 30 October 2019, in La Gabarra (Norte De Santander), members of the Colombian Army deactivated three explosive devices belonging to the National Liberation Army (ELN). Officials reported the devices were meant to be denotaded by La Antena military base. No injuries or fatalities were reported.
On 1 Nov 2019, in Toribio, Cauca, armed men set fire to a van that was left as evidence from the massacre that took place in Tacueyo on 30 Oct 2019.

On November 03 2019, in La Playa de Belen, Ocana municipality, Norte de Santander, 80 people -21 families- were displaced after members of the Popular Liberation Army (EPL) threaten these families. EPL members gave these families half an hour to leave the territory.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: On 4 November 2019, on the road La Gabarra-Tibu, Norte de Santander, armed men intercepted a vehicle from the Battalion of Engineers of the Army. The soldier who was driving was requested to leave, and the armed men burned the vehicle. The area is known for the presence of FARC dissidents.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Colombia (2018-) DIRAN: Anti-Narcotics Directorate
NOTES: As reported on 4 November 2019, in Los Angeles, Sardinata, Norte de Santander, the Army 30th Brigade, the Colombian Air Force, and the Counternarcotics Police destroyed two laboratory complexes composed of 13 structures, that belonged to the ELN's Juan Fernando Porras Martinez Front.They seized 1,188 kg of cocaine and 336 kg of coca base.

As reported on 5 November 2019, in the rural area of La Gabarra, Norte de Santander, the Army discovered and defused three cylinders filled with explosives, near the military base of La Antena. The IEDs belonged to the Luis Enrique Leon Guerra Front of the ELN.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: On 12 November 2019, in Durania, Norte de Santander, military forces destroyed a lab used in the production of cocaine. The lab was owned by dissident factions of FARC.

On 12 November 2019, in Pueblo Nuevo, Cordoba, 73 members of the Embera Dochama indigenous community and 53 farmers were forced to leave their home by illegal armed groups looking to control the territory.
On 12 November 2019, in Amalfi, Antioquia, military and police forces captured a suspected leader of the 'Capitan Mauricio' faction of ELN, which has presence in the north-west region of Antioquia.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - 18th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (18th Front)
NOTES: On November 12 2019, in Versalles, Cordoba, 67 members of the Embera Katio indigenous group were displaced by FARC Dissident-18th Front and members of Los Caparros gang. Both FARC dissidents and gang members are forcing locals to move to take control of the area.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - 18th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (18th Front)
NOTES: On November 15 2019, in Dochama reserve, San Jose de Ure, 52 indigenous were displaced by FARC Dissident-18th Front and members of Los Caparros gang. Both FARC dissidents and gang members are forcing locals to move to take control of the area.

On November 17 2019, in downtown Bogota, dozens of soldiers settled in the streets, where people usually protest. The local office of United Nations expressed its concern about the increase of military in the streets before the national strike on November 21.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - 18th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (18th Front)
NOTES: As reported on November 17 2019, in San Jose Ure, Cordoba, 225 people were displaced by FARC Dissident-18th Front and members of Los Caparros gang. Both FARC dissidents and gang members are forcing locals to move to take control of the area.

As reported on November 18 2019, in Alto Baudo, Choco, there was a massive displacement of indigenous and Afro-Colombian families after members of the Gaitanist Self-Defence Forces of Colombia (AGC)/Gulf Clan established in the area. While almost 2,160 individuals moved to other areas, 680 individuals are still in the area without freedom of mobilization or communication.

On November 19 2019, in Cali, police officers raided student houses within the Universidad del Valle. Police officers were in search of potentially dangerous materials before the national strike called for November 21.

On November 19 2019, in Bogota, police officers raided the headquarters of the Media Cartel Urbano media. Police officers seized graphic material. Likewise, another media was asked to remove a self-protection manual against the Mobile Riot Squadron (Esmad) from the website. The freedom of the press foundation indicated that the raid took place as an attack to freedom of expression days before the national strike called for November 21.

Between November 19 and 22 2019, the government of Colombia in Bogota, shut down all the borders. All 12 borders checkpoints that communicate Colombia with Brazil, Ecuador, Peru, and Venezuela were closed due to the national strike that took place on November 21. Intelligence agencies informed that several foreigners, who have been protesting in other countries in the region, could enter Colombia.

On November 20 2019, in the Andalucia-Cali way, police officers seized 10,000 detonators for explosive charge and 8,500 meters of wick. The material was inside a metal container in a car. Two men were arrested.

On November 21 2019, in Pamplona, Norte de Santander, police officers seized 135 explosive devices. Four people were arrested. Allegedly, the detainees were students from Universidad de Pamplona and members of the movement JM19.
On 22 November 2019, in Bogota, the authorities decreed a curfew after violent demonstrations took place as part of nation-wide protest to demand policy changes.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - 18th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (18th Front)
NOTES: As reported on November 30 2019, in Ituango, Antioquia, after several clashes between 18th FARC dissidents and members of the Gulf Clan, 246 people were displaced to nearby areas. Troops were deployed in the area to pushed FARC dissidents and members of the Gulf Clan out of the area.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On December 03 2019, in La Guadalupe, Guainia Department, Venezuelan National Guard (GNB) officials crossed into Colombian territory and forcing indigenous communities to register at a checkpoint in Chaparro. GNB officials confiscated boats when indigenous people refused to register. No further information.

As reported on December 09 2019, in Popayan, Cauca, public security forces arrested a finance chief of the National Liberation Army (ELN) in Southern Cauca. The ELN member was accused of arms explosives trafficking and other crimes.

As reported on December 12 2019, in Saravena, Arauca, police officers arrested the head of the death squads for the eastern front of the National Liberation Army (ELN). The detainee was under investigation for some 100 murders.

As reported on December 12 2019, in Riosucio, Choco, military officials arrested a Gulf Clan chief. The detainee was in charge of drug trafficking in the Uraba region and was behind the murder of an indigenous leader.

As reported in December 19 2019, closed to the bus terminal in the north part of Cali, 200 Venezuelan migrants have been established in a camp for Venezuelans. Some of the migrants have returned to these camps due to the lack of jobs and that the authorities have denied them the Special Permit of Permanence (PEP).

As reported on December 26 2019, in Bogota, police and military officers seized 20 boxes with more than 1,000 cartridges for 9mm guns inside a boat. The group provides cartridges, grenades and guns to the National Liberation Army (ELN). Seven individuals were arrested.

On December 30 2019, in Cali, police officers arrested a National Liberation Army (ELN) leader. The leader was released from prison in 2017 and was negotiating a peace agreement with the national government. The motive of the arrest is not reported.

As reported on December 31 2019, between La Caucana and San Jose de Ure, Cordoba, 20 armed men were collecting information about kids so they can recruit them to the armed group. the name of the armed group is not reported. It is informed that for months, Los Caparros Gang, Gulf Clan, and members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) are fighting to control the area.

On January 5 2020, in Jiguamiando, Choco, 30 members of the Gaitanist Self-Defence Forces of Colombia (AGC)/Gulf Clan arrived with guns and demanded the indigenous communities to deforest so they can plant coca. AGC members informed that they will take control of the territory and asked for the whereabouts of social leaders in the area. A group of indigenous people decided to move to other areas.

On January 7 2020, in Villanueva, La Guajira, 30 members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) with guns moved and took a section of the territory. The ELN installed a checkpoint with flags and wrote graffiti at the headquarters of the university Universidad de La Guajira and vehicles. No armed clashes are reported.
As reported on January 12 2020, in Bojaya, Choco, about 200 members of the Gaitanist Self-Defence Forces of Colombia (AGC) arrived to take control of the drug trafficking in the area.
As reported on January 20 2020, in Tumaco, Narino, 3,000 people were displaced after armed clashes in the area. Families are being displaced after armed groups have been fighting to control the area.

As reported on January 21 2020, in Taraza, Cauca, 60 people were displaced after President Ivan Duque visited the area. Families that are being displaced are part of the National Program for the Substitution of Crops for Illicit Use. Authorities are monitoring armed groups that want to take control of the area and are causing these displacements.

On January 22, 2020, in the Roberto Payan municipality, Narino department, 1,600 residents from the Pangas community were displaced due to the armed clashes between armed groups such as FARC dissidents, Gulf Clan, and Los Contadores.

On January 28 2020, in Hacari, Norte de Santander, soldiers and police officers arrested a leader of the Nation Liberation Army (ELN). The detainee was a member of the ELN for more than 10 years and was in charge of recruitment, explosions, and violent activities within the group.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
NOTES: As reported on January 31 2020, in Ituango, Antioquia, 62 former FARC members with their families were displaced due to the lack of security in the area and recent attacks against former FARC members.

Around 1 February 2020 (between 31 January - 1 February), in the Roberto Payan municipality, Narino department, more than 100 residents were displaced due to the armed clashes between armed groups such as FARC dissidents, Gulf Clan, and Los Contadores.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 29th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (29th Front - Gonzalez Prado)
NOTES: As reported on February 3, 2020, in Barrancabermeja, Santander department, soldiers arrested a leader of the FARC dissident 29th structure Gonzalez Prado front. Military reports informed that soldiers started a surveillance operation months ago to capture and arrest this leader.

On February 4, 2020, in the San Marcelino reserve, Putumayo department, a group of Ecuadorean soldiers entered the Colombian territory and detained four indigenous people, including a minor. The detainees were taken to Ecuador. The motive of the arrest and the circumstances of the presence of Ecuadorean soldiers in Colombian territory are not reported.

On February 5, 2020, in La Arenosa community in Abrego, Norte de Santander department, 236 people were displaced to other parts of the Norte de Santander due to the armed clashes between members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) and members of the Popular Liberation Army (EPL).

On February 12, 2020, in the Las Coralinas neighborhood in Cucuta, Norte de Santander department, members of the Popular Liberation Army (EPL) burned a bus from the company Coomicro. The bus was parked in a residential area. The action took place after members of the EPL mentioned that there will be an armed strike starting on February 14. Member of the National Liberation Army (ELN) also announced an armed strike on February 14. No fatalities reported. [size=no report]

Between February 14 and 15, 2020, in Ocana, Norte de Santander department, members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) stationed a truck in the middle of the road. The ELN prohibited the pass between Venezuela and Colombia for the weekend. This event occurred during the 72-hour armed strike initiated by the ELN in Colombia and the Zulia state in Venezuela. The motive of this action is not reported. [size=no report]

On February 15, 2020, in Aracataca, Magdalena department, suspected members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) burned a bus from the private company Brasilia. No injuries or fatalities reported. [size=no report]

On February 19, 2020, on a highway that connects Cucuta with Tibu, Norte de Santander department, unidentified armed individuals burned a truck. The event took place during a 72-hours armed strike called by the National Liberation Army (ELN). No injuries are reported.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: As reported on February 20, 2020, in Cali, Valle del Cauca department, members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) and FARC dissidents are recruiting minors and young adults to their groups in exchange for jobs and money.

As reported on February 21, 2020, in the Aguas Calientes village in Morelia, Caqueta department, police officers arrested a leader of the Residual Organized Armed Group (GAOR). The member of the GAOR is going to be prosecuted for the crimes against members of the former FARC, threats toward social leaders, and drug trafficking.

Between February 23 and 24, 2020, in Ituango, Antioquia department, more than 820 people, 120 families from 12 villages, have been displaced as a result of threats made by the Gaitanist Self-Defense Forces of Colombia/Gulf Clan.

As reported on February 25, 2020, in Abrego, Norte de Santander department, soldiers and police officers seized 891 kilos of cocaine and 968 gallons of liquid used to manufacture cocaine. The drug belongs to Los Pelusos gang (EPL). No arrests were made.

On February 28, 2020, nearby the Industrial University of Santander (UIS) in Bucaramanga, Santander department, two individuals burned a police motorcycle. The motive of the attack is not reported. Students and workers from the Industrial University of Santander (UIS) were evacuated from the area.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - Carlos Patino Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Carlos Patino Front)
NOTES: As reported on March 7, 2020, in Argelia, Cauca department, 25 members of the FARC Carlos Patino front established its headquarters. People of the area have been displaced. The United Nations asked for more security and respect for the rights of the community. No further information.
As reported on March 15, 2020, in the Choco department, soldiers conducted three operation and seizure 4.2 tons of cocaine, allegedly belonging to the Gulf Clan. No arrests were made.

As reported on March 16, 2020, in San Pablo, Caceres municipality, the Antioquia department, security forces arrested a National Liberation Army (ELN) leader. The leader was a member of the ELN for over 30 years and was an expert on explosives, extortions, and the recruitment of minors.

As reported on March 17, 2020, in La Ceja town, Sabanalarga municipality, Antioquia department, soldiers captured a Gulf Clan female leader. The leader was in charge of carried out proselytist activities and intimidating rural residents in the Antioquia department.

As reported on March 24, 2020, in Roberto Payan municipality, Narino department, 944 Afro-Colombian people were displaced due to the constant armed clashes between armed groups. Members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) are present in the area to control the traffic of drugs.
On March 24, 2020, in Caceres, Antioquia department, soldiers and police officers arrested a leader of Los Caparros gang. The detainee was the leader of 130 members of the gang.

On March 25, 2020, in Convencion, Norte de Santander department, residents blocked a road to prohibit the entrance of people that might be infected with the coronavirus. They only allowed the entrance of health workers and people with food. 470 cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in the Norte de Santander department.

On April 4, 2020, in Los Patios, Cucuta, Norte de Santander department, 900 Venezuelan refugees arrived to the border area to return to Venezuela during the quarantine implemented both in Colombia and Venezuela due to the spread of the coronavirus. Some of the refugees came from Ecuador looking for support and assistance during the quarantine.
On April 16, 2020, in Itagui, Antioquia department, 50 Venezuelan refugees were moved to the border with Venezuela due to the spread of the coronavirus.

On April 16, 2020, in Parque El Agua in Bucaramanga, Santander department, 200 Venezuelan refugees were moved to the border with Venezuela due to the spread of the coronavirus. Local authorities demanded help from the national government to deal with Venezuelan refugees in the Santander department.

On April 17, 2020, in Cali, Valle del Cauca department, 400 Venezuelan refugees, coming from Ecuador, were put in 20 buses and moved to the border with Venezuela due to the spread of the coronavirus. These group of Venezuelan migrants lost their jobs and were looking for health assistance and support during the quarantine implemented due to the coronavirus.

On April 21, 2020, in the Quebradona community in Caceres, Antioquia department, military officers destroyed machinery intended to be used for illegal mining. The machinery was the property of the Los Caparros gang, who use illegal mining to finance their activities. 8 people were arrested.

On April 22, 2020, in Puerto Santander, Cucuta, Norte de Santander department, more than 400 Venezuelan migrants returned to Colombia from Boca de Grita, Tachira state. The group of refugees returned after they received threats in Venezuela from armed groups. The movement of more than 400 refugees alerted the Colombia authorities for a possible coronavirus outbreak at the border.

On April 23, 2020, in Parque del Agua, Bucaramanga, Santander department, around 600 Venezuelan migrants were moved to special facilities. The city announced the creation of an area for migrants, to avoid a coronavirus outbreak in the city amidst the pandemic.

On 24 April 2020, in Urrao, Antioquia department, 70 indigenous families were displaced from the area due to constant armed clashes between armed groups. More than 300 people have been displaced from the area.

On 27 April 2020, in Norte de Santander department, 810 Venezuelan refugees were moved close to the border with Venezuela. Refugees were moved from Comprehensive Social Housing Points on the Colombian border to their home states in Venezuela. This is the fourth wave of Venezuelan refugees that returned to Venezuela after spending five days in social isolation due to the coronavirus.

Around 2 May 2020 (as reported), in Saravena, Arauca department, the oil field Cano Limon-Covenas was attacked six times by unidentified armed individuals. The attacks on the pipeline occurred in a region with the presence of the National Liberation Army (ELN) members and after the armed group announced the end of the unilateral ceasefire in the face of the coronavirus pandemic.

On 5 May 2020, in Arauca, Arauca department, the oil field Bicentenario was attacked by unidentified armed individuals. The attacks on the pipeline occurred in a region with the presence of the National Liberation Army (ELN) members and after the armed group announced the end of the unilateral ceasefire in the face of the coronavirus pandemic.

On 6 May 2020, in Dadeiba municipality, Antioquia department, military forces seized and destroyed a mine belonging to the Gulf Clan. The mine was giving USD $4,600 million per month to the Gulf Clan. 14 people were arrested for illegal mining.

On 8 May 2020, in Medellin, Antioquia department, an humanitarian corridor was created to move back 200 Venezuelan migrants to Venezuela. Most refugees were in shelters, due to the coronavirus pandemic.

On 8 May 2020, in La Guajira department, 304 Venezuelan refugees returned to Venezuela during the coronavirus pandemic. Most refugees arrived from Atlantico and Bolivar departments. More than 800 Venezuelan refugees have returned to Venezuela via La Guajira.

On 13 May 2020, in Cali, Valle del Cauca department, more than 700 Venezuelan migrants departed to Venezuela with the support of the Colombian Migration office and the Police. The coronavirus pandemic complicated their stay in Colombia.

Around 16 May 2020 (as reported), in the rural area of Sardinata municipality, Norte de Santander department, military forces destroyed two laboratories of drugs pertaining to the ELN. 75 gallons of gasoline, 20 gallons of ammonia, three 55-gallon metal cans, each filled with coca leaf in process, and three plastic cans were found.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - Carlos Patino Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Carlos Patino Front)
NOTES: Around 16 May 2020 (as reported), in Argelia municipality, Cauca department, 30 armed members of the Carlos Patino FARC front moved to the area.

Around 22 May 2020 (as reported), in Alto Baudo municipality, Choco department, 1,300 people from the indigenous reservation of Catru have been displaced due to the continuous armed clashes between members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) and other armed groups.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: FARC Dissident - 33rd Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (33rd Front)
NOTES: Around 26 May 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of Sardinata, Norte de Santander department, military forces seized 495 gallons of coca and 60 gallons of fuel. The material was owned by the National Liberation Army (ELN) and FARC dissidents of the 33 front. No arrests were made.

On 26 May 2020, in Cucuta, Norte de Santander department, 130 Venezuelan refugees arrived to the international airport Camilo Daze from Medellin as the group of migrants are on their way to Venezuela. Venezuelan migrants have faced more economic difficulties due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Around 26 May 2020 (as reported), in Suarez, Cauca department, a group of more than 20 people were moved to a secure place by military forces after the victims received threats by dissident members of the Revolutionary Forces of Colombia (FARC).

Around 1 June 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of the Teorama municipality, Norte de Santander department, military forces seized a laboratory with 400 kilograms of chopped coca leaf, 200 gallons of gasoline and 29 metal cans. The laboratory belong to the National Liberation Army (ELN). No arrests were made.

Around 1 June 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of the Teorama municipality, Norte de Santander department, military forces seized a laboratory with 500 gallons of gasoline, 500 kilograms of chopped coca leaves, 100 kilograms of ammonia sulfate, 30 kilograms of urea and 20 plastic cans. The laboratory belong to the National Liberation Army (ELN). No arrests were made.

Around 2 June 2020 (as reported), in Ipiales municipality, Narino department, more than 300 Venezuelan migrants asked Colombian authorities help to return to Venezuela. Some migrants are injured and around 30 children are sleeping on the street. The group of Venezuelans do not have money to keep walking to the border between Colombia and Venezuela. The group of migrants have been walking from Ecuador and Peru.

Around 3 June 2020, in Cucuta, Norte de Santander department, more than 1,000 Venezuelan migrants are waiting to return to Venezuela. Venezuelan authorities only allow 300 Venezuelans to re-enter de country per day. Venezuelan migrants are returning to their country due to the economic situation created after the coronavirus outbreak.
Around 5 June 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of Timbiqui, Cauca department, military forces rescued 38 people that have been threatened by FARC dissident members.

Around 7 June 2020 (as reported), around 500 Venezuelan migrants demanded aid from local authorities to return to Venezuela. Venezuelan migrants have been forced to return to Venezuela due to the economic crisis that started after the coronavirus outbreak. Migrants do not have money to stay in Colombia or buy a ticket to return to Venezuela. They have been camping on the streets of Bogota.

On 9 June 2020, in Villa del Rosario, Norte de Santander department, about 1,000 Venezuelan migrants were waiting to pass through to Venezuela. The migrants have not been able to cross into Venezuela because the Venezuelan authorities only allow for 300 people per day to pass through the border. Colombian authorities say it is a complex humanitarian situation because it continues to put at risk the health of both the inhabitants of the area and the migrants themselves who wish to return voluntarily due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Around 11 June 2020 (as reported), in the north part of the Valledupar municipality, Cesar department, Colombian military forces arrested a Venezuelan military officer, accused of being a spy, in the Ye de Corazones sector. Colombian authorities informed that the detainee was a risk for national security.

On 15 June 2020, in a Care Center in Tienditas, Zulia municipality, Norte de Santander department, 300 Venezuelan migrants left in a bus to return to Venezuela. The group of migrants have been waiting for days in a Health Care Center to be allowed to cross the border to Venezuela.

On 22 June 2020, in Cali, Valle del Cauca department more than 130 Venezuelan migrants boarded a bus in Las Banderas park to return to Venezuela. Migration Colombia and the Mayor's Office of Cali coordinated the move. Venezuelan migrants will have to arrive in Venezuela and wait 14 days in quarantine due to the coronavirus outbreak.

On 29 June 2020, in Bucaramanga, Santander department, around 100 Venezuelan migrants were transported in five buses to the border with Venezuela. Many Venezuelan migrants have been returning to Venezuela due to the economic crisis originated after the coronavirus outbreak.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Colombia (2018-); Police Forces of the United States (2017-2021) Drug Enforcement Agency
NOTES: On 1 July 2020, between Cartagena and Panama, Bolivar department, police forces, military forces of Colombia, and authorities from the United States, seized 7.5 tons of cocaine that where in a boat with Colombian flag. The drug belonged to the Gulf Clan.

On 7 July 2020, in Colombia, members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) proposed to the government of Colombia a bilateral ceasefire for three months in view of the coronavirus pandemic. A one-month ceasefire was previously established in April after the United Nations Secretary General asked armed groups for unilateral ceasefires during the pandemic.

Around 9 July 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of Cucuta, Norte de Santander, soldiers seized six rifles, 1,770 5.56 caliber cartridges, 891 7.62 caliber cartridges and 18 suppliers, war material used in the disputes against members of the National Liberation Army (ELN). The material and firearms found were from Los Rastrojos Gang. No arrests were made.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
NOTES: On 15 July 2020, in a rural area of Mutata, Antioquia department, around 100 former FARC members arrived after leaving a reincorporation zone in Ituango due to violence. Former FARC members left the Saint Lucia Territorial Training and Re-Entry Space (ETCR), where they returned to civilian life after the signing of the peace agreement in November 2016.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former AUC: United Self-Defence Forces of Colombia
NOTES: On 16 July 2020, in a rural area of Monteria, Cordoba department, around six unidentified armed individuals arrived to the house of a former member of the United Self-Defence Forces of Colombia (AUC). The house was partially damaged by the shooting. The former member of the AUC was not in the property. No injuries or fatalities reported.

SOURCE: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz; El Espectador
NOTES: On 7 August 2020, in the rural area of Vistahermosa, Meta department, local communities of Guayabero reported the arrival of several military units and other unidentified armed individuals. Witnesses claimed the groups were working together and threatened several of the residents including a journalist who was reporting the event.

Around 31 August 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of the Segovia municipality, Antioquia department, a group of 30 armed individuals arrived and threatened residents, in the Campoalegre community, firing guns into the air. There is a presence of members of the Gulf Clan and the LIbertadores del Norte in the area. Soldiers were deployed to the area.

On 1 September 2020, in a rural area of the Caceres municipality, Antioquia department, around 750 people were displaced from the Isla de la Amargura community after armed individuals arrived and threatened all residents. There is a presence of members of Los Caparros and the Gulf Clan in the area.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Colombia (2018-) UNP: National Unit for Protection
NOTES: Around 15 September 2020 (month of), near El Carmen municipality, Norte de Santander department, suspected ELN members stole two bullet-proof vehicles trucks that belonged to the UNP-Police.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - Second Marquetalia: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Segunda Marquetalia)
NOTES: Around 6 October 2020 (as reported), in Popayan, Cauca department, in a security operation Military Forces arrested a FARC dissident, leader of the Second Marquetalia dissident faction, in Los Naranjos neighbourhood.

SOURCE: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
NOTES: On 11 October 2020, in Bogota-Usaquen, Bogota D.C., a group of six people identified as police officers raided the private house of a human rights activist and member of a peace commission. The armed men inspected the building and took private cellphones with them. The Inter-American Commission on Human Rights has interim measures for the victim and his family.

ACTOR2: GUP: United Guerrillas of the Pacific
NOTES: Around 15 October 2020 (month of), in the maritime area of la Bocana Amarales, La Tola municipality, Narino department, the military forces of Colombia seized a submarine loaded with two tons of cocaine. The drugs reportedly belonged to the United Guerrillas of the Pacific. Three people were arrested, including one Mexican and one Ecuadorian citizens.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 33rd Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (33rd Front)
NOTES: Around 21 October 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of the Tibu municipality, Norte de Santander department, military forces and police seized a laboratory with half a ton of cocaine, 200 kilograms of chopped coca leaf, 470 kilograms of coca paste, and several plastic cans. The complex belonged to the FARC dissident faction 33rd. No arrests were made.

Around 21 October 2020, in Santiago, Norte de Santander, police forces arrested the presumed leader of the EPL. According to official sources, the leader led a group of at least 385 EPL members. Sources did no report armed clashes or injured.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former FARC: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia
NOTES: Around 26 October 2020, in Villavicencio, Meta department, government representatives held a meeting with 20 leaders of former FARC fighters. The group met as several FARC demobilized members organized a national protest to demand guarantees from the government to fulfill the Peace Agreement of 2016, including the protection of former FARC guerrilla members.

Around 27 October 2020 (as reported), in the Antioquia department [coded to Medellin], authorities reported that the Gulf Clan and the Los Caparros gang are receiving resources from the Sinaloa Cartel and the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, respectively. Although the meddle of Mexican cartels in Colombia had been previously identified, the groups are now actively contributing with provisions, including guns and monetary support, to carrying out a turf-war in the rural areas of the department.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - Second Marquetalia: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Segunda Marquetalia)
NOTES: Around 27 October 2020 (as reported), in the Cauca department (coded to Popayan), military officers reported the arrest of one of the leaders of the FARC Dissident faction Second Marquetalia in this department along with another 12 members. According to the military forces, this arrest disarticulates the action of this dissident faction in the Cauca department.

Around 28 October 2020, military forces reported the deployment of additional troops in the rural areas of the Montes de Maria (Serrania de San Lucas). The operation includes members of the military forces and police forces. This decision followed the recent killings of 5 social leaders in the rural area of Sucre department (Sincelejo).

Around 28 October 2020 (as reported), in the rural area of El Carmen De Bolivar municipality, Bolivar department, a grenade and landmine planted by an unidentified armed group was defused by the military forces.

Around 30 October 2020, in the Magdalena department [coded to Santa Marta], the armed group Los Pachencas Gang made a public statement in which they claimed their links with the current governor of the Magdalena department. In the video, the group claimed the politician paid the armed organization to win the elections in the past, including the mayor office of Santa Marta. The group claimed they used extorsion on voters to facilitate the victory of the candidate.

Around 4 November 2020 (week of), in the rural area of Riosucio municipality, Choco department, members of the Gulf Clan blocked access of two medical missions who were traveling to indigenous communities of the department. The group of health professionals was forced to return to the town.

SOURCE: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
NOTES: On 8 November 2020, in Jiguamiando, rural area of Curbarado municipality, Choco department, 50 members of the Gulf Clan arrived with guns and set a camp near a community. The armed men demanded a list of the residents of the CAMERUJ indigenous reserve.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - 48th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (48th Front - Pedro Martinez)
NOTES: Around 8 November 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of the Villagarzon municipality, Putumayo department, military forces seized more than 1,000 kilograms of cocaine hidden in a truck driving on a rural road. The drugs belonged to the FARC dissident faction 48th.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - Oliver Sinisterra Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Oliver Sinisterra Front)
NOTES: Around 13 November 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of the Francisco Pizarro municipality [coded to Salahonda], Narino department, military forces, and police seized a laboratory with 2,543 kilograms of cocaine. The complex belonged to the FARC dissident faction Oliver Sinisterra. No arrests were made.

Around 18 November 2020 (as reported), in the Choco department (reported to Quibdo), the ELN changed its leadership following the death of one of its high-ranking members. The new commander, known in the group as ''La Abuela'' is in charge of the West Front of War (Frente de Guerra Occidental), with nearly 178 men under her command.

On 20 November 2020, in the rural area of Taraza, Antioquia department, suspected members of Los Caparros used two trucks to block the route that connects the rural communities with the departmental capital of Medellin. The group declared a forced curfew in the region following the death of a high-rank commander in a military operation. The group forbade all movement of merchandise or civilians for a lapse of three days.

Around 20 November 2020, in the rural area of Caceres, Antioquia department, residents reported the movement of Los Caparros members in the area. Due to this activity, mass displacement is underway in the Buenos Aires vereda, and over 222 people have sought shelter at Caceres.

Around 23 November 2020, in the rural area of Cienaga, Magdalena department, suspected members of the ELN set fire to a truck. Reports claimed the victim refused to pay an extorsion for the armed group. No injuries were reported.

Around 27 November 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of the Tibu municipality, Norte de Santander department, military forces seized two laboratories with 1,144 of kilograms of cocaine. The laboratory belong to the National Liberation Army (ELN). No arrests were made.

Around 7 December 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of the San Luis municipality, Antioquia department, in the context of an ongoing military operation in the rural areas of the municipalities of San Luis and San Francisco, military forces seized several laboratories to produce cocaine. In total 11 construction were destroyed. There is the presence of Gulf Clan, ELN, and other armed organizations in the area. No arrests were made.

Around 7 December 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of the San Francisco municipality, Antioquia department, in the context of an ongoing military operation in the rural areas of the municipalities of San Luis and San Francisco, military forces seized several laboratories to produce cocaine. In total, 11 facilities were destroyed. There is the presence of Gulf Clan, ELN, and other armed organizations in the area. No arrests were made.

Around 9 December 2020 (as reported), in Argelia, Cauca department, the military forces reached an illegal agreement of non-aggression with other armed groups in the area. The accusations were made public by a lawmaker member of the U party. According to the politician, there is a reduced report of armed clashes in the area despite a dramatic increase of violence against civilians. Armed organizations that operate in the area such as ELN, FARC dissident faction, among others, seek political control in the region with the endorsement of military forces.

SOURCE: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
NOTES: Around 10 December 2020, in the rural area of Puerto Leguizamo municipality, Putumayo department, residents reported the recruitment of several young members of the community by the CDF armed group. Furthermore, witnesses claimed they observed amicable interactions between members of the armed organization and soldiers of the military forces of Colombia.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - Second Marquetalia: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Segunda Marquetalia)
NOTES: Around 11 December 2020 (as reported), in the department of Meta (coded to Villavicencio), sources reported the expansion of operations of the FARC dissident faction Second Marquetalia towards areas controlled by the FARC dissident Faction 1st Front in the Meta and Guaviare department. According to the report, Second Marquetalia leaders unsuccessfully have been trying to established negotiations with the commander of the latter.

Around 12 December 2020, in the department of Bolivar (coded to Cartagena), police forces carried out the ''Neptuno'' operation which resulted in the arrest of at least 43 active members of the Gulf Clan. The operation took place in the municipalities of Magangue, San Jacinto, Marialabaja, El Carmen de Bolivar in Bolivar, and Tolu (Sucre department) and Plato (Magdalena department).

On 14 December 2020, in Palmarito, in the rural area of Cucuta municipality, Norte de Santander department, residents reported the arrival of nearly 100 armed men that identified themselves as members of the Los Rastrojos gang. According to the report, the men are looking to expand their illegal activities to the urban area of the city of Cucuta.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - Alfonso Cano Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Alfonso Cano Front)
NOTES: Around 20 December 2020, in the rural area of Tumaco municipality, Narino department, military forces seized a laboratory with more than 2,026 kilograms of cocaine. The facilities belonged to the FARC dissident Faction Alfonso Cano (formerly known as Oliver Sinisterra Front) and it had several materials to produce cocaine. No arrests were reported.

Looting: On 21 December 2020, in Barrancabermeja (Santander), unidentified armed individuals broke into the private residence of two local leaders, who are also human rights activists. Perpetrators stole computers, SD cards, notebooks, and other material that contained information regarding human rights abuses in the region. This is the second time the activists are victims of a similar attack, with the first event taking place in 2011.

SOURCE: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
NOTES: Around 22 December 2020, in the rural area of Buenaventura municipality, Narino department, the community in the area El Pinal reported an increasing movement of troops from armed organizations such as Gente del Orden gang, La Local, among others armed groups in the area. Witnesses claimed unidentified armed individuals set up a camp near the community of Puente Nayero on 3 December 2021.

On 27 December 2020, in Caldono, Cauca department, members of the indigenous Nasa community reported the destruction of a political and religious room used by the community. The group claimed the event was sabotage against the community and the perpetrators are members of an armed group that carries out operations in the area such as FARC dissidents, ELN, Gulf Clan, among others. No fatalities or injuries reported.

Around 28 December 2020, in the rural areas of Tibu municipality, Norte de Santander department, local farmers reported the movement of troops of the Gulf Clan. According to a press release, the armed organization is looking to overtaking territory from the Los Rastrojos gang.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - 36th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (36th Front - Jair Aldana Baquero)
NOTES: On 29 December 2020, near Puerto Valdivia, suspected FARC dissidents of the 36th Front set fire to four trucks in The La Paulina area. The armed men used the vehicles to block the traffic in the freeway that connects the department of Antioquia with the Caribbean coast. No fatalities or injuries reported.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - Carlos Patino Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Carlos Patino Front)
NOTES: Around 7 January 2021 (as reported), in the rural areas of the Cauca department (coded to Popayan), local social leaders reported the movement of troops of the FARC dissident Faction Carlos Patino. According to the civilians, the armed group has forced the communities of rural areas such as San Juan de Micay, Zabaleta, Betania, and Honduras to take part in political meetings as the armed organization is looking to overtaking territory from the ELN and military forces.

Around 8 January 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Bojaya, Choco department, a community of indigenous people reported increasing intimidations from unidentified armed individuals who set up camp near the community. Residents claimed they men restricted them to carry out everyday activities such as fishing or working in the fields. The restrictions have affected the 512 residents since October 2020. There is a presence of multiple armed organizations in the area.

Movement of forces: Around 10 January 2021, in the rural area of Tibu municipality, Norte de Santander department, members of the Gulf Clan set up a camp near the El Ambato area. The group restricted everyday activities for nearly 256 residents, causing the displacement of at least 64 people. By 14 January 2021, nearby communities, such as La Silla, Totumito-Carboneras and El Empalme, reported an increasing movement of troops from this armed group.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - Dagoberto Ramos: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Dagoberto Ramos)
NOTES: Around 10 January 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Caloto municipality, Cauca department, military forces defused four IEDs planted by suspected members of the Dagoberto Ramos FARC Dissident Faction. The explosives were located 300 meters from a powerplant that provides energy to various municipalities in the area.

On 15 January 2021, in the rural area of Sopetran municipality, Antioquia department, in the context of an ongoing military operation in the rural areas, military forces seized and destroyed a laboratory to produce cocaine in San Jose village. The group found 55 kilograms of cocaine and 1,5 tons of supplies to produce drugs. The facilities would belong to the Gulf Clan. Soldiers arrested nine people.

Around 23 January 2021 (weekend of), during an online general assembly of the FARC political party (coded to Bogota), the organization reported changing its political name to Comunes. The group announced this decision followed several critics in which the former name was associate with still active armed groups. Party leaders claimed such a connection endangered the security of their members, who are mostly former FARC fighters.

Around 24 January 2021, in the rural area of Sardinata municipality, Norte de Santander department, in the context of an ongoing military operation in the rural areas, military forces seized and destroyed a laboratory from the ELN used to produce cocaine. The facilities could fabricate nearly 1.1 tons of cocaine per month. The group also seized more than 1,475 kilograms of supplies and 1,900 gallons of gasoline. No arrests reported.

Around 25 January 2021, in the road that connects Tibu and El Zulia, Norte de Santander department, unidentified armed individuals who identified themselves as EPL members set fire to a bus of public service in the Aguasal area. The armed men used the vehicle to block the traffic. No fatalities or injuries reported.

On 25 January 2021, near the Pueblo Rico municipality, Risaralda department, two unidentified armed individuals on a motorcycle stopped two civilians in the route Quibdo-Pereira. The men forced the couple out of the vehicle and subsequently set it on fire. No fatalities or injuries reported. There is a presence of several armed groups in this area.

Around 25 January 2021 (as reported), in El Salado, Carmen de Bolivar municipality, Bolivar department, military forces reported the deployment of at least 500 additional troops. The decision followed the distribution of pamphlets by an armed group threatening several social leaders and other prominent members of the community.

Mass grave: On 26 January 2021, in Bogota, Bogota DC., authorities found a mass grave with the remains of at least 26 people. A commission of experts discovered the burying place as they searched for a victim of forced disappearance in 1995. There is no further information about the identity of the victims or potential perpetrators.

Around 30 January 2021, in the rural area of Cumbitara municipality, Narino department, in the context of an ongoing military operation in the rural areas, military and police forces seized and destroyed a laboratory to produce cocaine. The group found 2,800 kilograms of cocaine, 600 cocaine paste, sleeping areas for nearly 30 people, among other pieces of equipment. The facilities belonged to the ELN. No arrests reported.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - Carolina Ramirez Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Carolina Ramirez Front)
NOTES: Around 30 January 2021, in the rural area of Puerto Leguizamo municipality, Putumayo department, seven members of the Carolina Ramirez FARC dissident faction surrendered in the context of an ongoing military operation. Security forces seized 6 fusils, guns, military gear, and communication equipment and documents. No fatalities reported.

SOURCE: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz
NOTES: Around 1 February 2021, in the rural area of Curbarado municipality, Choco department, local communities reported the presence of several members of the military forces of Colombia carrying out military operations in the areas El Caballito, Las Menas, and Bajira. Witnesses claimed military soldiers held four residents against their will for several hours.

Displacement: On 2 February 2021, in the rural area of Litoral de San Juan municipality, Choco department, 38 families residents of the rural area of Hacari fled to the municipal seat, following the set up of a military base near their vereda. Communities raised concerns about potential clashes between armed groups. There is a presence of several armed groups in the Catatumbo subregion.

Displacement: On 2 February 2021, in the rural area of Buenaventura municipality, Valle del Cauca department, mass displacement was underway after residents reported the presence of an armed group in the area of San Antonito and Las Juntas. 28 families had fled, while 157 more are confined in their houses.

Around 2 February 2021, in Magdalena department (coded to Santa Marta), the political party FC and several social organizations reported the movement of troops and rearmament of paramilitary groups, particularly in 48 veredas of the Sierra Nevada sub-region. Concerns were raised following the return to the country, on 25 January 2021, of the former commander from the now disbanded Tayrona Resistance Block from the AUC, after serving several years in prison in the United States.

Around 2 February 2021, (coded to Bogota), police forces reported the arrest of 229 members of several armed organizations across the country, including members of the Gulf Clan and La Terraza gang. In the context of the police operation 'Cazador', officers carried out over 42 searches in Villavicencio (Meta), Medellin (Antioquia), Pereira (Risaralda), Valle Del Cauca department, among other areas in the country.

SOURCE: Comision Intereclesial de Justicia y Paz; El Colombiano; Vanguardia Liberal
NOTES: Around 6 February 2021, in the rural area of Murindo municipality, Antioquia department, Embera indigenous communities from the indigenous reserve areas Rio Murindo and Rio Chagerado reported that members of the ELN planted landmines in the surrounding areas of the reserves. The communities received previous threats demanding them to leave the territory. Subsequently, the armed group blocked the mobility of the residents with the explosives. Over 2,000 indigenous peoples have restricted mobility and lack access to basic services due to the mines.

Around 6 February 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Hacari municipality, Norte de Santander department, 98 people, mostly farmers, were displaced from the corregimientos Mesitas and San Miguel. The group sought shelter following an increase of armed clashes and violence between armed groups due to the destruction of coca crops from security forces. There is a presence of several armed groups in the Catatmbo sub-region.

Around 9 February 2021 (from 4 - 9 February), in Buenaventura Valle del Cauca department, mass displacement is underway after residents reported increasing clashes between armed groups that operate in the urban area of the municipality. According to the local Ombudsman office, over 300 people have sought shelter, following curfew restrictions and clashes among members of groups such as the ELN, the Gulf Clan, FARC dissidents, and other armed groups.

Around 10 February 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Gaitania corregimiento, Planadas municipality, Tolima department, military forces defused two landmines planted in the Alto Sano vereda. No fatalities or injuries reported.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: FARC Dissident - 36th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (36th Front - Jair Aldana Baquero); Gulf Clan
NOTES: Around 10 February 2021, in the rural area of Caceres municipality, Antioquia department, Zenu indigenous people reported an increased presence of troops from the ELN, Gulf Clan, and members of the 36th FARC dissident Faction in the Jose de Los Santos, Isla la Dulzura, Guarumo Balay, Puerto Santo Manantial, Jardin la Esperanza and Alto del Tigre indigenous reserve areas. Civilians claimed over 231 families have mobility restrictions.

Displacement: Around 14 February 2021 (between 14 February - 16 February), in the rural area of Ituango municipality, Antioquia department, mass displacement was underway after residents reported the presence of military forces in the El Quindio, Quebrada del Medio, Las Aranas, and El Alto del Limon veredas. According to local leaders, multiple residents received calls from an unidentified armed group, demanding the farmers to leave the area. Subsequently, the arrival of security forces increased fears of armed clashes between the military and members of armed groups, such as the Gulf Clan and FARC dissident factions, leading to a displacement of at least 257 people.

Property destruction: Around 18 February 2021, in the rural area of Sardinata municipality, Norte de Santander department, in the context of an ongoing military operation in the rural areas, military forces seized and destroyed a laboratory to produce cocaine. The group found 285 kilograms of cocaine and 2,2 tons of supplies to produce drugs. The facilities would belong to the ELN.

Displacement: Around 19 February 2021 (between 19 February - 21 February), in the rural area of Alto Baudo municipality, Choco department, mass displacement was underway after residents reported armed clashes between Gulf Clan and ELN members. 2,893 Embera indigenous people had fled the area, while 4,741 are confined in their houses in the Maomia indigenous reserve land.

Security measures: On 20 February 2021, in Andes, Antioquia department, a military post was installed by the Ministry of Defense. Security forces claimed they aim to put an end to the presence of armed groups that operate in the Southwest of Antioquia. The decision followed a series of reports on massacres against civilians carried out by armed organizations in the rural areas of the municipality.

Security measures: On 20 February 2021, in Bolombolo, Venecia municipality, Antioquia department, a military post was installed by the Ministry of Defense. Security forces claimed they aim to put an end to the presence of armed groups that operate in the Southwest of Antioquia.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: Weapons seizure: Around 24 February 2021, in the rural area of Vista Hermosa municipality (coded to Vistahermosa), Meta department, military forces found and destroyed a warehouse used to build IEDs. Security forces seized several pieces of equipment to assemble explosives and nearly 254 bombs. The facilities belonged to a FARC dissident faction.

Displacement: Around 25 February 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of El Aro corregimiento, Ituango municipality, Antioquia department, at least 20 farmers' families fled from their houses after an unidentified armed group distributed a list of farmers that have to abandon the area. There is a presence of FARC dissident factions and Gulf Clan members in this zone.

Movement of forces: On 26 February 2021, in Bogota D.C. (coded to Bogota), an elite force task came into operation within the military forces, with the aim of fighting drug cartels and transnational criminal organizations. Government officials claimed the task force has over 7,000 highly trained soldiers.

Property destruction: On 1 March 2021, in El Bagre, Antioquia department, suspected ELN members set fire to a private vehicle and vandalized several stores. There is a presence of Gulf Clan members and Caparros members in the Bajo Cauca sub-region. Resident warned about possible movement of ELN troops to the area.

Arrests: Around 1 March 2021, in a rural road of San Cayetano, Norte de Santander, security forces arrested a commander and leading Gulf Clan member. According to the source, there were nearly 200 men under his command.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident - Gentil Duarte Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Gentil Duarte Front)
NOTES: Property destruction: Around 3 March 2021, near Puerto Flores corregimiento, San Jose Del Guaviare municipality, Guaviare department, military forces shut down 30 kilometers of an illegal road built by the FARC dissident faction Gentil Duarte. The structure included two wooden bridges. According to local authorities, it was used to move drug supplies through the Amazon area.

Displacement: On 3 March 2021, in the rural area of Bagado municipality, Choco department, mass displacement was underway after Embera indigenous people of the Tahami indigenous reserve land reported the presence of an armed group in the area. 73 families had fled towards Puerto Rico (Risaralda).

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - Second Marquetalia: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (Segunda Marquetalia)
NOTES: Movement of forces: Around 4 March 2021, FARC dissident forces of the New Marquetalia reported the expansion of their troops in the Montes de Maria sub-region (coded to Cartagena). The group released a statement claiming that the decision to institute a front in the Caribbean coast was taken during the annual meeting of commanders that took place between 4 to 6 March 2021.

Property destruction: On 5 March 2021, on the route that connects Ocana municipality and Cucuta, Norte de Santander department, armed men that identified themselves as ELN members stopped the traffic and subsequently placed a truck across the road.
