On 2 October 2019, in Brus Laguna, Gracias a Dios, Military Forces of Honduras found an illegal airplane used to transport cocaine. It is believed that the plane hit an animal on its landing, because its structure was broken.
On 2 October 2019, in Trojes, El Paraiso, Police Forces of Honduras seized and destroyed a 15.000 plants crop of marijuana.
On 4 October 2019, in Brus Laguna, Gracias a Dios, Military Forces of Honduras found and destroyed two illegal airstrips.

On 7 October 2019, in Iriona, Colon, Police and Military Forces of Honduras found and seized a submerged narco plane nearby the town's beaches. Part of the drug was taken by a group of around 400 inhabitants and the local associations are mediating to convince people of returning the drug to the authorities.
On 9 October 2019, in La Union, Olancho, Police Forces of Honduras seized and burned 30,000 marijuana plants in a crop and 1,000 getting dried.
On 13 October 2019, in San Antonio, Copan, an unknown group of individuals burned the municipality building at midnight. The municipality was threatened and received extortion messages weeks before.

On 20 October 2019, in Saba, Colon, Police Forces of Honduras seized some houses and shops of the criminal organization led by Ilvis Omar Herrera in the framework of Operacion Optimus. The criminal organization is related to narco business. 14 raids and 2 inspections were conducted in La Ceiba, Saba and Olanchito.

On 20 October 2019, in La Ceiba, Atlantida, Police Forces of Honduras seized some houses and shops of the criminal organization led by Ilvis Omar Herrera in the framework of Operacion Optimus. The criminal organization is related to narco business. 14 raids and 2 inspections were conducted in La Ceiba, Saba and Olanchito.

On 20 October 2019, in Olanchito, Yoro, Police Forces of Honduras seized some houses and shops of the criminal organization led by Ilvis Omar Herrera in the framework of Operacion Optimus. The criminal organization is related to narco business. 14 raids and 2 inspections were conducted in La Ceiba, Saba and Olanchito.
On 21 October 2019, in Brus Laguna, Gracias a Dios, Military Forces of Honduras seized and destroyed an illegal airstrip.

On 22 October 2019, in Tocoa, Colon, Military Forces of Honduras seized a marihuana crop of around 5,000 plants.

On 22 October 2019, in San Pedro Sula, Police Forces of Honduras arrested a man in the airport trying to bring 1500 22 calibre bullets into the country. The man arrested has double nationality Honduras - United States of America.

On 22 October 2019, in rural area of La Masica, Atlantida, unidentified perpetrators sabotaged an energy transmission line of the National Electricity Company (ENEE) by intentionally cutting a tree to break the line. Most of the departments of the country were left with no electricity.
On 22 October 2019, in Brus Laguna, Gracias a Dios, Military Forces of Honduras seized and destroyed an illegal airstrip.

On 23 October 2019, in Tocoa, Colon, Military Forces of Honduras seized a significant area of marihuana crops of around 15,000 plants, plus 2,000 plants been dried. A 16-year-old boy was arrested. Two motorcycles and a bag of weed were confiscated.
On 25 October 2019, in Brus Laguna, Gracias a Dios, Military Forces of Honduras destroyed an illegal airstrip.

NOTES: On 30 October 2019, in La Ceiba, Atlantida, Police Forces of Honduras seized three houses that belong to Los Grillos criminal organization.

On 28 November 2019, in Atlantida department, Police Forces of Guatemala seized several properties and goods of Los Valle Valle Gang. During a single operation in Atlantida and Cortes, the Police seized 13 properties, three companies, and made several arrests.

On 22 January 2020, in Santa Rosa de Copan, Copan, Police Forces of Honduras deployed Operation Redada 2, against Los Valle Valle gang. On 16 February 2020, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, Police Forces of Honduras seized and dismantle an operations centre of the MS-13. According to the report, the finding seems to be related to the operation led the week before to free 'El Porky', leader of the MS-13. Four people were arrested.

It is believed that neighbours took away the cocaine after the crash. The airplane had a Colombian identification number.

Security measures: On 2 April 2020, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, in light of the coronavirus pandemic, the government ordered absolute curfew and allows the population to stock up on food only on Monday, Wednesday and Friday. On 10 April the government extended the curfew until 19 April for the departments of Colon, Cortes and the city of El Progreso, Yoro. On 11 April the Red Alert and the curfew was declared for the whole country until 19 April. On 19 April, the curfew was extended until 25 April from 10pm to 5am.
On 15 April 2020, in rural area of Brus Laguna, Gracias a Dios, military forces found and destroyed an airstrip used for drugs trafficking.
Around 15 April 2020 (between 14 April - 17 April), in rural area of Tocoa, Colon, police forces seized and destroyed a crop of around 4,500 marijuana plants and over 15 pounds of seeds.
On 20 April 2020, in Brus Laguna, Gracias a Dios, military forces found and destroyed a clandestine airstrip used for durgs trafficking. The military used explosives to destroy the airstrip.

SOURCE: El Heraldo (Honduras); La Tribuna (Honduras); Proceso Digital; GardaWorld
NOTES: Security measures: On 17 March 2021, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, the government ordered absolute curfew from 10pm to 5am as part of coronavirus related measures. On 12 April the government extended the curfew until 18 April. On 25 April the government extended the curfew until 9 May in 18 departments of the country. In Olancho, the curfew starts at 8pm to 5am and people are allowed leave their homes according to the last digits on their ID cards. The curfew and mobility measures extend until 10 May. On 28 June, the government extended the curfew until 11 July from 10pm to 5am. On 12 July 2021, the curfew was extended to 18 July from 10pm to 5am. On 19 July 2021, the curfew was extended until 25 July from 10pm to 5am. On 26 July, the curfew was extended until 1 August from 10pm to 5am. On 8 August, the curfew was extended to 15 August. On 27 September, the curfew was extended to 3 October.

Property destruction: On 24 May 2021, in the municipality of Tocoa, Colon, police officers found a plantation of marijuana and seized around 25,000 plants.

On 6 June 2021, in La Union, El Porvenir, Atlantida, one of the main leaders of Los Grillos Gang was arrested by the police forces during a security operation supported also by the military forces. The gang leader is accused of drug dealing and murder.

Property destruction: On 8 June 2021, in Tocoa municipality, Colon, police forces seized and destroyed 1500 marihuana plants in Las Mangas rural area. Information on the group associated to the crop is unknown.

Property destruction: On 12 June 2021, in the municipality of Iriona, Colon, military offices seized a coca plantation with more than 70,000 coca leaf bushes in the sector Rio Verde.

Property destruction: On 28 June 2021, in Tocoa municipality, Colon, police forces seized and destroyed 634 marihuana plants in Las Mangas rural area. Police officers also found a narcolab. Information on the group associated to the crop is unknown.

Property destruction: On 20 July 2021, close to Iriona, Colon, police officers seized a narco laboratory with more than 50,000 alleged coca plants in the National Park Rio Tinto in Nueva Santa Barbara.

Property destruction: On 21 July 2021, in Brus Laguna, Gracias a Dios, military forces seized and destroyed a clandestine landing strip used for drug trafficking. The strip was 1050 meters long and 30 meters wide.

Property destruction: On 23 July 2021, close to San Jose del Boqueron, Cortes, police forces seized and destroyed a narco laboratory of the MS-13 in the aldea El Ocotillo. 100,000 crack rocks were seized and eight members of the MS-13 were arrested.

Property destruction: On 29 July 2021, in Tocoa municipality, Colon, police forces seized and destroyed around 2000 marihuana plants hidden in corn fields in Las Mangas rural area. Information on the group associated to the crop is unknown.
Defusal: On 4 August 2021, in Olanchito, Yoro, police officers seized and destroyed and anti-tank grenade and an anti tank rocket launcher from a citizen allegedly involved in drug trafficking.
Property destruction: On 5 August 2021, in the municipality of Tocoa, Colon, police officers seized and destroyed 9900 marihuana plants in the Garay aldea. No arrests were reported.
Property destruction: On 9 August 2021, close to Tocoa, Colon, military officers seized and destroyed a marihuana plantation in the Garay aldea.
Property destruction: On 11 August 2021, close to Iriona, Colon, police officers seized and destroyed a coca bush plantation and dismantled a narco laboratory in Sambita.

Property destruction: On 12 August 2021, in the municipality of Juan Francisco Bulnes (coded to capital Palacios), Gracias a Dios, police officers seized and destroyed a coca plantation and narco laboratory in the sector Guapote.

Looting: On 5 September 2021, in the municipality of Iriona (coded to Iriona), Colon, police forces seized an estimate of 8,000 coca plants and arrested five suspects. The plants were destroyed by officials during an operation carried out in the same place on 12 September.

Property destruction: On 12 September 2021, in the municipality of Iriona (coded to Iriona), Colon, police forces destroyed a drug laboratory alongside an estimate of 8,000 coca plants, located in a mountainous area. It was reported that the plants destroyed were seized by police officers on 5 September 2021, arresting five suspects during the operation.

Property destruction: On 17 September 2021, in Ahuas municipality (coded to Ahuas), Gracias a Dios, military forces seized and destroyed a clandestine landing strip used for drug trafficking near the Wawina sector. No arrests were reported.

On 8 October 2021, in San Marcos de Colon, Chulateca, police forces arrested 26 Nicaraguan migrants in the community of San Diego. There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: On 15 October 2021, near Iriona, Colon, police forces eradicated around 49,400 coca leaf bushes, 42,550 nursery plants and a drug-laboratory situated in a mountainous area of the sector Quebrada El Salado. The Operation was coordinated by the Armed Forces within the framework of Fusina, where the Joint Task Force Xatruch and the Directorate for the Fight Against Drug Trafficking (DLCN) participated. There were no fatalities.

On 16 October 2021, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, police forces of the National Force against Maras and Pandillas (FNAMP) arrested one of the main coordinators of the gang B-18 in San Pedro Sula, in the residencial Villas de San Antonio. According to reports, the man has Salvadoran origins, and also had a criminal record in the USA.

On 17 October 2021, in Siguatepeque, Comayagua, police forces of the National Force against Maras and Pandillas (FNAMP) arrested one of the main coordinators of drug distribution for the gang Mara Salvatrucha in Comayagua, in the residencial Lomas de San Fernando. The man had a history of more than 20 years working for the gang.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Honduras (2010-); PNH: National Party of Honduras
SOURCE: La Prensa (Honduras); La Tribuna (Honduras); HCH; El Heraldo (Honduras)
NOTES: On 18 October 2021, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, police forces arrested the mayor of Talanga (Francisco Morazan) for the National Party (PNH) and members of his family including his wife, sister, mother-in-law and brother-in-law on drug trafficking and money laundering charges. Investigations by the Directorate for the Fight against Drug Trafficking and the Special Prosecutor's Office against Organized Crime concluded that Avilez and members of his family laundered more than 320 million lempiras resources that came from drug trafficking. The arrest comes ahead of the general elections in which the mayor's son was expected to run for the same office. According to reports, the mayor has not been present in the day-to-day governing of the municipality for years allegedly only dropping by his office for necessary matters. A generalized feeling of fear among the residents of Talanga to speak out against the abuses of the mayor due to his criminal affiliations was also reported by various news outlets.

Looting: On 20 October 2021, near El Progreso, Yoro, police forces seized a truck transporting 3,200 pounds of marijuana (around 1.6 tons) and arrested three people involved in the drug trafficking operation.

On 20 October 2021, in La Ceiba, Atlantida, police forces arrested the right hand man of the head of the Atlantic Cartel in a hotel in the center of the city. According to reports, the arrested was acting as replacement to the cartel boss given that the latter's arrest and extradition warrant.

SOURCE: La Tribuna (Honduras); El Heraldo (Honduras); HCH; La Prensa (Honduras)
NOTES: Property destruction: On 23 October 2021, near Tocoa, Colon, police forces seized and destroyed 2,500 marijuana plants in the aldea Vado Ancho within the framework of the operation 'Omega X'.

Looting: On 24 October 2021, in San Lorenzo, Valle, police forces seized a ton of marijuana transported in the wooden bases of beds. According to the authorities there is a relationship between this seizure and another one occurred the same day in Santa Rita, Yoro, as both drugs were being trafficked from Colon and were transported using the same method.

Looting: On 24 October 2021, in Santa Rita, Yoro, police forces seized 254 packages of marijuana transported in the wooden bases of beds. According to the authorities there is a relationship between this seizure and another one occurred the same day in San Lorenzo, Valle, as both drugs were being trafficked from Colon and were transported using the same method.

Looting: On 24 October 2021, near Iriona, Colon, police forces seized a coca plantation and two narco-labs that were used for the production of coca paste in a mountainous area of Quebrada de la Mina.
Property destruction: On 30 October 2021, near Tocoa, Colon, police and military forces seized and eradicated around 4,500 marijuana plants in the caserio Garay of the Cauca jurisdiction.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former Military Forces of Honduras (2010-); MIDE: Independent Movement Dignity and Hope
NOTES: On 4 November 2021, near Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, police officers arrested one of the presidential candidates for MIDE movement who is also a retired military officer at the Toncontin airport on money laundering charges and seized his properties including estate, cars and companies he owned. His wife was also arrested. In separate operations, police forces also arrested other members of the candidate' family who are accused of money laundry. According to reports, the arrested is accused of not declaring the entirety of the money and drugs that were seized under his responsibility while in office and of illegally appropriating them. Also the candidate is accused of being involved in homicides. The brother of the candidate was arrested in the US under similar charges.

On 4 November 2021, in Santa Rosa de Copan, Copan, police forces arrested the mother-in-aw of one of the presidential candidates for the upcoming elections scheduled for November 28 on money laundering charges. In separate operations in other municipalities, police forces also arrested the presidential candidate and his wife (coded separately). There were no fatalities.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: ACI-PARTICIPA: Association for a Participative Citizenry
NOTES: Property destruction: On 5 November 2021, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, unidentified men set fire to the house of the general coordinator of the Association for Participative Citizenry (ACI-PARTICIPA). The fire burned the front, furniture, roof and electrical cables of the house. According to reports, both the victim and the ACI-PARTICIPA organization have been the target of numerous threats, acts of violence and intimidation due to their work in the protection of human rights.
Looting: On 7 November 2021, near Iriona, Colon, police forces seized around 87,000 coca plantations and an unreported number of narco-labs in a mountainous area of the aldea Pedrogoza.

Looting: On 8 November 2021, near Iriona, Colon, police forces seized 142,000 coca plantations and a drug processing laboratory in a mountainous area of the aldea Pedragoza. It is worth mentioning that on Sunday 7 November 2021 another 87,000 coca plantations were seized in the same area (coded separately).

On 12 November 2021, in San Manuel, Cortes, police forces arrested a long-time member and leader of the gang Mara Salvatrucha (MS-13). The arrested has been a member of the organization for 25 years and it is believed to be coordinating criminal activities in the departments of Cortes, Comayagua and Yoro.

Looting: On 17 November 2021, in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, police forces seized a laboratory used by the gang MS-13 Mara Salvatrucha for making self-made explosives in the colonia Sabillon Cruz in the sector of Chamelecon. During the operation police forces seized 68 molotov bombs and material for the making of 500 molotov bombs, and arrested three members of the gang. According to reports, the bombs were ready to be used for political intimidation aims in the run-up to the next general elections.

Other: On 18 November 2021, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, National Congress (CN) approved a decree prohibiting the carrying of fire weapons 10 days before and 10 days after the general election scheduled for November 28. Violators will have their weapon confiscated for six months and will have to pay a fine of 10,000 lempiras.

On 19 November 2021, in Amarateca, Francisco Morazan, police forces arrested 46 Haitian, 10 Cubans, eight Cameroonians, seven Brazilians, five Venezuelans and one Ecuadorian for transiting without official migration papers. The arrests are part of a nation-wide operation nicknamed Omega XI which totaled the arrest of 91 migrants and the sanctioning of three companies arranging migrant transportation.
Looting: On 21 November 2021, outside Jutiapa, Atlantida, police forces seized 2.3 tons of cocaine in an underground storage in the aldea Diamante de Sion. There were no arrests.

On 2 December 2021, outside San Pedro Sula, Cortes, police forces arrested in the colonia La Reina, in Aldea El Carmen, the main distributor of drugs for the Mara Salvatrucha (MS-13) in San Pedro Sula who is also reported to be the leader of the gang in the Eastern part of the city.

Looting: On 3 December 2021, near Orocuina, Choluteca, police forces seized 3,000 pouches of marijuana that were being transported in a truck coming from the department of Olancho. The driver of the truck was taken into custody on drug trafficking charges.

Land seizure: Around 6 December 2021 (week of), near Tocoa, Colon, groups of armed farmers occupied over 11,000 hectares of African palm fields in production belonging to Agropalma, Dinant, Aceidesa, Salama and independent producers. Farmers and workers called for authorities to address the issue promptly, threatening to take to the streets in protest if their demands are not met. According to reports, these invasions have resulted in the dismissal of more than 1,200 employees from these companies.
On 2 January 2018, in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, a partial curfew was imposed until 6 January. No specific reason for the curfew reported.
On 19 January 2018, the Jamaican government declared a state of emergency, as well as imposed a curfew, in areas in the parish of St. James.

On 24 January 2018, in Kingston, Kingston, police found over 1800kg of marihuana in a trailer in Port Bustamante. The drugs were seized but no arrests were made.

On 23 February 2018, in Orange Hill, Westmoreland, police arrested 30 people in relation to the seizure of 300kg of marihuana of an estimated value of $2,8 million. The arrested people were preparing the marihuana for export.

On 4 March 2018, in Kingston, Kingston, one of the leading figures in the ongoing gang war between factions of the Clansman Gang was arrested by police forces. It is estimated that the intragang war between the two factions led to at least 100 killings in the 15 months leading up to the arrest.
On 9 March 2018, in Kingston, Kingston, officers of the Narcotics Division seized 1852 kilograms of marihuana inside a container in the Kingston Terminal. 1 person was arrested.

On 17 March 2018, in Saint Catherine parish (coded to Spanish Town), the state of public emergency that was previously declared in parts of the parish was expanded to include the northern part as well. The reason for the state of emergency is a spike in killings in the parish and lawlessness.

On 5 June 2018, in Spanish Town, St Catherine, the Jamaican government declared a state of emergency, as well as imposed a curfew, in the Gregory Park area until 11 June. Exact reason for curfew not reported.
On 7 June 2018, in Red Gal Ring, St Andrew, the Jamaican government imposed a curfew in the Cassava Piece community until 11 June. Reason for curfew is not reported.

On 22 June 2018, in Portmore, Saint Catherine, police officers assigned to the Counter-Terrorism and Organized Crime Investigations seized approximately 1043 kg (2,300 pounds) of marihuana in a house in West Cumberland.

On 17 July 2018, in Kingston, Kingston, the Zone of Special Operations (ZOSO) already active in parts of the capital since October 2017 was extended in time. The ZOSO in Denham Town and Mount Salem neighbourhoods were extended by 60 days following success in driving down the number of incidents of gun violence. According to the Prime minister knives, machetes and acid was still used to resolve gang disputes in the area.
On 22 July 2018, in Kingston, Saint Andrew, a curfew was imposed in an area around Ambrook Lane, Half Way Tree neighbourhood until 24 July. Reason for curfew is not reported.

On 22 August 2018, in Kingston, Saint Andrew, following the killing of the wife of a gang leader and in an attempt to stop any reprisal attacks for this killing, a curfew was imposed in an area around the Park Lane and 100 Lane, Red Hills until 24 August.

On 22 September 2018, in Kingston, Kingston, a state of emergency was declared in part of the Corporate Town area as a crime fighting measure. The state of emergency will be in place for 14 days and is the third one in place on the island.
On 10 October 2018, in a joint military and policy action in Westmoreland, Jamaica, 56 people allegedly part of the Kings Valley Gang were arrested.
On 5 October 2018, in Kingston, multiple houses were burnt down by gangs and left 20 people homeless in the Waterhouse neighbourhood.
On 20 January 2019, in August Town, Saint Andrew, the government imposed a curfew until 22 January 2019. There is no information about the reasons that justify this decision.
On 28 January 2019, in Barbary Hall, Saint Elizabeth, police stopped a van with 1000kg of marihuana on board. The drugs was seized and the driver arrested.
On 29 January 2019, in Kingston, Kingston, police imposed a curfew until 6Pm 2 February in August Town neighborhood. This parish has been the scenery of significant gang activity.

Security measures: On 3 February 2019, in Montego Bay, Saint James, the government imposed a curfew set to begin on 3 February 6pm until 5 February 6pm. The measure was imposed to answer the ongoing escalation gang violence.

On 4 February 2019, in Kingston, Kingston, a two-day curfew was imposed n the Swallowfield area, during which people are forced to stay indoors during the hours of the curfew. Also in in August Town neighborhood a two days curfew was imposed due to ongoing gun violence in the neighbourhood.
On 9 February 2019, in Central Village, Saint Catherine, the government imposed a curfew until 11 February 2019 in response to an ongoing gang war. Several people were arrested.

On 19 February 2019, in Kingston, Kingston, a two-day curfew was imposed on parts of August Town in response to gun violence in this area. During the curfew hours people are not allowed to leave their homes.

On 23 April 2019, in Kingston, Kingston, a curfew was imposed on the Denham Town neighbourhood to curb gang activities in the area. The residents of the area are not allowed to leave their house during curfew hours.
On 26 April 2019, in Kingston, Kingston, the government imposed a curfew in Denham Town neighborhood until 29 April 2019 at 6pm. There is no information about the reasons that justify this decision.

On 30 April 2019, in Hanover parish (coded to Lucea), a public state of emergency was declared in response to ongoing gang violence in parts of these parishes. As part of the state of emergency, a large amount of military forces were deployed in different areas.

On 30 April 2019, in Saint James parish (coded to Montego Bay), a public state of emergency was declared in response to ongoing gang violence in parts of these parishes. As part of the state of emergency, a large amount of military forces were deployed in different areas.

On 30 April 2019, in Westmoreland parish (coded to Savanna-la-Mar), a public state of emergency was declared in response to ongoing gang violence in parts of these parishes. As part of the state of emergency, a large amount of military forces were deployed in different areas.

On 7 May 2019, in Montego Bay, Saint James, the Government of Jamaica imposed a state of emergency. This parish has been the scenery of significant gang activity.
On 30 May 2019, in Spur Tree, Manchester, police seized over 1300kg of marihuana and arrested two men.
On 12 June 2019, in Kingston, Kingston, police imposed a curfew in sections of Bowens Toad and Kingston 11 until June 14. This neighbourhood has been the scenery of significant gang activity.

Around 15 June 2019 (month of), in Spanish Town, Saint Catherine, 31 members of the One Don Gang were arrested during an operation carried out by security forces and subsequently charged under the Anti-Gang Legislation.

On 24 June 2019, in Central Village, Saint Catherine, a curfew of four days was imposed. During curfew hours, people will not be allowed to be outside their homes. There is no information about the reasons that justify this decision.

On July 7, 2019, the Prime Minister declared a state of emergency for St Andrew South area for 14 days. It is the fourth region after Westmoreland, Hanover, and St James to enter into an SOE, due to violence at epidemic proportions; 94 murders in the area this year, up from 79 last year. The PM says gangs and guns are the main cause of death in the country. The SOE is expected to delay traffic.
On 31 July 2019, near Morant Point, Saint Thomas, police forces seized nearly 1200kg of cocaine worth USD 1.5B.
On 31 July 2019, near Morant Bay, Saint Thomas, police seized nearly 1,200 kilograms of cocaine about 60 miles from the port. The street value is more than USD 35,000,000.
On 12 August 2019, in Salt River, Clarendon, police seized a tonne of marihuana on a boat, as well as over 400 litres of petrol.
On 23 August 2019, in Boscobel, Saint Mary, police discovered and seized over 3000kg of marihuana which appeared to be ready for export.

On 7 October 2019, in Kingston, Kingston, a two day curfew was imposed on an eastern part of the city in response to ongoing gun violence. Inhabitants of the region can not be outside during curfew hours.
On 7 October 2019, in Buff Bay, Portland, police held a man with over 1100kg of marihuana. The drugs have a reported street value of $12 million.
On 7 November 2019, in Kingston, Kingston, a curfew of two days was imposed in the Saint Andrew South area. A state of emergency is still in effect in this area due to the ongoing gun violence.
On 2 December 2019, in Portmore, Saint Catherine, a curfew was imposed for two days in Waterford following a killing that occurred in that area.

On 2 December 2019, in Kingston, Kingston, the government imposed a curfew in the sections of the Mountain View neighborhood from 2 December at 6pm until 4 December at 6pm. There is no information about the reasons that justify this decision.

On 13 December 2019, in Beacon, Saint Elizabeth, police seized over 1100kg of marihuana. Two men escaped arrest.
On 13 December 2019, in Black River, Saint Elizabeth, police seized 2,500 pounds of marijuana. The drug has an estimated street value of USD 9,000,000.

On 28 December 2019, in Morant Bay, Saint Thomas, the Narcotics police seized a vessel with 2,000 pounds of marijuana and arrested five people. The drug has an estimated street value of USD 9,412,000.

On 11 January 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, a two day curfew was imposed by the government in Mountain View. The residents are not allowed to be outside during curfew hours. The reason for this restriction is unknown.

On 18 January 2020, in Central Village, Saint Catherine, a curfew was imposed by the Government for two days in parts of the town. Residents are not allowed to be outside during curfew hours. The reason for this restriction is unknown.
On 22 January 2020, off the coast of Portland Cottage in Clarendon, the Jamaica Defence Force (JDF) Coast Guard seized 1895 kilos of compressed ganja on a ship and arrested the three men on board.
On 26 January 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, a state of emergency was declared in east Kingston by the Government in response to the ongoing issue of gang violence in this part of the city.

On 29 January 2020, in Kingston, Kingston, a five day curfew was imposed by the Government in August Town. The residents are not allowed to be outside during curfew hours. The reason for this restriction is unknown.

On 30 January 2020, in Central Village, Saint Catherine, a curfew was imposed by the Government for four days in parts of the town. Residents are not allowed to be outside during curfew hours. The reason for this restriction is unknown.

On 12 February 2020, in Central Village, Saint Catherine, a curfew was imposed for two days by the Government in parts of the town. Residents are not allowed to be outside during curfew hours. The reason for this restriction is unknown.
On 24 March 2020, throughout Jamaica the ports and airports were closed to incoming persons to prevent the spread of coronavirus.

On 4 May 2020, in Spur Tree, Manchester parish, police and narcotics officers discovered nearly 4000 kilograms of marihuana, with an estimated street value of 35 million USD. The seizure is being labeled the biggest ever marihuana bust in Jamaica. Four persons were arrested.

On 4 June 2020, in Spur Tree, Manchester parish, police officers located over 1100 kg of marihuana in the bush off Alligator Pond road. The drugs has an estimated street value of over 10 million USD. Nobody was arrested in relation to the find.

Around 11 June 2020 (week of), in Kingston, a truce has been brokered between warring gangs in the Spoilers, Tel Aviv and Franklyn Town areas of the capital. The truce was agreed upon in a meeting facilitated by the local government councillor. Afterwards, gang leaders walked through the neighbourhoods together in a show of solidarity. According to the government councillor, since the truce has been brokered gun violence in these areas has dropped.

On 14 June 2020, in Kingston, a state of emergency was declared in Western and Central Kingston. The reason for the state of emergency is the increase in gang activity in these parts of the city, after a gun-sale gone wrong led to two deaths.

Around 21 June 2020, in Trelawny parish (coded to Falmouth), nearly 7000kg of marihuana was seized by police. One Haitian individual was arrested. This part of the island is a hotbed for smugglers, including criminals from Jamaica who are involved in guns-for-drugs schemes with Haitian gangs.
On 25 June 2020, in Lances Bay, Hanover, police discovered and seized nearly 1200kg of marihuana with an estimated value of over 10 million dollars. Three Bahamian individuals were arrested.
On 30 June 2020, in Orange Bay district, Portland, police discovered and seized over 1200 kg of marihuana, with an estimated value of nearly $11 million.

On 6 July 2020, in Kingston, the creation of a new special taskforce of the police for the entire country was announced. This taskforce will focus exclusively on dismantling and disrupting gang activity.

On 8 July 2020, in Kingston, the community of August Town was declared a Zone of Special Operations (ZOSO) by the government. This neighbourhood is ravaged by gang violence, declaring it a ZOSO is meant to allow police forces to combat rival gangs operating here.

On 30 July 2020, in Saint Andrew Parish (coded to August Town), a police exercise led to the arrest of 11 gang members including one of the most wanted men of the island. The man is a leading figure of the Sparta Gang which is active in Saint James.

On 4 August 2020, in Westmoreland parish, police captured a high ranking member of the Kings Valley Gang. The man was wanted for several crimes including murder and had been on Jamaica's most wanted list since 2016.
On 23 November 2020, off the coast of Alligator Pond, police intercepted a boat with nearly 1500kg of marihuana, with an estimated street value of $12 million. Five men were arrested.

On 18 December 2020, in May Pen, Clarendon, a 96 hour curfew was imposed after seven people were killed by gunmen in a 48-hour period. During the curfew, security forces hunt for the gunmen and nobody is allowed outside during curfew hours.
On 23 December 2020, in Montego Bay, Saint James, a curfew was imposed for two days in the Norwood area in response to an increase in gang violence. Residents have to stay inside during curfew hours.

On 7 January 2021, in Kingston, Kingston, a two day curfew was imposed in parts of Trench Town after tensions in that part of town rose following a number of shootings. Police also erected barricades to prevent drive-by shootings.
On 16 January 2021, in Montego Bay, Saint James, a two day curfew was imposed in the Norwood area following two fatal shootings. It was extended to remain in place until 31 January 2021.
On 17 January 2021, in Clarendon parish (coded to May Pen), a two-day curfew was imposed in parts of the parish for security reasons.
On 10 February 2021, throughout Jamaica (coded at the capital Kingston), a nation-wide curfew was imposed by the government in order to prevent the spread of the coronavirus.

On 13 February 2021, in Saint Ann's Bay, Saint Ann, unknown individuals set fire to the constituency office of the PNP. While no motive was established, the leader of the constituency believes that the act was vandalism rather than politically motivated.
On 26 February 2021, in Lionel Town, Clarendon, a two days curfew was imposed due to a flare-up in violence between two local gangs in recent days.

SOURCE: Haiti Press Network; AFP; Jamaica Observer
NOTES: Around 1 October 2021, in Kingston, Kingston, police arrested a former Colombian military officer wanted by Haitian authorities over the assassination of President Jovenel Moise. No further details of the arrest were reported.

Security measures: On 14 November 2021, in Kingston, Kingston, Prime Minister Andrew Holness announced 7 States of Emergency (SOE) in St James, Westmoreland, Hanover, St Andrew South, Kingston Western, Kingston Central and Kingston East, in order to address the spike in the murder rates in these areas. SOEs give the Government the ability to deploy both the police and the military. Police also imposed 48-hour curfews on weekends in four divisions of the Corporate Area.

Security measures: On 25 November 2021, in Fort-de-France, Fort-de-France, authorities imposed a curfew until 8 December 2021, as a response to the general strike against the health pass and the mandatory vaccination measures to prevent the spread of coronavirus.

On 25 September 2018, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, military forces took control of all local public security tasks in the Acapulco municipality arguing the infiltration of organized crime members within the state police forces. The operation also included the arrests of two police commanders and the chief of police. So far it has been reported that this measure will last indefinitely.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2012-2018) State Police
NOTES: Around 26 September 2018 (as reported), in Hidalgo de Parra, Chihuahua, State Police Officers arrested the leader of the Sinaloa Cartel in this region.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2012-2018) Federal Police
NOTES: On 28 September 2018, outside Victoria Durango, Durango, along the highway from Durango to Parral, Police arrested 29 undocumented migrants from Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador. The coyote transporting the migrants was also arrested.
On 30 September 2018, at least one thousand members of the Military Police arrived in Cancun, Quintana Roo, to strengthen security in the city.

On 2 October 2018, in Pareo municipality, Michoacan, a group of villagers built barricades on a highway to prevent members of the Secretary of the Navy from moving to the centre of the municipality of Tancitaro. These settlers allegedly sought to prevent the military convoy from disarming the local population who has been protecting themselves from organised crime. Another version states that the barricade was set to protect a leader of Los Viagras.

On 4 October 2018, in Guasave, State of Sinaloa, two unidentified attackers set fire to the Center of Technology Studies 108 facilities on the road leading to Los Angeles del Triunfo sector. No fatalities or injuries were reported.

On 12 October 2018, in San Martin de Bolanos, Jalisco, a clandestine laboratory where synthetic drugs were produced was dismantled by members of the National Defense Secretariat. 1,400 sodium hydroxide and other precursors used in the manufacture of illegal drugs were found at the site.

On 12 October 2018, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, personnel from the Navy Secretariat seized and destroyed four clandestine laboratories located in the northwest of the city, where they found approximately 1,400 litres of narcotic-like chemicals. In addition, chemical precursors, equipment, and materials used to make illegal drugs were found.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2012-2018) Federal Police
NOTES: On 14 October 2018, in Cancun, Quintana Roo, Federal Police officers seized 2,590 kilograms of methamphetamine in the loading and unloading area of the city airport.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2012-2018) Federal Police
NOTES: On 14 October 2018, in Tepic municipality, Nayarit, Federal Police officers seized around 1,400 kilos of methamphetamine found on a bus that was traveling on the Tepic-Mazatlan highway.
Around 15 October 2018 (as reported), in Tonala, Jalisco, a grave with at least 18 human bodies was found. The identities of the victims and the attackers are unknown.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2012-2018) State Police
NOTES: On 16 October 2018, in the municipality of Centro, Tabasco, the National Institute of Migration and State police rescued and place under detention 123 migrants from Central America on the highway from Villahermosa to Cardenas. 53 of them were minors.

On 19 October 2018, in Heroica Matamoros, Tamaulipas, Petronilo Moreno Flores aka ''El Panilo'', alleged leader of the Gulf Cartel and one of the most wanted criminals by the federal government, was captured by members of the Army in Fraccionamiento Paseo Residencial.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2012-2018) State Police
NOTES: On 20 October 2018, in Galeana, Nuevo Leon, rural Police officers seized a ton of illegal drugs that were hidden in bales of livestock feed inside a vehicle.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2012-2018) Ministerial Federal Police
NOTES: On 21 October 2018, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, members of the Criminal Investigation Agency of the Attorney General's Office seized 83 barrels with approximately three tons of chemical precursors used for the production of illegal drugs in Colonia Valle de San Carlos.

Around 22 October 2018 (month of), in Lagos de Moreno municipality (Jalisco), the authorities found a mass grave with 16 male and 3 female bodies, together with 2 skulls. The authorities said the people had been killed around 4 months ago. The identity of the bodies, and the motive and perpetrators behind the killings are still unknown.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2012-2018) State Police
NOTES: On 23 October 2018, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, the leader of the Cartel del Noreste in the state, was captured in a joint operation carried out by the state authorities in Nuevo Leon and Tamaulipas.

Around 23 October 2018 (as reported), the police forces safely defused 3 homemade explosive devices placed by unidentified armed actors in San Angel neighbourhood (Alvaro Obregon, Ciudad de Mexico). One of the devices was activated previous to the arrival of the police, but did not detonate properly, only creating a small fire.

On 3 November 2018, in Tlaltempanapa, Zitlala, Guerrero, 70 people were displaced from their community by the Los Ardillos gang, that threatened to kill them if they stayed in their land. They found shelter in Copalillo.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Refugees/IDPs (El Salvador); Refugees/IDPs (Guatemala); Refugees/IDPs (Honduras); Civilians (El Salvador); Civilians (Honduras)
ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 2 November 2020, in Coatzacoalcos, Veracruz, elements of the National Guard and personnel from the National Migration Institute rescued and arrested and 151 migrants from Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador who were transported in a box in a truck. Two people were arrested.

On 3 November 2020, in Talpa de Allende municipality, Jalisco, elements of the military forces found 46 marijuana plantations and destroyed 772 thousand plants of cannabis sativa in poblados San Andres and Zapotan.

On 3 November 2020, in Hermosillo, Sonora, a fragmentation grenade was found under a bridge in Bulevar Enrique Mazon Lopez and guarded by elements of the military who confirmed that the grenade was handmade. No injuries reported.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard; Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: On 3 November 2020, in Periban de Ramos, Michoacan, a narco laboratory was found and dismantled by the military, the national guard and the state police. Nine reactors used for the manufacture of the synthetic narcotic known as crystal together with chemicals and other tools were seized.
Around 5 November 2020 (as reported), in La Calera de Capirato, Sinaloa, military forces located a synthetic drug laboratory.

Around 6 November 2020 (as reported), in the municipality of Salvador Escalante, Michoacan, military forces located a synthetic drug laboratory near Las Charandas Hill [coded to Santa Clara del Cobre].

On 6 November 2020, in Los Aldamas, Nuevo Leon, a PEMEX truck shot and burned in front of the pantheon. Nothing is known about the drivers of the vehicle. A painted message was left next to the vehicle by an organized crime group.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: Around 6 November 2020 (as reported), in El Carrizal, Sinaloa, State and military police seized just over three tons of crystal behind a pantheon. Several packages of cocaine, opium gum and fentanyl were also found.

On 7 November 2020, in the municipality of Salvador Escalante, Michoacan, armed individuals burned at least two vehicles to block the exit to the community of Ario. Several vehicles were also burned on the roads to Zirahuaen and Opopeo. The event is allegedly related to the clashes between criminal groups [coded to Santa Clara del Cobre].

On 7 November 2020, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, an undetermined number of armed individuals stopped a city bus covering the Coloso-Costera route and after pulling the driver down, the vehicle was doused with gasoline and set on fire. No injuries were reported.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard
NOTES: On 8 November 2020, in Benito Juarez, Nuevo Leon, National Guard and police forces discovered a mortar grenade in front of a house in Colonia Los Arcos.

On 8 November 2020, in the municipality of Salvador Escalante, Michoacan, for the third day in a row, a cargo vehicle was taken and burned after being crossed on a road in what seems to be a narco road block. The event is allegedly related to gang rivalry. [coded to Santa Clara del Cobre]

On 10 November 2020, near Pueblo Viejo, Michoacan, at least 40 to 50 members of Los Viagras gang forced 65 families from La Cuchilla to flee and leave their houses as they took over the town. No fatalities or injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard
NOTES: On 11 November 2020, in Lagos de Moreno municipality, Jalisco, elements of the National Guard seized chemical precursors for the production of synthetic drugs and an arsenal of different calibres in a Ranch in Comunidad Comanja de Corona.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard
NOTES: On 11 November 2020, in Saltillo municipality, Coahuila, elements of the National Guard seized around 1 ton of marijuana that was transported in a vehicle on the Saltillo-Torreon highway near ejido Puebla.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard
NOTES: On 12 November 2020, in Santa Maria Jalapa del Marques, Oaxaca, elements of the National Guard and the military arrested 25 migrants from Guatemala when they were travelling in a vehicle around Colonia Guadalupe.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: On 12 November 2020, in Guadalupe y Calvo, Chihuahua, the state police found and destroyed a poppy plantation with 16 875 plants in the place known as Tahunitas.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
NOTES: On 12 November 2020, in Cosala municipality, Sinaloa, elements of the military forces found and dismantled two clandestine laboratories for the manufacture of drugs in Milpillas and Palo Dulce. Meanwhile, elements of the Federal Ministerial Police and the Federal Public Ministry seized more than three tons of methamphetamine hydrochloride used for the production of drugs in poblado Mezcaltitan.

On 12 November 2020, near Santiago Tangamandapio, Tangamandapio municipality, Michoacan, officers of the Public Security (SSP) and National Defense (SEDENA) destroyed a marijuana plantation near the road between Tarecuato to Cirio communities.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Federal Police
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: On 12 November 2020, in El Carrizal Numero Dos, Sinaloa, federal and state security forces seized chemical precursors for the manufacture of methamphetamine. In addition, two vehicles, a refrigerator, containers and a centrifuge were secured.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard
NOTES: On 13 November 2020, in Alcholoya, Hidalgo, elements of the National Guard dismantled a clandestine laboratory for the manufacture of drugs. Five people were arrested including one person for carrying a firearm for the exclusive use of the armed forces.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: On 14 November 2020, in Guadalupe y Calvo, Chihuahua, elements of the state police destroyed a poppy plantation in a gap that connects Rancho de Santo Nino with the municipal seat.

NOTES: On 15 November 2020, in Puebla municipality, Puebla (coded to Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza), the National Guard arrested 39 migrants from El Salvador, Honduras and Guatemala when travelling in a vehicle on the Mexico-Puebla highway. The two drivers were arrested.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
NOTES: On 15 November 2020, in El Carrizal, Sinaloa, Elements of the Attorney General's Office located a building that was used as a narco-laboratory. The police forces seized chemical precursors, two vehicles, a refrigerator, containers and centrifuges.

On 16 November 2020, in Ecatepec de Morelos, Mexico, 42 Guatemalan immigrants and 2 immigrants from El Salvador were arrested by the police in Colonia Granjas Valle de Guadalupe. Four of the arrested persons were minors.

On 16 November 2020, between Tepalcatepec and Coalcoman, Michoacan, armed individuals used backhoes to lift the asphalt and create a ditch on the Coalcoman-Tepalcatepac road. According to the report, this is the first time this type of narco-road-blocks has been carried out. Apparently the roadblock was carried out by CU members to prevent the advance of CJNG in the region controlled by them.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: Around 16 November 2020 (as reported), between Madera and Gomez Farias, Chihuahua, Military forces and state police located two narco-camps. Two men were arrested.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: Around 17 November 2020 (as reported), in the municipality of Salvador Escalante, Michoacan (coded to Santa Clara del Cobre), in an operation carried out in several locations within the municipality, the Michoacan Police and the State Attorney General's Office located a narco-camp. Six people were also arrested and 24 vehicles and firearms were secured.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 18 November 2020, in Las Choapas, Veracruz, the police arrested 27 migrants from Cuba, Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, El Salvador and Ecuador. This arrest was part of a security operation carried out in the state where a total of 244 migrants and 13 people were arrested.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 18 November 2020, in Rio Blanco, Veracruz, the police arrested 66 migrants from Cuba, Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, El Salvador and Ecuador. This arrest was part of a security operation carried out in the state where a total of 244 migrants and 13 people were arrested.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 18 November 2020, in Minatitlan municipality, Veracruz, the state police arrested 105 migrants from Guatemala on the road of Minatitlan-Cordoba highway. Two people were arrested. This event is part of a police operation in different locations in the state where a total of 244 migrants and 13 people were arrested.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
NOTES: On 19 November 2020, in Tequila, Jalisco, elements of the Federal Ministerial Police found and destroyed a marijuana plantation in the area known as ''La Majada''. Approximately 7,200 cannabis sativa (marijuana) plants were destroyed.

On 19 November 2020, in Tepalcatepec, Michoacan, members of the Tepalcatepec Communal Militia blocked the roads to the city centre to prevent a new raid from members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel. This cartel attempted to take this municipality on November 18.

On 20 November 2020, around San Juan de los Platanos, Michoacan, armed men took over a dairy products company truck and set it on fire to block the Buenavista-Apatzingan highway. The state police and Military forces were patrolling the area in localidad Ordenitas when armed men ran away after seeing them.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Civilians (Honduras); Refugees/IDPs (Honduras); Refugees/IDPs (Guatemala); Civilians (El Salvador); Refugees/IDPs (El Salvador)
NOTES: On 20 November 2020, in China, Nuevo Leon, police officers arrested 71 migrants from Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador who were travelling in a trailer. The driver was arrested.
Around 21 November 2020 (as reported), in El Salto, Jalisco, 113 bodies were found in a mass grave.
On 23 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Tlalpan, the police found and secured a grenade in Colonia Pedregal de San Nicolas. No injuries or fatalities reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: On 24 November 2020, in Tequila, Jalisco, the state police found and destroyed a marijuana plantation, in the Potrero de Los Rivera Delegation.

On 24 November 2020, in Hermosillo, Sonora, armed men in cars were shooting in Colonia Villa Guadalupe during the day. Four vehicles and one property had gunshots. No fatalities or injuries were reported.

On 24 November 2020, in Santa Maria Ixtulco, Tlaxcala, armed men entered and looted the house of the municipal president. The armed men took over objects and 16 cellphones of municipal workers. The municipal president and municipal workers were preparing the annual report. No injuries or fatalities were reported.
On 25 November 2020, in Ciudad de Armeria, Colima, three vehicles and an empty house were set on fire. There were no fatalities or injuries reported.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 25 November 2020, in Cosoleacaque, Veracruz, the house of the General Secretary of the Single Union of Electrical Workers of the Mexican Republic (SUTERM) was shot during the night. He was not in the house. No fatalities or injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
NOTES: On 26 November 2020, in El Hongo, Baja California, elements of the Regional Prosecutor's Office of Tecate and the State Investigation Agency arrested 98 migrants. They also arrested three people and seized some drugs. The nationalities of the migrants are unknown.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: On 26 November 2020, in Sanalona, Sinaloa, State and military police found a synthetic drug laboratory. Several tanks, pots, fans, boilers and drums with chemicals were located.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: On 27 November 2020, in Charo, Michoacan, State police forces located and destroyed a marihuana crop of more than 1000 plants on the road going to la Cofradia. 30kg of marihuana were also seized in the operation.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
NOTES: On 27 November 2020, in Tijuana, Baja California, elements of the Federal Ministerial Police (PFM) found a drug Laboratory and secured methamphetamines in a place located between Tecate-Tijuana highway.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard
NOTES: On 30 November 2020, between Tamazulapam and Huajuapan de Leon, Oaxaca, the National Guard arrested 57 migrants from El Salvador and Honduras when they were traveling in two trucks on the Oaxaca-Cuacnopalan highway. The two drivers were also arrested.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: CRSJ-PCP: Regional Coordinator of Security and Justice-Citizen and Popular Police; Indigenous Group (Mexico)
NOTES: On 2 December 2020, in Ahuacatlan, Guerrero, the town of Ahuacatlan formalized its adherence to the Regional Security and Justice Coordinator of the Citizen and Popular Police (CRSJ-PCP). Dozens of Policias comunitarios mainly from indigenous communities marched to commemorate the act.
Around 3 December 2020 (as reported), in Zihuatanejo, Guerrero, at least four armed men fired with gasoline a public transportation bus in Colonia Infonavit La Parota. No injuries were reported.

On 4 December 2020, in Santa Ana Amatlan, Michoacan, alleged members of a criminal group blocked the Apatzingan-Buenavista highway with burning van. The roadblock happened after the police released another roadblock on the Aguililla-Apatzingan road.

On 4 December 2020, in the municipality of Apatzingan, Michoacan (coded to Chandio), alleged members of a criminal group blocked the Apatzingan-Aguililla highway with burning vehicles. A roadblock was reported in Chandio and another in Los Hornos.
On 5 December 2020, in Ciudad General Escobedo, Nuevo Leon, 66 immigrants were arrested by the police inside a house in Colonia La Unidad.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
NOTES: On 7 December 2020, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, elements of the Federal Ministerial Police (PFM) found a drug Laboratory and secured chemical precursors in Colonia Independencia.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
NOTES: On 7 December 2020, in Ciudad Juarez, Chihuahua, military forces and elements of the Attorney General's Office located inside an abandoned truck 1312 kilograms of marijuana, 3996 kilograms of fentanyl, 65 kilograms of crystal and 5994 kilograms of cocaine. The truck was in Colonia Tierra y Libertad.

On 7 December 2020, in the municipality of Tepalcatepec, Michoacan, inhabitants of Pinolapa blocked the Pinolapa-Puerto de las Cruces roads to prevent more than 40 CJNG armed people from passing through.

On 7 December 2020, in Acambaro municipality, Guanajuato, organizations of relatives of victims of forced disappearance and officers of the State Commission for the Search of Disappeared People found human remains inside 78 plastic bags in at least 14 clandestine graves in Rio Blanco community. Some of the bodies were dismembered.

On 10 December 2020, in Victoria municipality, Tamaulipas, armed individuals stopped a truck transporting avocadoes, forced the driver out and set fire to the truck on the highway from Ciudad Victoria to Matamoros close to Jimenez.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 11 December 2020, in Agua Dulce, Veracruz, state police officers arrested 31 migrants from Honduras, Guatemala, and Cuba.

On 11 December 2020, in Tulum, Quintana Roo, a man set fire to a hotel with no reported injuries or property damage. The perpetrator was accompanied by a man and a woman. The incident was recorded and circulated on social networks.

Around 13 December 2020 (as reported), near Ciudad del Carmen, Campeche, Military Forces of Mexico seized an illegal airstrip used for drug trafficking located between Ciudad del Carmen, Palizada, Campeche and Jonuta. 350 kilograms of cocaine were seized.

SOURCE: Hoy Tamaulipas; El Blog del Narco
NOTES: On 15 December 2020, around Chandio, Michoacan, armed individuals of the Nueva Familia Michoacana cartel carried out various road blockades on the Apatzingan-Aguililla and the Apatzingan-Buenavista roads to prevent the authorities from advancing. The blockades were carried out with at least five vehicles and at least one of them was burned.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
NOTES: On 16 December 2020, in Etzatlan municipality, Jalisco, elements of the military and ministerial police officers found and secure a laboratory were drugs were made in poblado Puerta de Pericos.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 18 December 2020, in Coatzacoalcos, Veracruz, armed men threw Molotov bombs at a vehicle in Colonia Maria de la Piedad. The vehicle burned and was destroyed. Besides, the armed men shot at a particular house, although this information is yet to be confirmed. No fatalities or injuries reported.

On 19 December 2020, near Chandio, Michoacan, the Apatzingan-Aguililla highway was blocked with a vehicle. According to the authorities, these actions are made by organized crime to prevent police officers to move around the area.

On 19 December 2020, in Cuautepec de Hinojosa municipality, Hidalgo, a warehouse where stolen fuel from PEMEX was stored was set on fire in comunidad San Lorenzo. According to the report, the event occurred in one of the areas with the highest rates of hydrocarbon traffic. On December 18, armed clashes were reported, suggesting this might have been an arson.
Around 21 December 2020 (as reported), in Tlajomulco de Zuniga, Jalisco, a mass grave with at least 16 bodies was discovered in Colonia Ojo de Agua.

On 22 December 2020, in Cortazar municipality, Guanajuato, the road to Canada de Caracheo community was blocked with burning vehicles, as part of the gang armed clash and arrests in Celaya registered on the same day.

On 22 December 2020, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, armed men shot at a car that was being repaired and seemingly belonged to police forces in Colonia Progreso. In the area, another seven vehicles were crippled with bullets. Three people were arrested in Playa Manzanillo.
On 23 December 2020, in Acambaro, Guanajuato, 104 bags with human remains were found in a mass grave.
Around 23 December 2020 (as reported), in San Jose de Guaymas, Sonora, a mass grave with between 8 and 10 burnt bodies was found.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 23 December 2020, in Coatzacoalcos, Veracruz, a roast chicken store and a motorcycle used for delivery was set on fire by armed men with a molotov bomb in Colonia Adolfo Lopez Mateos.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: On 23 December 2020, in Ciudad del Carmen, Campeche, Military, and state police forces discovered a grenade and defused it without incident in Colonia Obrera. The grenade was unlocked and was located in front of a house.

On 26 December 2020, in the municipality of Santa Maria del Oro, Jalisco, Military Forces found a synthetic drug lab. About 13 tons of synthetic drugs and 14,000 litres of chemical precursors were seized and destroyed. A small camp was also located.

SOURCE: El Blog del Narco; Pagina 24 Jalisco
NOTES: On 27 December 2020, near Jilotlan de los Dolores, Jalisco, the military forces found and destroyed a drug laboratory and a narco-camp in Santa Maria del Oro municipality. It belonged to the Jalisco New Generation Cartel with 13 tons of drugs and more than 14 thousand litres of precursors.
On 27 December 2020, in Patzcuaro municipality, Michoacan, the municipal police found and destroyed a camp used by the organized crime based in two caves and a hut in Santa Juana Community.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 28 December 2020, in Las Choapas, Veracruz, the state police arrested 32 migrants when they were on their way to the US. Two drivers were arrested.

ADMIN1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
NOTES: On 28 December 2020, in Agua Dulce municipality, Veracruz, the police arrested 115 migrants from Belize, Cuba, Guatemala, Honduras, El Salvador, Nicaragua and India when they were on their way to the US on the Coatzacoalcos-Villahermosa highway. Two drivers were arrested.

On 28 December 2020, in the state of Puebla (coded to Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza), the governor imposed a curfew to prevent the spread of coronavirus until 25 January 2021. Among other measures, the closing of non-essential businesses was imposed.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard
NOTES: On 30 December 2020, in Madero municipality, Michoacan (coded to Villa Madero), the National Guard found and destroyed about 17,500 marijuana plants in poblado Los Ojos de Agua.

NOTES: On 30 December 2020, in San Pablo Guila, Oaxaca, state police officers and the National Guard found and destroyed a marijuana plantation of approximately one ton.

On 1 January 2021, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, during the early morning hours, armed individuals destroyed about 50 public video surveillance cameras located in different parts of the city. According to the report the armed individuals belonged to the Sinaloa Cartel.

On 4 January 2021, in Cadereyta Jimenez, Nuevo Leon, in the early morning, a man threw a Molotov cocktail towards a car that was in the garage of a house located in Colonia Jose Luis Lozano. The event was recorded by a security camera and no injuries were reported.

SOURCE: El Blog del Narco; El Sol de Sinaloa
NOTES: On 4 January 2021, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, in the early morning hours, armed men in several vans shot at the urban surveillance cameras on Alvaro Obregon Avenue. On social networks there are videos of the event. The armed individuals appeared to be members of Los Chapitos Gang. No injuries were reported.

SOURCE: La Jornada; AFN - Tijuana; Zeta Tijuana
NOTES: Around 4 January 2021 (as reported), in Tijuana, Baja California, a mass grave with 13 bodies was found in Colonia ejido Maclovio Rojas. The grave was apparently used by the CJNG.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard; Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police; Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
NOTES: On 6 January 2021, in Petatlan municipality, Guerrero, the military, the National Guard and ministerial and state police officers found and dismantled a drug laboratory in poblado La Ceiba.

On 6 January 2021, in Morelia, Michoacan, a group of armed men presented themselves on social networks as a new self-defense group to end the violence in the area. The group is called Panuelos Negros. The police have confirmed its creation.

On 8 January 2021, in the municipality of Tecamachalco, Puebla, a group of 20 to 30 armed people presented themselves on social networks as a new self-defense group to end the violence in the area. The group is called United Citizens for Tecamachalco ('Ciudadanos Unidos por Tecamachalco').

On 8 January 2021, in Tecamachalco, Puebla, dozens of hooded men, with short and long weapons, presented themselves on social networks as a self-defense group to counter insecurity that prevails in that area of Puebla. The news were shared on social media.
On 8 January 2021, in the municipality of Salvador Escalante, Michoacan (coded to Santa Clara del Cobre), 3 narco-camps were located. Weapons and drugs were seized and 21 people were arrested.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former Government of Mexico (2018-); PAN: National Action Party
NOTES: On 9 January 2021, in Tanquian de Escobedo, San Luis Potosi, the van of a former PAN deputy was burned down in the early morning. The incident is believed to be related to the selection of PAN candidates for the next elections. The van owner has allegedly been pressured to support a candidate, other that the person is has been supporting. No injuries were reported.

On 13 January 2021, in Ortiz, Sonora, a mass grave with at least 10 bodies were found. The human remains were mainly found burned.

NOTES: Around 15 January 2021 (week of), in the municipality of Suchiate, Chiapas (coded to Ciudad Hidalgo), hundreds of National Guard and military personnel were deployed to the border area to reinforce security ahead of the arrival of a caravan of about 6,000 migrants from Guatemala.

On 16 January 2021, in Zacatepec de Hidalgo, Morelos, during the early morning hours two hooded individuals burned a funeral hearse with gasoline in Colonia Centro. No injuries were reported.

On 17 January 2021, in Aguililla, Michoacan, residents announced the creation of a so-called self-defense group that will defend itself against the Carteles Unidos. The event was recorded on video and shared on social media. Some authorities raised concerns about the resurgence of communal militias, often sponsored by organized crime groups.

NOTES: On 17 January 2021, in the municipality of Los Ramones, Nuevo Leon, state police officers arrested 64 migrants from Honduras, El Salvador, Guatemala and Nicaragua. The migrants were found in an abandoned restaurant.

Security measures: On 30 March 2020, in Curacao (coded to Willemstad), throughout Curacao a curfew was imposed to stop the spread of coronavirus.

On 22 November 2021, in Coast of Willemstad, police arrested 33 irregular migrants, including 11 women, who were in a vessel in the territorial waters of Curacao. Several exotic animals were seized during the operation.

On September 24, 2019, in Philipsburg, the Council of Ministers has dissolved Parliament and called for new elections, which would make it the ninth parliament in the country_ nine years of independence.

On 30 March 2020, throughout Sint Maarten a curfew was imposed to stop the spread of coronavirus.
On 16 March 2020, the island of Saba (Caribbean Netherlands) banned entry via the airport and seaports to prevent the spread of coronavirus.
On 20 June 2018, paramilitary forces of the Government of Nicaragua mobilized and seized some roads in the country after attacks on cities such as Esteli.
On 20 June 2018, paramilitary forces of the Government of Nicaragua mobilized and seized some roads in the country after attacks on cities such as Masaya.
On 20 June 2018, paramilitary forces of the Government of Nicaragua mobilized and seized some roads in the country after attacks on cities such as Jinotepe.
On 12 December 2018, the offices of a local NGO working on human rights protections were assaulted and looted by the police. Among the objects the police left in the office is a new military uniform.

On 14 December 2018, the Nicaraguan police raided the offices of a journalist in Managua who is critical of the government of president Daniel Ortega. The policemen took all the work equipment of the television programs and a newspaper that operated out of those offices.
On 28 December 2018, a regional tv station was closed in Matagalpa; the television channel transmitted across several municipalities. Since its closure, they have been broadcasting from Facebook.

On 7 January 2019, in Ticuantepe, Managua, Police Forces of Nicaragua seized the house of Sandinista Renovation Movement MRS leader Dora Maria Tellez, without a court order. According to the source, the operation is part of a repression strategy against those who oppose president Ortega.

On 23 January 2019, in Leon, Leon, unidentified men broke into the facilities of a radio station, stole the energy plant and destroyed some equipment. Radio Dario, the station attacked, has been the target of previous threats and attacks by the police.

On 24 Jan 2019, in Managua, due to the presence of a delegation from the European Parliament in the city, the Nicaraguan government deployed police officers to the main streets and avenues of Managua. The security presence was intended to prevent public anti-government demonstrations.

On Jan 30 2019, relatives of a journalist in exile suffered an attack in Managua when paramilitaries threw Molotov cocktails inside a house, causing damage to one of the vehicles. The persecution against the journalist and her family began with the protests of April 2018 against the government of Daniel Ortega.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Nicaragua (2007-) Prison Guards
NOTES: As reported on 6 February 2019, in Tipitapa, Managua, in La Modelo Prison, political prisoners denounced that Police Forces of Nicaragua and Prison guards are currently arming paramilitary squads to operate in several cities of the country in order to control the population.

On Feb 7 2019, Nicaraguan authorities raided the office of a community development organization in Managua and detained two administrative staff for several hours. The occupation comes amid increasing persecution of organizations critical of the government. The authorities took legal documents, the safe box, and vehicles.

On 7 February 2019, in Managua, Police Forces of Nicaragua seized the facilities of NGO Red Local and took documents and computers without pressing any charges against the representatives of the organisation.
On 27 February 2019, in Tipitapa, Managua, the Government of Nicaragua released 51 political prisoners from La Modelo and La Esperanza prisons.

On Feb 27 2019, two pro-government individuals, who were boarding a motorcycle, threw a flaming stick, aiming at vehicles parked inside a house in Managua. These attacks have been occurring against opponents of the national government in Managua and Masaya.

On Mar 16, the Liberal Party denounced the arrest of the municipal president of the organization in San Francisco Libre by police patrols who violently removed him from his home. According to the liberal party, the leader was accused of having in his possession 'weapons' belonging to 'the peasant movement.'

On Apr 4, 2019 the Police has sent more armed men, riot police and police officers, to strengthen their controls on entry and exit to the city of Masaya, public buildings, schools and state schools, especially in the indigenous neighborhood of Monimbo. Police control increases after four in the afternoon, when members of the special forces management in Masaya are displaced [size=no report].

On July 4, 2019, a group of armed people destroyed the gate and the front of the house of a student leader in Leon. Hooded men threw kicks, rocks, and shouted that they were going to kill the leader. The student leader was released from prison by the regime on June 12.

On July 5, 2019, police of the regime and paramilitaries moved to neighborhoods of Masaya to militarize the area. The deployment was due to security reasons for a political event to be carried out by the regime. Opposition groups, like the Blue and White National Unity, called on the population to close their doors and implement a checkpoint in the area. Police forces blocked routes in Masaya.

On 30 July 2019, in Managua, Managua, anti riots police officer took control over Managua Tribunals where political prisoners are being judged. There is no information about how many officers were deployed.

On 12 September 2020, in Managua (Managua), the General Direction of Revenues embargoed Canal 12 (Channel 12) for improper tax statements. However, hidden motive might be connected to political antagonism between the visions aired at the channel and the regime of President Ortega.

On 26 September 2020, in Managua (Managua), around 30 members of the National Coalition were detained by police forces. Non-violent activity: On 13 August 2021, in Managua, Managua, police officers raided the office of the newspaper La Prensa, a day after the newspaper announced the suspension of its printed edition due to the restrictions of the government to import paper. This newspaper had been raided by police on previous occasions and this was the last newspaper that had printed edition in the country.

The manager will remain in prison for 90 days and is under investigation for alleged fraud and laundering of money, goods, and assets. The offices of this newspaper have been raided on two occasions in the last three months. The manager of this newspaper is the cousin of a presidential candidate who was arrested by the end of June. The manager is the 33rd person arrested ahead of the general Presidential elections.

Around 3 November 2021 (week of), in the department of Rio San Juan (coded to Morrito, Rio San Juan), police forces arrested five leaders of the Citizens for Freedom (CxL) opposition party throughout the week. On 6 November 2021, in Managua, Managua, police forces arrested the electoral expert and economist under Law 1055 also known as the 'Sovereignty Law' or the Special Cybercrime Law, accusing him of conspiring against the country through his publications on social media.

On 7 November 2021, in Masaya, Masaya, police officers detained two journalists who were reporting from the voting centers on the election day. The motivation of the arrest in unknown. Various acts of violence together and a number of other irregularities were recorded by the electoral observer Urnas Abiertas across the country within the context of the Nicaraguan general elections. According to the reports, examples have included armed parastatal forces surveilling polling stations, government workers being coerced to vote and required to share a picture of voting papers confirming a vote for a re-election of president Daniel Ortega, and the use of state vehicles such as ambulances in at least 118 voting centers to conduct electoral activities in support of the regime such as the transport of voters to voting stations. In other reported events in different location across the country, police forces prevented journalists from reporting on the elections.
On 7 November 2021, in Masaya, Masaya, police forces arrested an activist and opposition figure in his home for unknown reasons.

On 6 December 2021, in Masaya, Masaya, police forces raided the house of a former political prisoner from Masaya and arrested him on theft charges. The prisoner was released the same day.
