On 7 April 2018, unidentified actors set car on fire. The car belonged to a public servant for the Judicial Body working as the coordinator for the defence of victims. The events occured right outside her property in David (David, Chiriqui).
On April 4, 2019, in Cativa, Colon, a Molotov bomb was thrown at a catholic church by an individual that escaped. The police is investigating the attack.

On the week of April 4, 2019, in Pacora, Panama, Jesus Barrera Gomez a.k.a 'Meridio', an important Mexican drug lord, escaped from La Joya Prison. Barrera Gomez is required by the Southern District Court of California for drug trafficking and money laundering. 'Meridio' is linked to organizations such as Los Zetas in Mexico and others.
On 12 December 2019 in Chitre (Herrera), at the entrance to the national road of Chitre, unidentified men set three cars on fire, completely burning two of them. Motive and perpetrators unknown.

On 2 April 2020, a 15-day sex-segregated quarantine took effect in Panama as a measure against the spread of the coronavirus. Women can leave their homes on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, while men can leave their houses on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays and no one can leave their houses on Sundays and with specific provisions for the elderly, the sick and the disabled citizens of the country. Businesses are closed for thirty days. On 1 April 2020, a transgender woman was detained by police officers for going out on a 'women's day'.

SOURCE: La Estrella de Panama (Panama); El Siglo (Panama); La Prensa (Panama); GardaWorld
NOTES: Security measures: On 5 April 2021, in Panama City, Panama, the government ordered absolute curfew from 10pm to 5am as part of coronavirus related measures. On 17 April the government lifted quarantine for Changuinola and Bocas del Toro. On 19 April, the national curfew was softened and established from 12am to 4am. On 28 June 2021, the government ordered absolute curfew on Sundays. On 11 July, the curfew on Sunday was extended. Night curfew was established for Colon from 10pm to 4am. In Las Tablas, Los Santos, Chitre and Herrera, the curfew is from 8pm to 4am. In Chiriqui, the night curfew is from 12am to 4am. On 29 September 2021, the government announced that curfews will be lifted on 4 October 2021 in the provinces of Cocle, Herrera, Los Santos, Veraguas; in the districts of Changuinola (Boca del Toros province) and those of Alanje, Boqueron, Bugaba, David, Dolega, Gualaca, Remedios, Renacimiento, San Felix, San Lorenzo, Tierras Altas and Tole in Chiriqui province. Curfews will be lifted also in the districts of Chagres, Omar Torrijos and Portobelo in the province of Colon; Pinogana and Santa Fe in the Darien province; San Miguelito and the Metropolitan Region of Panama City in Panama Province and in the district of Capira, La Chorrera and Arrajian in the Panama Oeste Province.

On 1 December 2021, in the department of Panama (coded to Panama City, Panama), police forces arrested drug-traffickers and public officials involved in a criminal organization that served as a support in Panama for the Colombian gang Gulf Clan. The operation nicknamed 'Fisher' involved the arrest of 57 individuals including nine public officials across the provinces of Panama, Panama Oeste and Colon. The operation also included the seizure of 10 million US dollars in cash found in a residence in Colon.

On 23 March 2018, a group of around 1000 people who say they're part of the ''Sin Tierras'' Group (farmers), took over land of the 'Cuartel Victoria', they have been settled there for a while have security, water supplies amongst other goods which they say are donations. The police hasn't intervened.
Elections/referendum: On August 14th, under a context of ongoing protests the newly elected president Mario Abdo Benitez took over his role as president of Paraguay.

Property destruction: On 25 November 2018, on 25th, in between the departments of San Pedro and Amambay, the Ejercito del Pueblo Paraguay (EPP) attacked a residence called La Suiza. Shooting, damaging the property and leaving flyers. No one was living in the residence.

On April 21, 2019, armed men wearing camouflage uniforms broke into a private business and set on fire several vehicles and objects. The event was registered 75 km from the city of Concepcion in the Concepcion department in Paraguay. On a video published online on May 7, the ACA declared responsibility on the events.

On August 22, 2019, a group of 15 armed men attacked and set on fire several types of machinery in a private property located in the rural area of Mbuyapey, Paraguari. Land-owners claimed the attack was performed by a group of farmers, version denied by the counterpart. No casualties/injuries reported.

On 16 October 2019, in the rural area of Curuguaty, Canindeyu, a group of at least eight armed men set on fire the vehicles of a private farm. The men killed some of the cattle and burned the sown fields. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

On 8 November 2019, in Filadelfia (Boqueron), an armed group broke into a property, destroyed the houses with a chainsaw, and then burned them. The perpetrators and the motivation for the property destruction is unknown.

On 30 December 2019, in Capiata (Central), the car of the president of the Lawyer's School of Capita was burned by a man. The victim also reported that three days before someone tried to break into his office and those actions might be linked to two important cases that he has.

On 29 February 2020, in Tacuati (San Pedro), a tractor was burned in a farm located in the area of influence of EPP (Paraguayan People's Army). Perpetrators and motivations are unknown, but the investigators believed that it might have been led by other farmers due to the conflicts between them.

On 21 March 2020, in Antequera (San Pedro), self-convened residents tried to block the trucks that enter the city everyday, towards the port. The main goal of this measure was to prevent the spread of coronavirus, that was considered pandemic by the World Health Organization.

ACTOR1: San Pedro de Ycuamandiyu Communal Militia (Paraguay)
NOTES: On 21 March 2020, in San Pedro de Ycuamandiyu (San Pedro), self-convened residents blocked route PY-11 in order to control the entry of vehicles in the city. The main goal of this measure was to prevent the spread of coronavirus, that was considered pandemic by the World Health Organization.

On 9 May 2020, in Pedro Juan Caballero (Amambay), allegedly four EPP (Paraguayan People's Army) members with camouflaged uniforms and hooded faces burned the main house, a bulldozer, two tractors and a pickup truck in Jaguary farm. Before leaving, the armed men left pamphlets alluding to the EPP. No injuries were reported.

On 27 June 2020, in Capiata (Central), a car that was inside the property of the manager of the Eleventh Sanitary Region was attacked with a petrol bomb by two hooded people. The attack took place during the coronavirus pandemic and the motivation of the crime is unknown.

Around 21 September 2020 (as reported), in Amambay department, it was reported to the Paraguayan Indigenous Institute (Indi) and the D.A. Office that men of the Pai Tavytera guarani indigenous group were being forced to work in marijuana plantations by drug traffickers in Amambay's department.

On 11 November 2020, in Mariano Roque Alonso (Central state), two unidentified suspects threw a Molotov bomb against the vehicle of a municipal councilor, located outside his residence in the San Carlos neighbourhood. No one was injured and the car was empty at the moment of the attack. The incendiary attack followed a number of protests against municipal authorities over embezzlement and fraud.

Property destruction: On 27 January 2021, in the rural area of San Alfredo (Concepcion), around eight armed people wearing camouflage uniforms attacked Jose'i farm, set fire to a tractor, a truck, and part of the farm's building structure. Farm workers were detained for around six hours. The motivation of the crime and its perpetrators are unknown.

On 28 January 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), the president of the Authentic Radical Liberal Party (PLRA) was preemptively arrested for falsification of invoices during the 2018's presidential election. He was a presidential candidate in that election. PLRA members considered him a political prisoner, blaming the President Mario Abdo, former President Horacio Cartes and the State Attorney General of conspiracy. The PLRA is one of the main parties of the country.

Property destruction: On 23 February 2021, in Pedro Juan Caballero (Amambay), a petrol bomb was thrown by unknown person or people in the house of a woman who announced days earlier her pre-candidacy (no party informed) for Mayor. The petrol bomb burned part of a car. Relatives of the candidate consider the possibility that the attack's order came from another politician.

Weapons seizure: On 24 March 2021, in Salto del Guaira (Canindeyu), a commercial activity dedicated to the sale of weapons was raided by police officers. Officers intervened on suspicion that the business supplied arms to the Paraguayan People's Army (EPP) criminal group.

Property destruction: On 28 March 2021, around Arroyito municipality (Concepcion), around 20 armed people went to estancia San Jorge area, entered a farm, handcuffed a worker, set the place on fire, shot at the transformer and the water tank, killed two cows and injured another two as a means to send a message to its owner to pay his employees' salary on time and to slaughter cows to provide meat to his workers and the communities near the farm. It is believed that this action was a trial for new members of the Armed Peasant Association (ACA).

Property destruction: On 16 April 2021, in Capitan Bado (Amambay), a group shot at the San Miguel Medical Clinic in the early morning hours, when it was closed, breaking its glass doors. The perpetrators and their motivations are unknown.

Property destruction: Around 18 April 2021, in the rural area of Horqueta (Concepcion), near Yvyraty and Belen Cue localities, three armed members of the Armed Peasant Association (ACA), in uniform and with their faces covered, attacked Reunidas farm, setting fire to the main house as a reprisal for the farm's owner failure to comply with an agreement with the ACA. It was also reported that the perpetrators requested workers to take their belongings because they were aiming to damage only the farmer's.

Property destruction: On 22 April 2021, in Paso Barreto (Concepcion), two armed members of the Armed Peasant Association (ACA), including its leader, attacked Diamante farm by shooting a cow, two horses, a transformer and two water tanks. Perpetrators chatted about politics and social issues with a farm worker and his wife, besides listing several demands to the farm's owner before fleeing.

Property destruction: On 25 April 2021, in Paso Barreto (Concepcion), armed individuals with shotguns and rifles handcuffed an agricultural worker, set fire to Nu Apu'a farm and killed sheeps. The group was looking for the overseer and the police believe this event was related to cattle rustling. The worker was slightly beaten, but he was not injured.

Property destruction: On 25 April 2021, in Loreto (Concepcion), members of the Armed Peasant Association (ACA) shot around the Kurusu Nu police station and set fire to a police's motorcycle and a regular pickup truck.

Property destruction: On 4 May 2021, in Alto Vera (Itapua), an unidentified person or group set fire to a wooden bridge and left an obituary that said 'We prefer having no bridge than having a bridge like that amid the elections, total shame'.

Property destruction: On 4 June 2021, in Asuncion (Asuncion), a backhoe was set on fire by unidentified individuals, in the early hours, to prevent the demolition of the Cerro Cora club's stadium. Neighbors and the club's supporters were dissatisfied with this measure and were accusing the Paraguayan Football Association (APF) of allowing the auction and destruction of the field. Perpetrators were unknown.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: ANR-PC: National Republican Association - Colorado Party
NOTES: Property destruction: On 8 June 2021, in San Pedro de Ycuamandiyu (San Pedro), the farm of an ANR party congressman was attacked by unidentified armed individuals. The perpetrators cut the wire fences, the electric currents, killed two dogs and thus released the cattle, but did not take anything. According to the victim, the attack could have had the political purpose of intimidating his family, since the crime took place during the election campaign period.

Property destruction: On 18 June 2021, in Paso Barreto (Concepcion), at least four members of the Armed Peasant Association (ACA), who were armed and wearing camouflage uniforms, set fire to Machuca Cue farm and shot to the air. Nobody got injured.

Property destruction: On 22 June 2021, in Quiindy (Paraguari), unknown people entered the Municipality and intentionally set fire to machinery, such as a backhoe shovel, also affecting a dump truck and a minibus. Even though the crime's motivation was unknown, City Councilors claimed that this machinery was scheduled to be inspected in the following week, under an investigation into the municipal patrimonial resource's management. The damage was believed to be more than PYG 550 million.

Property destruction: On 13 July 2021, in Puentesino municipality (Concepcion), three members of the Armed Peasant Association (ACA) took as hostage three contractors who were working with machinery in Nathalie farm, and burned the equipment. No one was injured and the contractors were released after an hour.

Property destruction: On 31 July 2021, in the rural area of Itacurubi del Rosario (San Pedro), three hooded armed men attacked a farmer in Frieslan neighborhood, tied him up, took his pickup truck, and set fire to it in a road. The motivation of the crime and its perpetrators are unknown. There have been several attacks against farmers in San Pedro department by armed groups who target farms.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: ANR-PC: National Republican Association - Colorado Party; Government of Paraguay (2013-); Farmers (Paraguay)

The group stole food and shot a pig to death. They did not injury the workers, ordering them to leave. The Mayor had required improvement in the area's security after the ACA attack against police officers on 3 August 2021.

Property destruction: On 21 August 2021, in Curuguaty (Canindeyu), at least 100 armed peasants broke into Pindo Cattle, made 13 security workers who were guarding it as hostages, robbed all their belongings, took their cars, and set fire to the property. The group made security workers leave after that. The motivation of the crime and its perpetrators are unknown.

Property destruction: On 5 September 2021, in the rural area of San Alfredo (Concepcion), around 11 armed people wearing camouflage uniforms attacked Jose'i farm and set fire to a tractor. The same farm had been previously attacked in January 2021. The motivation of the crime and its perpetrators are unknown.

Property destruction: On 18 September 2021, around Itacua municipality (Concepcion), armed members of the Armed Peasant Association (ACA) broke into Tres Ollas farm, in the Itapucumi zone, detained the workers, shot against the power transformer, set fire to the main house, and stole food. It was reported that the group asked for the farm's owner and questioned the workers about their salaries. The fire was only able to burn one bedroom.

Property destruction: On 24 October 2021, in Caazapa (Caazapa), a man shot against the house of a lawyer in the Padre Adolfo Zaracho settlement, broke its windows, and threw a homemade explosive artifact inside it, causing a small fire. The lawyer's work was believed to be the perpetrator's motivation. A minor was later arrested for this crime.

Property destruction: On 4 December 2021, in the rural area of Tacuati (San Pedro), around 10 hooded and armed men robbed a farm and its workers in the Santa Clara neighborhood, damaged the tires of three motorcycles, made employees slaughter two cows, and took them to boats near the Ypane river, where the group crossed to the Nueva Fortuna settlement. There is no information about perpetrators nor crime motivation, but there is the presence of the EPP in the department.

ACTOR1: PCP: Communist Party of Peru - Shining Path
NOTES: On 14 November 2018, an important leader of the Shining Path was arrested by police forces in Ayacucho. The leader previously took part in several clashes with the Military forces.

ACTOR2: PCP: Communist Party of Peru - Shining Path
NOTES: On July 12 2019, in Churcampa, Huancavelica, the captain of the military command of PCP (Sendero Luminoso) was arrested by a joint effort between Police forces and the military.

On September 30 2019, in Lima - Lima District, Lima Province, the Peruvian president Martin Vizcarra dissolved the Congress as a last recourse to force new parliamentary elections, which had been repeatedly blocked by the opposition-controlled legislature. The president argued that Congress was going against the citizens will and trying to protect their own. In response, lawmakers suspended the president for 12 months and nominated the vice president as head of state.

On 16 October 2019, in Santo Tomas, Cusco, the Peruvian government declared an emergency state for 30 days in Supreme Decree N169-2019-PCM in the Corredor Vial Apurimac-Cusco-Arequipa, including 500 meters of each side of the highway, that includes the districts of Ccapacmarca, Colquemarca, Chamaca and Velille in Chumbivilcas in Cusco region. The main reason of this decision was to maintain control with Military Forces with Police forces on this sector. The decree also suspends the right of reunion and inviolability of residence.
On 5 November 2019, in Tumbes, authorities arrested the former governor of Tumbes and 8 of his aids. The former governor was arrested under charges of corruption.

On 24 January 2020, in El Alto, Piura, the house of a female merchant that had denounced irregularities in overprices against the mayor of El Alto was attacked by unknown assailants who threw Molotov bombs in Barrio Verde. There were only material damages. She had received life threats before because of her complaints

On 28 March 2020, in Lima district, Lima, the congress signed a Law of Police Protection, that would exempt military and police forces to enforce the national quarantine lockdown implementation against the coronavirus from spreading. The law would allow Military and Police officers to use weapons to enforce the quarantine.

On 29 March 2020, in Piura city, a journalists and his 2 brothers were arrested by police forces while he was in his house. Police Forces assaulted the journalist and took him to the police station. on the claims they were breaking the quarantine. He was later released.The journalist later claimed there was abuse from the authorities, in the terms on the new law that exempts police and military officers from criminal responsibility during the coronavirus pandemic.

On 9 November 2020, in Lima-Lima District, Lima Province, Congress members approved the removal of President Martin Vizcarra (no party) during an impeachment vote. Vizcarra was ousted on allegations of moral incapacity, following a decision that found him guilty of corruption charges during his time as governor of Moquegua region, in 2011-2014. The removal of Vizcarra was approved with the majority votes of Congress. The swearing-in of the next in line of sucession, Manuel Merino (AP party), is expected to take place on 10 November 2020.

On 10 November 2020, in Lima-Lima District, Lima Province, Manuel Arturo Merino de Lama, from the Popular Action party (AP), was sworn in as the President of Peru. His inauguration took place after the Congress approved the removal of President Martin Vizcarra (no party) during an impeachment vote, on allegations of moral incapacity and corruption charges.

Non-violent activity: On 15 November 2020, in Lima-Lima District, Lima Province, Manuel Arturo Merino de Lama, from the Popular Action party (AP), resigned from his position as President of Peru. The action followed violent demonstrations against his government, after two young men were killed during demonstrations in Lima, on 14 November. Merino was in power for only five days, after the Congress approved the removal of President Martin Vizcarra (no party) during an impeachment vote.

Non-violent activity: On 17 November 2020, in Lima-Lima District, Lima Province, Francisco Rafael Sagasti Hochhausler, from the Purple party (Partido Morado), was sworn in as the President of Peru. His inauguration took place after Manuel Merino resigned from his position after only five days in power following a political crisis in the country.
On 15 December 2020, Huancayo, Junin, more than 50 presumed land invaders burned down small houses in Unas sector, forcing residents to flee the sector.

On 26 January 2021, in Tumbes city, there was the deployment of 54 tanks and 1,200 soldiers to the border with Ecuador, to prevent undocumented immigrants from entering Peru during the coronavirus pandemic. Most of the immigrants are from Venezuelan nationality.

On 26 January 2021, near Suyo municipality, Piura, police forces arrested 74 Venezuelan migrants in El Recodo sector, while they were trying to enter Peru from Ecuador through an illegal pass in Calvas river. Police forces have been patrolling the border to prevent illegal crossings from migrants.

Other: On 28 July 2021, in Lima - Lima District, Lima Province, Jose Pedro Castillo Terrones, of Free Peru (PL) political party, was sworn in as the President of Peru in the Congress building. His presidency ends the one-year interim government of the Purple Party.
Around 18 January 2018 (as reported), near San Juan, (San Juan), the Los Menores gang was dismantled by the police. The gang was dedicated to drug trafficking. No fatalities reported.

On 29 June 2018, in San Juan (San Juan), the police arrested 50 members of the La Familia gang during an operation in the Figueroa neighborhood in Santurce. The police estimated about 97 people to be members and claimed that this gang was dedicated to drug trafficking.

On July 13, 2019, the Center for Investigative Journalism in San Juan published the complete 889 pages of text from an encrypted group chat where the Governor and 12 male members of his administration share information and make unofficial agreements, as well as talk unfavorably of other officials, politicians, journalists, and sharing jokes and insults, which sources call obscene, sexist, and homophobic. Dubbed 'ChatGate' or 'RickyLeaks', this is putting pressure on the governor, with protesters demanding his resignation. Some contents from the chat started leaking earlier in the week, July 10 or 11.

On July 24, 2019, at 23:30, in San Juan, the governor of Puerto Rico published a video message declaring his resignation, effective as of August 2, 2019. He is the first Puerto Rican governor to resign before his term was over.

On August 2, 2019, in San Juan, the governor resigned after a political scandal and mass protests. His successor was sworn in. It had been unclear who would be the successor, and they are still waiting for approval by the Senate.
August 7, 2019, in San Juan, a new governor was sworn in, the country_ third governor in a week, and the second ever woman governor, previously Secretary of Justice.

This comes following Maduro's inauguration as president for a second term on Jan 10, 2019, following a presidential election that was largely boycotted by the opposition and which has been criticized by the opposition as illegitimate.
