On Mar 15, 200 people were arrested in the week of March 15, in the Anzoateguistate, for protesting against the lack of water and electricity. 118 people were deprived of their liberty and another 82 were taken with precautionary measures.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) SEBIN: Bolivarian Intelligence Service
NOTES: On Mar 21, officials of the Bolivarian National Intelligence Service arrested the head of the office of the president in charge of Venezuela, Juan Guaido, and leader of the political party Voluntad Popular in Las Mercedes, Miranda state.

On Mar 21, a deputy of the National Assembly claimed that he was detained for more than three hours along with 12 parliamentarians in the Bolivar state near El Callao. The reasons for the arrest are unknown.

On March 21 2019, in Urena, Tachira state, the regime of President Nicolas Maduro blocked the bridge that connects the Colombian city of Cucuta with the Venezuelan city of Urena with 15 containers. Containers were full of sand and debris. The regime took this measure after the opposition leader Juan Guaido led the operation to allow international humanitarian aid to enter to Venezuela via Colombia.

On Mar 23, two Russian air force planes landed at Venezuela_ main airport in Maiquetia, Vargas state, carrying a Russian chief of staff, nearly 100 troops, and 35 tonnes of material. According to Russia, these flights are part of defense contracts between Venezuela and Russia.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: PSUV: United Socialist Party of Venezuela
NOTES: On March 29 2019, the first vice president of the United Socialist Party of Venezuela led the first training of the armed groups that the regime ordered in response to the events convened by opposition leaders. From the Yaracuy state, the first vice president of the United Socialist Party of Venezuela showed a video in which civilians, with covered faces, are manipulating weapons as part of a military civic exercise.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: VP: Popular Will; Government of Venezuela (1999-) National Assembly
NOTES: On Apr 2, Venezuelan lawmakers stripped opposition leader and president of the National Assembly Juan Guaido's immunity and authorized the high court to prosecute him for proclaiming himself country's ruler.

On April 3 2019, it is reported that a pro-government group caused damage to the facade of the headquarters of the Democratic Action party in Cumana, Sucre state. The group of people carried big hammers to destroy the walls.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On April 6 2019, the National Guard arrested 33 people for protesting in San Timoteo, Zulia state. The court accuses them of the offenses of the use of explosive devices, assault, obstruction of public roads and attack against officials.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On Apr 6, in Maracaibo, Zulia state, two deputies were detained by members of the Bolivarian National Guard, violating parliamentary immunity. The deputies were arrested when they were supporting the civic demonstrations against the regime and the failures in the public services, which worsened after the frequent blackouts that occurred in March.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
NOTES: On April 10 2019, in Guanta, Anzoategui state, officers of the Special Forces (FAES) took over the headquarters of a cement production plant. It is reported that the take was directed to arrest workers of the company. Five workers were arrested. No further specifications.

On April 25 2019, in Tucupita, Delta Amacuro, a group of unknown people set fire to a health center. The center was robbed in 2016 and it was a place that the ministry of health used as a deposit. No further information.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On April 30 2019, a group of forty officials of the National Guard revolted and joined the president of the National Assembly to demand that the regime's officials leave power. The uprising was announced in La Carlota, airport and military base, next to the Altamira distributor, Chacao municipality in Caracas.

On April 30, 2019, in Caracas, the National Telecommunications Commission blocked one radio station, one cable service, and three VT channels. The radio station, cable service, and channels blockade were Radio Caracas Radio, DirecTV, CNN International, and BBC World. The motive of the blocked was the transmission of the uprising of military officers against the regime of President Nicolas Maduro and the attack of National Guard (GNB) officers toward protesters.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) SEBIN: Bolivarian Intelligence Service
NOTES: On May 1 2019, the home of an opposition leader of the Voluntad Popular party was raided and robbed by members of the Bolivarian National Intelligence Service. This raid occurred after he was released from house arrest on April 30 and went to the streets to protest against the regime. The leader is now at the Spain Embassy in Caracas.

On May 7 2019, three deputies from the National Assembly sought asylum at embassies in Caracas. These deputies requested asylum after the Supreme Court of Justice accused them of treason, conspiracy, instigation to insurrection, civil rebellion, conspiracy to commit a crime, misappropriation of functions, and public instigation to the disobedience of the laws.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) SEBIN: Bolivarian Intelligence Service
NOTES: On May 8 2019, officials of the Bolivarian National Intelligence Service detained the first vice president of the National Assembly in La Florida, municipality of Libertador in Caracas. The vice president of the National Assembly was leaving the headquarters of the political party, Accion Democratica when the arrest took place. Theregime accuses the vice president of the National Assembly of being involved in an attempted uprising on April 30.

On May 11 2019, an explosive device was placed in front of the house of a leader in Higuerote, Brion municipality, in the Barlovento region of Miranda state. The explosive was not detonated. The opposition leader reported that the subjects moved in a vehicle and police officers did nothing. This event is attributed to groups of armed civilians, affected by the regime, known as colectivos. The Free Venezuela Broad Front accused the regime of this act.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) DGCIM: Directorate General of Military Counterintelligence
NOTES: On 19 May 2019, officers of the military counter-intelligence DCGIM intervened the military base Eskamoto in Santa Elena de Uairen. According to reports, the officers arrested some military officers who were planning an uprising and one of them escaped.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) SEBIN: Bolivarian Intelligence Service
NOTES: On 19 May 2019, officers of the intelligence service SEBIN de-activated an explosive device that according to official information was found in Chacao, Caracas. The officers blocked the roads to avoid the presence of the civilian during the operation.

On May 28 2019, residents of the Naguanagua municipality reported the presence of military troops as well as war tanks in the vicinity of Cerro El Cafe. The area was restricted. Apparently, the tanks began arriving in the area from Tuesday, May 28. There is no information about the reasons for this activity.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On May 28 2019, officials of the Bolivarian National Guard mobilized and militarized the surroundings of the National Assembly building, in the center of Caracas, preventing the entry of the media. However, they have allowed the passage of the deputies. After a military uprising on April 30, the measures to hinder the passage to the National Assembly have been recurrent. In addition, the Supreme Court of Justice has raided the parliamentary immunity of 14 deputies.

On June 1 2019, members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) threatened Venezuelan producers in the Udon Paez parish of the Catatumbo municipality of Zulia. ELN members gathered the owners and employees of the farms and told them that they had three minutes to vacate their farms. Those threatened immediately abandoned their production units and the farms were left to the ELN. Due to the conflict between the irregular groups over the control of the Venezuelan territory for the handling and trafficking of cocaine, the producers have had to leave about 350 hectares of land.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On June 1 2019, officials of the Regional Anti-Drug Intelligence Unit of the Bolivarian National Guard (GNB) of Tachira state detained the head of the National Land Institute of the State of Tachira for the alleged involvement in drug trafficking in the area. It was reported the detainee had participated directly, taking advantage of the political position to transport drugs.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) DGCIM: Directorate General of Military Counterintelligence
NOTES: On June 6 2019, in an operation involving officials of the General Directorate of Military Counterintelligence (DGCIM), a former councilor and leader of the Primero Justicia party was arrested in El Callao, Bolivar State. According to reports, the arrest could be due to a conflict in the mining sector El Peru, where the leader resides. In the sector, there have been protests by gold workers and it is presumed, that the leader participated in these protests.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Venezuela (1999-) National Assembly; VP: Popular Will
NOTES: On June 16 2019, security forces related to the political regime followed and besieged several vehicles of a caravan in which was the president of the National Assembly and his wife. They were returning to Caracas after completing a tour of the state of Merida. As reported by the press team of the president of the National Assembly, three vehicles and a motorcycle, followed the caravan and even surrounded it with the aim of drivers to lose control. Also, it was reported that the security intelligence forces made photographs and videos of the cars that were participating in the caravan.

ACTOR1: FPLN: Patriotic Forces of National Liberation
NOTES: Reported on June 17 2019, the Venezuelan pro-government irregular armies have begun to train civilians in armed combat. The Patriotic Forces of National Liberation (FPLN) are training civilians in exercises of military training in the Venezuelan state of Apure, the border with Colombia. The FPLN have long contested the territory of Apure with Colombian guerrilla groups, especially with the National Liberation Army (ELN).

On June 18 2019, eight soldiers were arrested in the 32nd Brigade in Maturin, Monagas state after an attempted military uprising. The soldiers planned on arresting some civil and military authorities in the state. One of the authorities that soldiers were planning to arrest was the governor of the state.

On 22 June 2019, from Boca de Grita, Tachira state, around 1,000 Venezuelan citizens were displaced to Colombia via Puerto Santander. The displacement originated from strong rumors of armed clashes in Tachira state. Venezuelan migrants entered Colombia at night, once the border was closed on the Venezuelan side. Among the migrants, there were several families with children and adolescents.

On June 24 2019, a plane with a group of Russian military technicians arrived at Maiquetia, La Guaira. It was reported that the military arrived to offer maintenance of some armament and equipments supplied in prior years to the Venezuelan regime.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On July 7 2019, a group of officials of the National Armed Forces, the National Guard, and the Coast Guard were deployed at the maritime coast in Sucre State. The mobilization took place after the murder of three soldiers in the area at the hands of unidentified armed individuals.
On August 3 2019, police and military officials were deployed on the border with Colombia to control armed groups in the area.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On August 4 2019, the president, Nicolas Maduro, ordered the incorporation of a group of militiamen to the Bolivarian National Guard to join in security and defense work.

On August 08 2019, in La Parada, San Antonio del Tachira, Tachira state, there was a military deployment. The regime of President Nicolas Maduro announced that this deployment is important given the siege of the United States near the border and in air and sea areas under the jurisdiction of the neighboring country. Eight tanks, 36 vehicles for deployment, four convoys with foot troops, a helicopter, 56 motorcycles, 12 war tanks, along with some 3,500 troops, participated in the deployment. The activity included mock tactics of combat and about 300 individuals who were trained and armed by the regime were also present.

On August 9 2019, members of the armed forces were deployed on the Tienditas international bridge, Tachira state at the border to Colombia, to protect the security of the area. An admiral of the Bolivarian Armed Forces reported that the operation intends to find paramilitary groups involved with the smuggling of gasoline and drug trafficking. It is also reported that, so far, 20 paramilitaries, who were wearing Colombian Army uniforms, have been arrested.

Between August 9 and 11 2019, members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) took territories near San Antonio del Tachira, Tachira state, to establish a camp. It is reported that members of the group moved trucks, motorcycles, mats, tents, and communication equipment. It is also reported that ELN members control and patrol the area and force the inhabitants to enter their homes at 8 p.m.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
NOTES: On August 13 2019, it is reported that military forces and Special Forces (FAES) officers have seized 3,000 kilograms of drug and arrested forty-nine paramilitaries in the border with Colombia in Tachira state. It is reported that military and police forces will remain in the area given that armed groups have threatened the population.

As reported on August 19 2019, in Machiques de Perija y Jesus Semprum, Zulia state, in the last three days military and police officials have disabled 14 clandestine runways for drug trafficking. It is reported that the operations also extend to other states such as Falcon and Lara.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) SEBIN: Bolivarian Intelligence Service
NOTES: On August 20 2019, in Caracas, officials of the Anti-explosive Directorate of the Bolivarian National Intelligence Service (SEBIN) withdrew an explosive inside the National Assembly building. It is reported that Assembly workers were evicted. There are no specifications on the explosive device.

Around 21 August 2019 (as reported), in areas such as Apartaderos, La Mulera, el paramo de Salado Negro, and Lomas Bajas, closed to San Antonio del Tachira, Tachira state, members of the National Liberation Army of Colombia established their headquarters. Residents of the area informed that they control the area and there are no longer military checkpoints or police patrols.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On August 21 2019, in El Manteco, Barquisimeto, Lara state, about 400 Special Forces (FAES) officials and National Guard (GNB) officers evicted informal traders. It is reported that the operation was intended to seize illegal material such as weapons and drugs. It is reported that police and military officials arrested 29 people. Three kilos of drugs, five weapons, 5 million bolivars in cash were seized.

On August 23 2019, in Carupano and Rio Caribe, Sucre state, 350 military officers were deployed following a message about a planned massacre in the city streets. It is reported that, on social media, information circulated that the gang 'El Tren' were planning a possible massacre in Carupano. No further details.

On August 24 2019, in Manzanares, Baruta municipality in Caracas, a group of officials of the Criminal Investigation Corps (CICPC) searched a house where allegedly arms were kept. It is reported that these arms were going to be used by military officials who rebelled against Nicolas Maduro on April 30, 2019. Neighbors rejected the arrival of officials and started to sound pans.

Between August 25 and 30 2019, in Rubio, Tachira state, a group of eighty Russians and a small group of Cubans moved to a military fort. It is reported that several helicopters have flown over the area and that the Russians and Cubans are installing radar equipment, antennas, and conducting drone training.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: On August 29 2019, in Rubio, Tachira state, it was reported that dissident members of the Colombian guerrilla group FARC are conducting censuses in schools and giving away school supplies in order to indoctrinate children in the border state with Colombia. It is reported that FARC members are using a foundation called Amigos de la Escuela to carry out the school census.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: On August 29 2019, in San Antonio del Tachira, Tachira state, it was reported that dissident members of the Colombian guerrilla group FARC are conducting censuses in schools and giving away school supplies in order to indoctrinate children in the border state with Colombia. It is reported that FARC members are using a foundation called Amigos de la Escuela to carry out the school census.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: On August 29 2019, in Urena, Tachira state, it was reported that dissident members of the Colombian guerrilla group FARC are conducting censuses in schools and giving away school supplies in order to indoctrinate children in the border state with Colombia. It is reported that FARC members are using a foundation called Amigos de la Escuela to carry out the school census.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: On August 29 2019, in Capacho Viejo, Tachira state, it was reported that dissident members of the Colombian guerrilla group FARC are conducting censuses in schools and giving away school supplies in order to indoctrinate children in the border state with Colombia. It is reported that FARC members are using a foundation called Amigos de la Escuela to carry out the school census.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: On August 29 2019, in Delicias, Tachira state, it was reported that dissident members of the Colombian guerrilla group FARC are conducting censuses in schools and giving away school supplies in order to indoctrinate children in the border state with Colombia. It is reported that FARC members are using a foundation called Amigos de la Escuela to carry out the school census.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) SEBIN: Bolivarian Intelligence Service
NOTES: Between September 2 and 3 2019, in the Urbaneja municipality, Anzoategui state, SEBIN officers raided and entered the residences of two executives of the Petroleum Corporation (CITGO) appointed by Juan Guaido. Neighbors reported that officials removed boxes from these residences and welded the doors after the search. It is also reported that the people who were wanted by the officials are outside the country.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On September 3 2019, in the Mulata-Urena sector, Tachira state, military officers seized explosives and ammunitions. Five Colombian paramilitaries were arrested.
On September 4 2019, in Paraguachon in La Guajira, 70 military officials were deployed after Nicolas Maduro announced a military deployment on the border with Colombia.

On September 4 2019, on the Roraima hill in the Gran Sabana, military officials settled in the area. It is reported that indigenous pemons met military officials, dressed as civilians, in the Roraima and that their presence may be due to mining exploration in the area. It is also reported that the military officials returned the next day.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
NOTES: On September 6 2019, in the municipality of Sucre and Libertador in Caracas, officials of the Special Forces (FAES) raided and entered the home of the Venezuelan ambassador appointed in Andorra by Juan Guaido. It is reported that officials raided two properties belonging to the designated ambassador. No further specifications.

On September 6 2019, near the border with Colombia, in the Tachira state, the Nicolas Maduro regime deployed 3,000 military personnel as part of the activation of the orange alert. It is reported that Venezuelan military officers are there due to the diplomatic and political tensions between Colombia and Venezuela.

On September 6 2019, in the Chacao municipality in Caracas, the coordinator of the international office of Juan Guaido, and member of the Popular Will (VP) party, took refuge in the Chilean embassy in Caracas. It is reported that the individual sought protection after the attorney general opened a formal investigation against Juan Guaido and his team due to the sovereignty of the Essequibo.
On September 14 2019, in Boca de Uchire, Anzoategui state, Chinese soldiers were allegedly seen. No further specifications.

On September 23 2019, in San Cristobal, Tachira state, the headquarters of two radio stations were destroyed by a group of Colectivos. It is reported that the Colectivos threatened the personnel of the radio stations.

On September 24 2019, in Maracaibo, Zulia state, there was a military deployment of 1024 soldiers headed by the governor of Zulia state. It is reported that the military deployment was done by air, sea, and land. Soldiers toured several border municipalities with Colombia.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
NOTES: On September 24 2019, in Caracas, Special Forces (FAES) officials raided the house of a deputy of the National Assembly without a warrant. It is reported that the deputy shifted sides and now is against the president Nicolas Maduro.

On September 26 2019, in Cabimas, Zulia state, unknown armed individuals aboard a motorcycle shot several times at a private clinic. According to reports, the attack could be due to gangs extorting in the area. No injuries are reported.

As reported on October 02 2019, in the Torbes municipality, Tachira state, soldiers trained and provided 1,141 rifles to 6,000 civilians. Authorities reported that the purpose of this training and armament is to defend the country and border zones. No further information.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) DGCIM: Directorate General of Military Counterintelligence
NOTES: On October 14 2019, in El Callao, Bolivar state, DGCIM officers arrested 29 artisanal miners. Relatives of the miners asked for justice since the miners were not committing any crime.

On October 18 2019, in San Felix, Ciudad Guayana, Bolivar state, police officers burned a house and three people were arrested. It is reported that neighbors saw how police officers murdered an individual in the area the previous day and then returned to burn a house. However, there are no further specifications of the death of an individual on October 17.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
NOTES: On October 25 2019, in the Limoncito sector, near Piritu, in the Falcon mountain area, Special Forces (FAES) officers found three clandestine runways and two aircraft that were being used for drug trafficking. It is reported that one aircraft is Brazilian and the other one American. No further specifications.

On October 30 2019, at the University of Carabobo, Valencia, members of the Pro-Capucha gang painted graffiti on the walls and destroyed part of the infrastructure demanding elections within the university to elect new authorities. It is reported that so far, universities have rejected the ruling of the Supreme Court of Justice to advance elections in universities. Some reports suggest that the Pro-Capucha gang is a pro-government group.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
NOTES: On November 06 2019, in San Francisco, Zulia state, officers of the Bolivarian National Police (PNB) seized 40 thousand kilos of polyethylene, which has been referred to by the national government as a strategic material. Ten people were arrested.

Between November 15 and 16 2019, in Urena, Tachira state, members of the Colectivo en Defensa de la Frontera y la Revolucion Bolivariana paraded through the city mounted on vans and motorcycles wearing balaclavas. The members of the Colectivo carried long weapons, aiming civilians with weapons, and throwing explosives in the city. The armed individuals warned the population that they would defend the regime of President Nicolas Maduro against any internal and international threat during the national protest called by the opposition leader, Juan Guaido.

Between November 15 and 16 2019, in San Antonio del Tachira, Tachira state, members of the Colectivo en Defensa de la Frontera y la Revolucion Bolivariana paraded through the city mounted on vans and motorcycles wearing balaclavas. The members of the Colectivo carried long weapons, aiming civilians with weapons, and throwing explosives in the city. The armed individuals warned the population that they would defend the regime of President Nicolas Maduro against any internal and international threat during the national protest called by the opposition leader, Juan Guaido.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
NOTES: On November 15 2019, in Barquisimeto, Lara state, tanks and vans owned by National Guard (GNB) officials, Special Action Forces (FAES) officers and Bolivarian Intelligence Service (SEBIN) officers were moved. The 10,000 military and security forces movement was made a day before the opposition leader, Juan Guaido, lead a national protest.

As reported on December 06 2019, in Tucupita, Delta Amacuro, 52 people embarked on a boat to migrate to Trinidad y Tobago. One of the migrants informed that the boat only had a capacity for 20 passengers and they have been charged in dollars to be transported to the Caribbean. Migrants, including indigenous groups, have fled from various points in Delta Amacuro to escape from hunger, the economic and social crisis.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
ACTOR2: AUC: United Self-Defence Forces of Colombia
NOTES: On December 07 2019, in the rural area of Valcerrama, Udon Perez parish, El Guayabo, Zulia state, National Guard (GNB) officials seized the camp of the United Self-Defence Forces of Colombia (AUC). GNB officials found uniforms, radios, and five packages of cocaine.

On December 08 2019, in La Guaira, Vargas state, President Nicolas Maduro swore in 3,200,000 militiamen. These militiamen have been trained and armed by the regime of President Nicolas Maduro to defend the country against any international intervention or possible internal uprising.

On December 08 2019, at the Vereda park, in Maracaibo, Zulia state, the governor and military officers swore in 281,000 militiamen. These militiamen have been trained and armed by the regime of President Nicolas Maduro to defend the country against any international intervention or possible internal uprising.

On December 09 2019, from the Panamanian embassy in Chacao municipality in Caracas, 16 soldiers, who were hiding after they revolted against the regime of President Nicolas Maduro on April 30 2019, fled the country. The location of the 16 soldiers was not revealed. One lieutenant revealed that they moved to another site as apart of a clandestine military operation that was supported by dozens of troops and commanders.

On December 10 2019, in Canaima National Park, Bolivar state, 40 Russian soldiers arrived. Residents informed that Russian military officers arrived with equipment such as satellite antennas and signal inhibitors. National authorities reported that the Russian military arrived to make a study of the airspace since Venezuela does not have the technology to face the threat posed by a deployment of American drones.

On December 10 2019, at the La Catedral Nuestra Senora del Carmen plaza in Maturin, Monagas state, the Governor of Maturin state and military officers swore in 1,200 militiamen. These militiamen have been trained and armed by the regime of President Nicolas Maduro to defend the country against any international intervention or possible internal uprising.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: PSUV: United Socialist Party of Venezuela; Government of Venezuela (1999-); Women (Venezuela)
NOTES: On December 11 2019, in La Concepcion, Jesus Enrique Lossada municipality, Zulia state, unidentified armed individuals destroyed the front of the house of a councilwoman from the United Socialist Party of Venezuela (PSUV). The councilwoman's car was burned and unknown armed individuals shot at the house. The councilor was not injured.

As reported on December 18 2019, close to the border with Colombia, in an area within the Jesus Maria Semprun municipality in Zulia state, military officers discovered and dismantled 16 laboratories of cocaine. Military officers seized and destroyed 4,079 kilos of cocaine hydrochloride, 3,694 kg of base paste and more than 24 tons of liquid and solid chemicals essential for the manufacture of cocaine.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) SEBIN: Bolivarian Intelligence Service
NOTES: On December 18 2019, in Caracas, Bolivarian Intelligence Service (SEBIN) officers entered and shut down the headquarters of a media outlet, Venepress News Agencies. While the regime accuses this media of legitimizing capital and other serious crimes, local national non-governmental organizations ask the regime to stop threatening freedom of expression. 80 media outlets have been closed since 2013 by the regime of President Nicolas Maduro.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: As reported on December 19 2019, in San Fernando de Apure, Apure state, National Guard (GNB) officers entered the headquarters of the professional organization, property of lawyers and health workers. GNB officers entered and expropriated the headquarters without a court order. 33 people were evicted. The motive of this eviction is not reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Journalists (Venezuela); Labour Group (Venezuela); VP: Popular Will
NOTES: On December 20, 2019, in La Florida neighborhood in Caracas, Special Action Forces (FAES) officers arrested a legislator of the Popular Will (VP) party. This is the third time that the legislator is arrested. A journalist and assistant of the legislator was also arrested. The motive of the arrest is not reported.

On December 29 2019, in Luepa village, Gran Sabana municipality (Bolivar), three soldiers published a video after a group of soldiers and Pemon indigenous stole 120 rifles and war materials from a military base in Canaima National Park. The soldiers mentioned that they are still in Venezuela and they are going to use these stolen arms to protect the country and indigenous groups who have been mistreated by armed groups.

Between January 8 and 10 2020, from Tachira state, 47,000 Venezuelan migrants entered Norte de Santander in Colombia. The director in charge of Migration Colombia informed that there has been an increase in migration flows. Some of the migrants cross the border to buy food and basic goods. Others are seeking to move to Colombia.

ACTOR1: Mutiny of Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-)
NOTES: On January 10 2020, in Venezuela, a group of soldiers attacked two military bases. The Prosecutor General informed that soldiers were part of a group that also attacked a military base in Bolivar state in at the beginning of January and they started a rebellion called Operacion Aurora. The soldiers were of the Pemon indigenous group.
On January 20 2020, at the Puente Internacional Simon Bolivar, San Antonio del Tachira, Tachira state, thousands of Venezuelan refugees crossed the border toward the city of Cucuta in Colombia.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) SEBIN: Bolivarian Intelligence Service
NOTES: On January 21 2020, in the Torre Zurich, Chacao municipality in Caracas, Bolivarian Intelligence Service (SEBIN) officers entered without a legal order the personal office of the opposition leader, Juan Guaido. The raided occurred while Juan Guaido was in Europe meeting political leaders. Documents were taken out of the office by SEBIN officers. Two members of the Popular Will (VP) party tried to enter the office but SEBIN officers prohibited it.

On January 22 2020, in Caracas, the non-governmental organization Rescate Venezuela, linked to the wife of the opposition leader Leopoldo Lopez, was raided by security forces. Medicines and food were taken without consent by security forces.

Between February 14 and 15, 2020, in El Cruce, Jesus Maria Semprun municipality in Zulia state, members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) stationed a truck and burned a vehicle. The ELN prohibited the pass between Venezuela and Colombia for the weekend. This event occurred during the 72-hour armed strike initiated by the ELN in Colombia and the Zulia state in Venezuela.

On March 4, 2020, in San Cristobal, Tachira state, police officers arrived at a bus station where a journalist was conducting a journalist investigation. Police officers took the journalist's identity and arrested her without motive. The National Union of Press Workers of Venezuela (SNTP) condemned the arrest.

As reported on March 4, 2020, in Urena, Tachira state, members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) established a camp and keep 24 women and more than 30 men kidnapped. 90 Venezuelans carry out surveillance work and they are paid $500,000 a week by the ELN.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
NOTES: On March 10, 2020, in Las Mercedes, Baruta municipality in Caracas, Special Action Forces (FAES) officers entered a hotel and arrested three deputies of the National Assembly. The arrest took place after a protest that was led by the opposition leader, Juan Guaido. Two deputies out of the three were later released. Days later, a tribunal charged the third deputy for financing violent activities. Germany asked the government of President Nicolas Maduro for the release of the third deputy.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On March 16, 2020, in the Panamericana highway between Los Teques and Caracas, a female journalist was threatened by National Guard (GNB) officers while she was trying to report about the first day of a preventive quarantine imposed by President Nicolas Maduro, due to the coronavirus pandemic. GNB officers also prohibited the movement of other journalists to Caracas.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On March 16, 2020, in Libertador municipality in Caracas, two female journalists were threatened by National Guard (GNB) officers while they were reporting about the first day of a preventive quarantine imposed by President Nicolas Maduro, due to the coronavirus pandemic. Another female journalist was also threatened by municipal police officers in the Catia market, Sucre parish. The officers waited until the journalists deleted the recording.

Security measures: On 16 March 2020, in Caracasa, Distrito Federal, President Nicolas Maduro imposed a nationwide quarantine to prevent the spread of the coronavirus. On 12 April 2020 the vice president signed the maintenance of coronavirus quarantine in the country for at least another 30 days.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) DGCIM: Directorate General of Military Counterintelligence
NOTES: On 22 March 2020, more than 103 local non-governmental organizations signed a petition to reject the persecution of health workers who have informed about cases of coronavirus. On 9 March 2020, in Maracaibo, Zulia state, the governor of Zulia state ordered the DGCIM to investigate the doctor and director of postgraduate medicine at the Zulia University. On April 4, 2020, in Valera, Trujillo state, police officers arrested one health worker from the University Hospital Dr. Pedro Emilio Carrillo for posting a medical order to perform coronavirus screening tests. On April 16, 2020, in Carora, Lara state, a doctor was arrested and later released by DGCIM officers and accused of hate crime after having criticized the national government via WhatsApp messaging.

As reported on April 1, 2020, in Venezuela, the regime of President Nicolas Maduro blocked the website, AlbertoNews.com. In previous days, the regime of Nicolas Maduro also blocked a website created by the opposition leader, Juan Guaido, to inform about the coronavirus in Venezuela.

On 6 April 2020, a curfew was imposed by President Nicolas Maduro from 4:00 pm to 10:00 am, starting the following day, in border areas of Tachira state. The curfew was imposed to avoid the entrance of armed groups in the country in the midst of the return of Venezuelans from Colombia due to the coronavirus outbreak.

SOURCE: Caraota Digital; El Nacional (Venezuela); La Patilla
NOTES: On 8 April 2020, in Capacho Viejo, Tachira, armed members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) threatened a nun, forcing her to give the keys of the Santa Mariana de Jesus private school. The event happened right after the mayor of the village, with deputies and military officers, asked the nun to give the school keys, as they planned to use it as a shelter for Venezuelan migrants coming from Colombia during the coronavirus pandemic.
On April 12, 2020, in Michelena, Tachira state, 300 Venezuelan refugees were put in a 14-days quarantine due to the coronavirus. The refugees returned from Colombia.

On April 12, 2020, in the Villa Olimpica in Valencia, Carabobo state, 12 Venezuelan refugees entered the country after spending 14-days in quarantine in Tachira state due to the spread of the coronavirus. The refugees returned from Colombia, Ecuador, and Peru.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On April 15, 2020, in Apure state, National Anti-Extortion and Kidnapping Command (Conas) officers entered the house of a journalist and took him away. Later, Conas officers returned to the home and threatened to enter by force to take equipment owned by the journalist. The wife of the journalist and his brother were arrested. The attack occurred after the journalist published an article regarding the lack of gasoline in the state.

On April 15, 2020, in Paraguachon, La Guajira, Zulia state, 178 Venezuelan refugees were put in a 14-days quarantine due to the coronavirus. The refugees returned from Colombia after they lost their jobs due to the spread of the coronavirus.
As reported on April 16, 2020, in Santa Elena de Uairen, Bolivar state, 910 Venezuelan refugees have returned from Brazil and spending time in quarantine due to the spread of the coronavirus.
As reported on April 16, 2020, in the Paez municipality, Apure state, around 2,000 Venezuelan refugees have returned from Colombia, Ecuador, and Peru due to the spread of the coronavirus.

On April 17, 2020, in the Villa Olimpica in Valencia, Carabobo state, more than 330 Venezuelan refugees entered the country after spending 14-days in quarantine in Tachira state due to the spread of the coronavirus. The refugees returned from Colombia.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On April 20, 2020, in the National Guard (GNB) base in Puerta Morocha, kilometer 33, Los Teques, Miranda state, a group of active and former National Guard officers tried a military uprising against President Nicolas Maduro. The group of GNB officers stole arms from the base and also tried to take the Ramo Verde prison, where several political prisoners are in. An unknown number of GNB officers were arrested.

On April 22, 2020, in Barcelona, Anzoategui state, during the lockdown implemented by the national government to stop the spread of the coronavirus, 39 Venezuelan refugees returned from Colombia, Ecuador, and Peru. The group of refugees was put in mandatory quarantine.

On 23 April 2020, in Puerto Ayacucho, Amazonas state, 21 Venezuelan refugees have returned via the Casuarito community in Colombia in the midst of the coronavirus crisis. The group of refugees is under preventive quarantine.

On April 23, 2020, in the Sports institute in Valera, Trujillo state, during the lockdown implemented by the national government to stop the spread of the coronavirus, 1,103 Venezuelan refugees returned from Colombia, Ecuador, and Peru. 90 refugees remained in mandatory quarantine since they are originally from the area.

On 24 April 2020, for two days, in Ocumare del Tuy, Miranda state, 31 Venezuelan refugees arrived from other countries in Latin America. The refugees remained in preventive quarantine to rule out the spread of the coronavirus.

Around 24 April 2020 (as reported), in San Carlos, Cojedes state, 296 Venezuelan refugees have returned from Colombia in the midst of the coronavirus crisis. 22 people, who are staying close to the Hospital Dr. Egor Nucete as a preventive measure, have been suspected of being infected by the virus.

Around 28 April 2020 (as reported), in Venezuela, the regime of President Nicolas Maduro blocked a website called Heroes de la Salud that was created by the opposition to pay 100$ per month to health workers. The American States Organization is managing the money that is going to be given to health workers for three months.
Around 28 April 2020 (as reported), in Guarenas, Miranda state, 569 Venezuelan refugees arrived after spending a preventive quarantine in Tachira state. The group of refugees arrived from Colombia.

On 28 April 2020, in the Villa Olimpica in Valencia, Carabobo state, 183 Venezuelan refugees arrived from Tachira state. The group of refugees came from various places in Latin America. Carabobo state has received 2,100 Venezuelan refugees in total.

Around 1 May 2020 (as reported), in a crossing point in Paraguachon, Guajira municipality, Zulia state, more than 300 Venezuelan refugees returned from Colombia in the midst of the coronavirus crisis. The group of refugees were put in a 14-days quarantine.

On 2 May 2020, in the 23 de Enero sector, Libertador municipality in Caracas, members of the pro-government armed group, Colectivos, conducted military exercises. Members of the Colectivos asked residents to stay at home to comply with the preventive quarantine implemented to stop the spread of the coronavirus.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-); Unidentified Armed Group (United States)
NOTES: On 4 May 2020, in Chuao, Aragua state, a group of unidentified armed individuals, including two Americans and two former Venezuelan police officers, tried to disembark. Security forces, including police forces, military forces and Colectivos, detained at least 13 people. The regime of Nicolas Maduro announced that the group of armed individuals was accused of attempting a coup d'etat. The day before, another group of armed individuals was found in Macuto, Vargas state.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On 5 May 2020, in Higuerote, Brion municipality, Miranda state, a group of National Guard (GNB) officers were moved to secure the area. The movement took place after unidentified armed individuals tried to disembark in Macuto, Vargas state and Chuao, Aragua state, as part of a plan to attack the regime of Nicolas Maduro.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) DGCIM: Directorate General of Military Counterintelligence
NOTES: Around 5 May 2020 (as reported), in Carayaca, Vargas state, a group of Directorate General of Military Counterintelligence (DGCIM) officers arrived to secure the area after an armed clash occurred on May 3 between armed individuals and security forces. On May 8, a group of 8 Russian soldiers arrived to support DGCIM officers and search for more armed individuals that are connected to a rebellion operation against the regime of President Nicolas Maduro.

On 6 May 2020, in Los Caracas, Vargas state, 213 Venezuelan migrants that were in Chile returned. Health authorities moved the group of Venezuelans to a place to start a quarantine due to the coronavirus pandemic.

On 7 May 2020, in Barquisimeto, Lara state, 90 Venezuelan migrants returned from Ecuador. Health authorities moved the group of Venezuelans to a place to start a quarantine due to the coronavirus pandemic.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces; Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) DGCIM: Directorate General of Military Counterintelligence
NOTES: On 8 May 2020, in La Colonia Tovar, Aragua state, a group of National Guard (GNB) officers, Special Action Forces (FAES) officers, CONAS officers, and Directorate General of Military Counterintelligence (DGCIM) officials arrived and entered houses looking for armed individuals that were, allegedly, planning a rebellion against the regime of President Nicolas Maduro. The movement of security forces took place after the Governor implemented a lockdown due to the arrival and arrest of armed individuals to Vargas and Aragua states. 2 people were arrested.

On 9 May 2020, in the Choro del Mono sector, Cedeno municipality, Bolivar state, military forces seized three boats with Colombian military insignia. Inside there were several guns and ammunition. The regime of President Nicolas Maduro accused the Colombian President, Ivan Duque, of helping a group of people to rebel against the Venezuelan regime. The Colombian president denied the accusation and any involvement.

On 9 May 2020, in Maiquetia, Vargas state, 210 Venezuelan migrants returned from Peru. President Nicolas Maduro informed that the group of migrants returned due to the xenophobic incidents they have experienced in Peru and because of the necessities they have due to the spread of the coronavirus.

On 11 May 2020, in Paraguachon, Zulia state, 300 Venezuelan migrants returned to Venezuela with the support of Colombian authorities. The coronavirus pandemic complicated the stay of these group of migrants in Colombia.
On 14 May 2020, in Maturin, Monagas state, 146 Venezuelan refugees returned in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic and are under quarantine in a health center.
On 23 May 2020, in Upata (Bolivar), the police arrested 112 people for not following the quarantine measures, implemented due to the coronavirus pandemic.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
NOTES: On 29 May 2020, in Caracas (Distrito Capital), a member of Juan Guaido's party (VP) and his family were detained by FAES officers. Their whereabouts is unknown.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: Around 2 June 2020 (as reported), in the south part of the Amazonas state, members of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC), National Liberation Army (ELN), and Hezbollah, established new bases to control the trafficking of gold, fuel, and drugs. A deputy and the president of the Amazonian Parliament made the announcement.

Around 15 June 2020 (month of), in the rural area of the municipality Pedro Camejo, in the Apure state, a group of nearly 60 indigenous people Jivi were internally displaced from their territories due to increasing violence from Colombian armed actors in their territories. The group informed that quarantine measures amid the coronavirus crisis increased their risk within their territories located in the lower Capanaparo River.

On 22 June 2020, in Paraguachon, Guajira municipality, Zulia state, 430 Venezuelan migrants returned to Venezuela from Barranquilla, Cartagena, and La Guajira. The group of migrants informed that they have returned to Venezuela due to the economic crises that started after the coronavirus outbreak.

On 26 June 2020, in Paraguachon, Guajira municipality, Zulia state, 280 Venezuelan migrants returned to Venezuela from Barranquilla, Cartagena, and La Guajira. The group of migrants informed that they have returned to Venezuela due to the economic crises that started after the coronavirus outbreak.

On 11 July 2020, in a rural area of Maripa, Sucre municipality, Bolivar state, 60 members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) arrived and illegally seized a small hotel. A deputy of the National Assembly informed that ELN members arrived to take control and protect mining ships in the Caura river.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: Around 26 July 2020 (as reported), in a rural area, close to the border with Colombia, Jesus Maria Semprum municipality, Zulia state, National Guard (GNB) officers found 25 laboratories and seized 9,173 kilograms of cocaine. No arrests were made.

Around 28 July 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of Casa del Padre, Tachira state, locals reported the presence of members of the National Liberation Army (ELN). Phosphorite and coltan can be found in the area, which are resources that finance ELN activitities.

Around 28 July 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of the Las Mesas, Tachira state, neighbors informed the media of the presence of groups of 20, 30, and 40 members of the National Liberation Army (ELN).

Around 28 July 2020, in San Rafael del Pinal, Fernandez Feo municipality, it was reported that there was a presence of members of the National Liberation Army (ELN). Non-governmental organizations claimed the armed group manages to secure its activities in the area in exchange of protecting residents.

Around 2 August 2020, the MUD and another 27 members of the opposition parties in Venezuela informed that they would not take part in the elections scheduled for 6 December 2020 due to high suspicion of electoral fraud. The MUD is the major coalition of political parties in Venezuela, with Juan Guaido (VP party) as its leader.

On 21 August 2020, in San Antonio del Tachira, Tachira state, around 200 Venezuelan migrants crossed the international bridge Simon Bolivar from Colombia to Venezuela. Amid the restrictions in the border between Colombia and Venezuela, Venezuelan migrants are returning due to the economic hurdles they are facing after the coronavirus outbreak.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
NOTES: On 7 September 2020, in Libertador municipality, Caracas, FAES officers arrived to the headquarters of the non-governmental organization Accion Solidaria and arrested eight members of the organization, for the irregular sale of medicines, including old medicines. The non-governmental organization works with individuals and relatives of individuals with HIV. Medicines and equipment were seized by FAES officers. Several national organizations rejected this action.

Around 15 September 2020 (as reported), in a rural area of Machiques de Perija, Zulia state, military officers seized and afterwards burnt down a plane with American registration, which was suspected of being used for drug trafficking.

On 17 October 2020, in Chaguaramas (Guarico state), security forces entered an apartment and took the Popular Will's regional coordinator in Guarico state and his two sons. One of the latter was later released, with the politician and the other son kept in custody after being judged before the First Tribunal of Judgement in Guarico.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) SEBIN: Bolivarian Intelligence Service
NOTES: Around 26 October 2020 (as reported), in Caracas (Distrito Capital state), three workers from the Spanish Embassy in Venezuela were arrested by SEBIN forces after the latter raided their respecting residences. The arrests took place after the opposition leader Leopoldo Lopez fled from the Spanish Ambassador's residence, where he was sheltering for 18 months. Workers were charged for having assisted Lopez in his departure.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) SEBIN: Bolivarian Intelligence Service
SOURCE: Caraota Digital; Diario Panorama; El Nacional (Venezuela); La Verdad de Vargas; El Pitazo; La Voz; El Carabobeno; Diario El Tiempo
NOTES: On 27 October 2020, in Caracas (Distrito Capital state), the operational coordinator of Popular Will was reported forcibly abducted, together with his neighbor and another opposition member, by SEBIN forces after the latter approached them aboard black vans without identification. Other sources indicated SEBIN forces raided the victim's residence. It was later reported that the politicians were arrested, with only the Popular Will coordinator kept in custody and judged before the Palace of Justice in Caracas. The latter was charged with the crimes of conspiracy, illicit trafficking of weapons, and financing of terrorism.

Displacement: On 19 November 2020, in San Antonio del Tachira (Tachira state), an estimate of 300 Venezuelan migrants returned to Venezuela through the Simon Bolivar international bridge with the support of Colombian authorities.

On 2 January 2021, in Puerto Ayacucho (Amazonas state), unidentified suspects set fire to an Indigenous school in the Mirabal community. It was reported the suspects also stole a number of items, such as computers and furniture. The motivation of the attack was unknown.

SOURCE: El Pitazo; Caraota Digital; El Carabobeno; Correo del Caroni; El Colombiano; El Nacional (Venezuela); La Voz
NOTES: Displacement: Around 21 March 2021 (as reported), in Paez municipality (coded to Guasdualito), Apure state, more than 5,000 Venezuelan citizens were forcibly displaced to Colombia via Arauquita. The displacement originated after heavy fighting erupted between Venezuelan military officials and members of a FARC dissident faction in the Venezuelan-Colombian border, on 21 March. Among the migrants, there were an estimate of 40 indigenous Makaguan families, sources reported.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident - 10th Front: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction (10th Front)
ACTOR2: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
NOTES: Property destruction: On 21 March 2021, Paez municipality (coded to El Amparo de Apure), Apure state, military forces destroyed nine campsites for drug trafficking, belonging to suspected members of the 10th front of the FARC dissident faction, near the waters of the Arauca river. Military operations were ongoing in the area since members of a FARC dissident faction and Venezuelan forces started clashing on that same day in the Venezuelan-Colombian border. No injuries or fatalities occurred.

SOURCE: La Verdad de Vargas; El Colombiano
NOTES: Change to armed group: Around 25 March 2021 (as reported), in Zulia state (coded to Maracaibo), suspected members of the Sinaloa Cartel and Colombian members of the National Liberation Army (ELN) joined forces to take control of drug-trafficking activity in the state. The bordering state of Apure is known for the proliferation of airport runways used for cocaine trafficking to the Caribbean and Central America.

Detonation: On 3 April 2021, in La Victoria (Apure state), four military officials were killed and eight others injured by the accidental detonation of a military explosive device in El Ripial sector. Military operations were ongoing in the area since members of a FARC dissident faction and Venezuelan forces started clashing on 21 March in the Venezuelan-Colombian border. 4 fatalities.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) FAES: Special Action Forces
NOTES: Around 14 April 2021 (as reported), in Los Teques (Miranda state), an estimate of 65 military officials and FAES forces were arrested and detained at the Ramo Verde military detention facility after they refused to be deployed to Apure state to combat Colombian dissidents. Military operations were ongoing in the area since members of a FARC dissident faction and Venezuelan forces started clashing on 21 March in the Venezuelan-Colombian border.

ACTOR1: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
SOURCE: El Pitazo; El Carabobeno; BBC News
NOTES: Around 30 May 2021 (as reported), in La Victoria area (Apure state), a ceasefire was declared between Venezuelan military forces and members of a FARC dissident faction after nearly two months and a half of armed clashes in the region. Venezuelan military officials were withdrawn from the territory thereafter. The conflict, which erupted on 21 March on the Venezuelan-Colombian border, has cost the lives of an estimate of 16 soldiers as well as the kidnapping of eight agents, who were released on 31 May. Some other agents are still missing.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) SEBIN: Bolivarian Intelligence Service
SOURCE: El Carabobeno; Diario 2001; Provea; Analitica; La Verdad de Vargas; ProtectDefenders.eu
NOTES: On 2 July 2021, in Santa Ana de Coro (Falcon state), the director of the NGO FundaREDES, together with other two other members of the organization and the director of the National Committee of Family Members of Forced Disappearance Victims(CNFVDF) , were arbitrarily arrested by SEBIN forces. The detainees were arrested by officials after the director reported to the Public Prosecutor's office widespread harassment against the NGOs. The CNFVDF director was released hours later, whilst the rest of the activists were transferred to Caracas, in Distrito Capital state. Two of the FundaREDES activists were released on 26 October 2021, while the organization's director remained imprisoned.

ACTOR2: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction
SOURCE: El Nacional (Venezuela); El Carabobeno; El Universal (Venezuela); La Patilla
NOTES: Arrests: Around 11 July 2021 (as reported), in Elorza (Apure), Venezuelan police forces arrested the presumed leader of FARC Dissident forces in the state, along with two of his lieutenants, the three of whom government officials accused of plotting to assassinate Nicolas Maduro. FARC Dissidents have been engaged in heavy fighting with Venezuelan military and police forces in the area since March 2021.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) SEBIN: Bolivarian Intelligence Service
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: VP: Popular Will; Government of Venezuela (1999-) National Assembly
SOURCE: La Verdad de Vargas; La Patilla; Caraota Digital; El Nacional (Venezuela); AFP; La Voz; Contrapunto; El Carabobeno
NOTES: On 12 July 2021, in Caracas (Distrito Capital), SEBIN police forces loyal to the Maduro regime detained a deputy of the pro-Guaido National Assembly and coordinator for the opposition Popular Will party while he was driving through the city. The government indicated the arrest was related to the operations against criminal groups in Cota 905 neighborhood, accusing the politician of terrorism and ties to both organized crime and Colombian paramilitary groups. Meanwhile, members of the opposition stated he had been 'kidnapped' or disappeared' in an extrajudicial abduction and demanded his freedom. The victim was released on 15 August, reportedly due to medical concerns, though the terms of his release remain unclear.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: VP: Popular Will; Government of Venezuela (1999-) National Assembly
NOTES: Non-violent activity: On 14 July 2021, in Caracas - Baruta (Miranda), police forces surrounded the house of the parents of Juan Guaido's chief of staff in an attempt to intimidate the Popular Will party politician. At the same time, pro-Maduro officials accused Somoza of ties to the criminal groups that fought government forces in Cota 905 neighborhood the previous week. The measure was one of many government actions against opposition politicians this week.

Land seizure: On 13 August 2021, in Machiques municipality (coded to Machiques, Zulia), armed Yukpa indigenous people took over the Casa Blanca farm. Local ranchers report the group expelled all of the farm's workers before stealing 106 animals and occupying the land for an indefinite period of time.

Land seizure: On 15 August 2021, in Machiques municipality (coded to Machiques, Zulia), armed Yukpa indigenous people took over the El Rosario farm. Local ranchers report the group expelled all of the farm's workers before stealing around 160 animals and occupying the land for an indefinite period of time.

Land seizure: On 18 August 2021, in El Tucuco (Zulia), armed Yukpa indigenous people took over Las Lilas farm in Sierra de Perija sector. Local ranchers report the group expelled the farm's workers before stealing their animals and occupying the land for an indefinite period of time.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: PSUV: United Socialist Party of Venezuela
NOTES: Looting: On 27 September 2021, in Caracas - Libertador (Distrito Capital), in the early hours a group of people, including man, women, and children, belonging to a Colectivo, invaded a building in Sabana Grande neighborhood. The assailants claimed to be PSUV supporters. They were later evicted by the police, with no reports of violence. Videos circulated on social media of invaders escaping the area with computers from the building.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: PSUV: United Socialist Party of Venezuela
NOTES: Property destruction: On 28 September 2021, in Puerto La Cruz, Anzoategui, members of a communal council, supporters of the Maduro government, broke into an apartment in the Doral Beach building claiming that the owner was not in the country. A video of the action was broadcasted on social networks.

Arrests: On 18 November 2021, in Pedernales municipality (coded to Pedernales, Delta Amacuro), police arrested the MUD campaign manager for the municipality, only three days before the nationwide elections set to take place on 21 November. Authorities state the campaign manager was arrested for possession of multiple identity cards, while opposition sources report the arrest was an arbitrary detention intended to influence the upcoming election.

Non-violent activity: On 21 November 2021, in San Francisco (Zulia), unidentified armed men on motorcycles patrolled a polling location and fired shots into the air to intimidate voters in El Callao neighborhood of Domitilia Flores parish. The identity of the perpetrators is unknown, and the event occurred around the same time as a shooting at a nearby polling place at the Eduardo Emiro Ferrer school.

Non-violent activity: On 21 November 2021, in Tachira state (coded to San Cristobal), ELN fighters patrolled near polling places close to the Colombian border and intimidated supporters of MUD candidates.

Non-violent activity: On 21 November 2021, in Seboruco municipality (coded to Seboruco, Tachira), ELN fighters patrolled at least two polling locations, closing down one of them and only allowing supporters of PSUV candidates to enter the other.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) SEBIN: Bolivarian Intelligence Service
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MUD: Democratic Unity Roundtable; Government of Venezuela (1999-)
NOTES: Arrests: On 26 November 2021, in Arzobispo Chacon municipality (coded to Canagua, Merida), SEBIN forces arrested a MUD politician who had been elected mayor of the municipality in the regional elections that took place five days prior, on 21 November. No reason was given for the arrest. He was released after 10 hours of detention.
